Very friendly service. Great bargains in drink at happy hour.

So disappointed...pho broth was just ok and they really skimped out on the beef brisket. My husband's bahn mi pork sandwich was mostly bread again with very little meat. We've had much better bahn mi and pho in Philly/NY/NJ area and were excited to try the local Vietnamese influence. Sadly did not live up to the hype.

I would definitely recommend Helzberg Diamonds. I purchased Christmas gifts for my whole family and Joanna was so helpful. She made great suggestions for what I should get for each person and showed me many options in all different price points, taught me about diamonds and different stones and even showed me under the microscope. I will be returning for all my occasions in the future and I look forward to working with Joanna again.

Overall I thought it was a great experience. Service was a bit slow, but the bartenders were doing a good job. Burgers were tasty and fresh. I would definitely recommend this place to try. I would go back for sure the next time I am in the STL.

True Mexican taqueria. True authentic Mexican Food. Muy buenos tacos, sopes y gorditas.

My family and I were at UCSB for a Softball camp and stopped at this restaurant on our way back home to San Diego. I must say, it was well worth our stop. 

As a Tijuana native, hime of street tacos, I approve this taqueria.

Since I travel so much for my job. I have he rare opportunity to eat at so many different places. I chanced on this place. Parking isn't exactly the easiest. But where in Santa Barbara is easy for parking?! This place makes that all go away. Service is outstanding. I accidentally left my CC there for a week. They remembered who I was, and had it waiting for me. This just doesn't happen in today's service related establishments. I've since taken family and friends to experience this first hand. Funny that I haven't got to the best part. Their food is off the charts. I frequent this place for breakfast while I'm working in the city. I've had lunch here a couple times. Same as B-fast. Doesn't disappoint. Highly recommend the Santa Barbara local omelette, add try-tip. A lot of food but you have to try it. I could go on and on. One last thing. One of the waiters there asked me my name after my second visit. Several weeks later, ran into him. Remembered my name. Just great food with sincere friendly service.
Great environment! The ambiance was just right to be able to talk to people across the table from you. Food was great with many options to enjoy. Large drink menu with several beer tabs.

Went into the store in Thursday morning. Immediately greeted by Gerry, the man that was working there that day. Very pleasant experience. Explained I had a budget of 1k and he worked to get my exact mattress that I wanted (was $1,800) for the outlet price of $800. The mattress was delivered the next day. Old mattress/boxspring out -- new ones in. All in less than 10 minutes. The delivery men wore shoe protectors in the house which is perfect. Received a courtesy call the day before delivery for time window and again that day of delivery and about 20 minutes before delivery. Overall great experience.

I've been here 5-6 times over the last couple years. I stay at the pear tree inn when going to Barnes Jewish so it's pretty convenient. The food is above average and I've always had great service. I do not like the signature wing sauce, it's very musterdy. But, everything else is good and the homemade marinara sauce is out of this world.
Next time I'll skip the Monte cristo and the madam....they were delicious, but the others were to die for. I should have bought more doughnuts. Next time, I'll buy so e to bring home.
Good coffee, lovely space, friendly employees and open at 7 am on a Sunday!  Couldn't have asked for more.

This is one of my favorite places to get coffee so I finally decided to come for breakfast after hearing great reviews and I was not impressed. I got the open egg sandwich with avocado and after a long wait it finally came out barely warm. The avocado, which I paid extra for, was unripe and completely inedible. The breakfast potatoes were good, but overall it was definitely not worth what I paid for it and I definitely would not get it again.

Fresh looking modern accommodations with great style. My favorite style of Marriott bar-none. Love the layout of the rooms, the desk with the privacy partition that allows for some late night work without bothering the family or simply a comfortable spot to work during the day.

Color scheme is calming, peaceful. Everything is planned out from the faucets to the drapes to be a "paring" of the style. The end result is a well coordinated modern theme with plenty of visual interest from the lobby all the way to the commode.

Now, to top it off, Lauren is just about the most friendly, accommodating person there who treats you like a "guest" rather than a "customer". Her voice actually "smiles" on the phone.

Whether I am coming to Tampa on business or to visit my daughter at USF, I stay here. Thank you for being such a great host to my travels.

Visiting from San Antonio and I had researched some places to try while in Tucson. This was THE place at the top of my list and we were not disappointed!  We visited on a Tuesday for breakfast and when we arrived it was busy. I ordered the Breakfast Sammi and it was delicious. The English muffin and eggs were perfect and the Preps potatoes are amazing!  The Smoked Salmon Beni was served perfectly. The service  was friendly an on point!  We wanted to try one of their pastries but they sold of them before we could.  This place is a 'MUST' try!!

Ordered food at noon. Waited 55 minutes for two salads. Friend ordered House Salad, when it arrived it was spring mix, red onions, cucumbers. No cheese, bacon, tomatoes, pecans. When questioned, response was "the chef changed it." Without asking the customer?? And to what....the only items we have prepped? Asked for the manager but was told she was in the kitchen.  Guess that sums it up. Obviously will never go back. 
One day later UPDATE: A marketing team member reached out to apologize and offered complementary meal as his personal guests should we want to try again. Hope this is indicative of a team trying to right the ship. Stay tuned.
Really "Pleasant" delivery people (not all but definitely the last two). Plus the last delivery was delivered 25 minutes after app claimed it had been.
This year the "Newfields" light exhibit is glorious and magical; so much more than ever before. So do yourself a big favor, buy a ticket and go! You will be happy you did and it runs through Jan.7!

This is one of the nicer and cleaner McDonalds I have been to!  They even had a couple of touch screens that allow you to order and skip the normal line.   The bathrooms and seating area is clean.  They also still have hazelnut iced coffee, which some locations have discontinued!  The only thing is that the cinnamelts we ordered for breakfast were kind of dry and not very warm. :(

Your search for comfort food ends here. Definitely a hit in the winter and sometimes the summer too! They adapt their menu often, so you never run out of new things to try.

The scallop and potato bake is an amazing appetizer, but be sure to leave room for the shrimp and grits or fried chicken plate as your entree. Service is always great so it's always an option for us when deciding where to go for dinner.

It is always nice to have a local restaurant real close to where you work! This place is in a little shopping mall which would give you a little pause on if this place is going to be the pizza restaurant experience you are looking for. However, do not be fooled, this place is a legit pizza place! Their calzones are by far the best for local faire and their "The Krewe" cheese sticks are the whole reason why I would walk through that door.

The food is good, the price is pretty cheap and it definitely beats out your local fast food pizza delivery spots. If you find yourself in Belle Chasse, come check out this funky little spot. This is the most convenient place to get your Rotolo's on!
Oysters are awesome! Rest of there Food was not that great and employees acted like they did not want to be there.  Smittys seafood down the road is 1000% better

Whenever I'm in Tucson I stay at a hotel down the road from this place and part of the reason for that is so I can have some of the best pizza I've ever had delivered right to my room. The sauce is thick with an excellent blend of spices and the cheese is generous without being too much. I always go for the pepperoncini topping because it's not offered at many places and is surprisingly delicious on top of a pie. After two years the quality has never gone down so I hope they're around for many more years to come.

Really nice coffee shop! Loved the place as soon as I walked in...

Their coffee was very nice, very balanced. They also have some pastries, though I didn't try those. 

The atmosphere is pretty chill, and the decor was nice and creative. 

There's also a cowork space adjoining the coffee shop.

Stopped by the Sun diner for a lunch as suggested by a person from the area. Walking in you will know that this place has been here awhile.  Very well worn and lived in feel. Taking a chance I, for the first time ever, ordered the chicken and waffles with sausage gravy. I was surprised by the fact that the meal was not heavy and tasted very good. The waiter was very helpful with suggestions and friendly. 
Stop by Goo Goos across the street after lunch

I loved my server, she was very good. This place has a nice atmosphere, love the decorations and the bathroom is adorable. The meal was my least favorite part. My turkey sandwhich came with fresh avocade which was good but with light sourdough. What exactly is light sourdough bread? It takes like white bread. The side salad was iceburg lettuce, which has no nutrition but I did enjoy the dressing. Last a terrible cookie that tastes as though it was made with splenda. I would probably come back here for the pastries or breakfast, but not for lunch.
The best Grouper Rueben! Great to be out by the water eating great food, having a cocktail listening to music and watching an amazing sunset. Relaxing and looking forward to going back to.

Excellent shrimp and grits but portion sizes are way too small for the price. I give 5 stars for Kevin's customer service because they were closing the kitchen and we had a few friends who were running behind that joined us right as they we closing the kitchen, they allowed us to still put the order in so they wouldn't be hungry for the night.

I've never been to a nail salon this beautiful! The decor is simple, clean and modern. The staff is very friendly and talented. You won't be disappointed. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends and family.

This is always a favorite with our family, whether driving or grabbing hot chocolate and bundling the kiddos up and walking thru...the lights & houses are always fun and festive. 

Something our family looks forward to every year!

This is a solid reliable taco and steak place which also has Sonoran style hot dogs. They have a nice fixings bar with all the guacamole you like salsas excetera. I find the quality is good the meats are well done and chopped properly. The tortillas are a fairly good quality not the best but good and they have states which are good but for the money. It's a bustling place about medium in price but I have always found them to be very reliable and very consistent.

If I could give zero stars I would. Huge disappointment. 
Terrible service all around. Front desk attendant upon my arrival was rude, couldn't find a luggage cart for me to use. I asked to be away from the elevator four times and was given a room that faced the elevator. The couch had a stain as did the walls. Could hear music and people talking from the lobby all night. I love Hilton hotels and always stay at one - this was a huge let down and I will be sure to never stay at this location again. For the price go somewhere else.

Last couple of visits food has been average at best. Food served on bare metal tray and luke warm. Mac and cheese tasty but cold. Sweet tea so sweet it leaves an after taste in your mouth. Pretty bummed as this was one of my favorite bbq places when visiting last school year.
Really good hamburgers.  Good menu with lots to choose from.  Relaxed atmosphere, good bar, great patio.  Excellent service!!
Second time coming and it won't be the last! Everything is super delicious @stephsequeirafit
Wow! What a great dining adventure! Huge rolls, good sake, good beer and HOT tea- was all awesome!

Picking up a roast and ordering meat for christmas;we decided to have a hamburger since it was late in the day and we didn't have any lunch.
Sarah made us one of the best hamburgers both of us had ever had.
So Porterhouse not only has great meats/seafood but a great deli and fresh made sandwiches.
We love Porterhouse

I stopped in and made a reservation, but I am horrified by the service I received. First of all, they took over an hour to seat us after telling us the wait was 30 minutes or so. Then, they seated us and it took over 20 minutes for a waiter to bring us water, let alone take our order. Food was far below similar restaurants (with better service). And I am disappointed.

Food is excellent!!! The grouper is ridiculously amazing!! Along with the crab cake!!!!!!! Delicious!!!! The service is not stellar and this place needs a serious update but if you want good food with a decent view... Sculleys is it!!!!

The male bartender (not sure his name) is super friendly, super knowledgeable, and... super friendly. By the looks of the place we thought it would be bad... it was seriously awesome. We got the shrimp tacos and the steak and cheese.. there are no words to describe... maybe we are just tourists and any Nola food is 10x better than what we are used to ... but it was amazing... the steak came out piping hot and each bite was like butter. The shrimp were seasoned wonderfully and just tasted awesome. This review was written only two beers in....

The Tuscan Tower rooms have always been the best in town but it appears they are in need of some renovation.  On my last visit, the reading lamp in between the two beds was flat out missing, yep, just an empty pedestal (not a good look to the room).  Immediately notified the front desk.  Also, it appears they have removed many of the decorative pillows, etc. that make the room appear more luxurious, not sure why they aren't being replaced.  Overall, the room just looks tired. The casino looks dark and dated with terrible ventilation.  Plus, what's with the double security to use your comp dollars?  Please enter your PIN and show me your ID to get a latte? Then, stand in line at the passport club desk to show your ID yet again to get your free play?  Really??!!  Ridiculous.  Have a little class Peppermill, these are your customers. You get three stars for the Terrace Lounge and a nice swimming pool.

I love this place so so so much. I came here during one of my first visits to Philadelphia and I'm so happy I ended up living down the street! Great playlists, great food, and very warm and friendly people. The owner, Blew, and her daughter are so kind and welcoming. Every time I come here I stay longer than I mean to, in the good way. Very thankful to have such an inspiring local business around. 

Other awesome things about this place:
The seating
The little library in the back
The mission and the intent of the space

Everything feels right about this spot :)

Love the revised interior very much NWO style/Parisian bistro style. It is cozy.  Conversation & cocktails were enjoyable versus TVs and sports.  Service was friendly and prompt.  Drinks, we tried several of the house cocktails of Sazarac's (repeated numerous times) & Joe Christmas were very solid.  Kudos to the mixologist - not everyone can consistently craft cocktails - at least in my extensive research.
Also various local draft beers were tried and a Bordeaux for good measure.
Apps of blackened shrimp and hominy hush puppies were tasty.  Dinner ranged from Blackened Red Fish Po'Boy served w/ Cajun chips, crab stuffed Missouri catfish to Shrimp & Grits. All were pleased with our choices and nothing remained once we were done. Dessert of Whiskey Caramel baked Alaska was shared.  All three of us agreed L'Acadiane hit all the marks on our list of solid cocktails, local beers, good wine; delectable food, great service and atmosphere that makes you want to linger.

I am embarrassed at how many times I have walked by this little boutique and haven't walked in to shop. Thank goodness, I discovered them at their outside booth during the Lafayette Holiday House tour. 

My cousin and are the family shoppers and after browsing the items at the outdoor booth, we headed up the street to check out the store. We weren't the only ones with this brilliant idea, the store was packed. After finding several gifts for different people on our Santa list, we opted to return later to make our purchases and avoid the crowd. 

Without giving away details, because a recipient may be reading this review. We found several unique and STL themed gifts for local sports fans and bar items for the boozers. We do not discriminate, we shop for the naughty and nice. 

The staff was friendly and very helpful with our selections. This little shop will now be one of my go to stores for unique gifts and I'll be shopping local. 

Will I return? - YES!

When: December 10, 2017
Why: Naughty or Nice List

Enjoyed a great brunch here on a Saturday with a friend of mine. We arrived around 9:30 AM and the dining room was full. There was a decent overflow of people waiting and I anticipated a much longer wait time than what we experienced which was about 20 minutes. This gave us time to engage in some observation of the clientele as well as the delicious breakfast items being pushed out by the kitchen. 

I loved the decor, clean, modern and welcoming! 
The breakfast menu can satisfy from savory to sweet. My friend and I shared a cinnamon roll before our main dish arrived. She had the eggs Benedict and I had a wonderful has. The food was seasoned really well, came out hot, and was ample in size for our post yoga consumption, I had to take some of my hash home. 

Overall I am for sure a fan of this place and look forward to dining on the patio when the weather is a bit warmer! 

My only criticism is for a refill of coffee they charge you .75 cents.  I don't know enough about the quality of coffee they serve but I can't imagine it's so extraordinary that you'll need to charge customers extra for a refill. Was just a tad put off by this!
Delectable açaí bowls/pita and wonderful staff. Ambience was quaint and clean; only downside was lengthy wait time for food.

Save your time and don't shop here. I went in to purchase a bedroom set for my daughter first time I went in to look and get prices then I had to go home measure and talk to my husband.. I went back and the lady who quoted me all my prices which she wrote down in detail everything she told me was off. The manager said why didn't you buy it the first time you were here then and basically told me he dosent know what to tell me so I said I was going to shop elsewhere and he said OK. I was blown away from the lack of professionalism. The furniture is cheaply made anyway. Ended up going to ashley furniture the same day, got my daughter a 5 piece bedroom set for 1,800!!!! Including mattress box spring warranty delivery mattress protector everything !! WAY BETTER quality than bobs and I saved money at Ashley's!!!!

Went for the puddin' so my review is narrowly-focused, this time around...

Prior reviewer mentioned Magnolia's in The Village (as in NYC). I have to agree, at least banana puddingwise, yes comparable. Magnolia's makes ice box cake, which we didn't see at Sweet Life, and I LOVE ice box cake... but I am also a Phulph'n, and Magnolia's ain't worth 2 hours on the Chinatown bus for pudding, when I can get some BETTER options here on South Street.

Unlike Magnolia's, Sweet Life has a variety of pudding flavors: peaches-n-cream, banana, banana caramel, salted caramel, no-nana, "magic" (like a Snickers bar), etc. And Sweet Life adds cake at the bottom, which I do not remember being in Magnolia's cups (just wafers). Bakery cake, all saturated with the pudding to make it thicker, was a really nice twist to America's idea of Jello snack cups.

Also got the potato pie, which was sweet, and spicey, and savory too. Very good!

Can't wait to try more next time!

My partner and I love PFFCU, but our last visit was absolutely exceptional.  
We are buying a house soon, but all of the online calculators and articles were conflicting. We could not get answers to our specific questions, nor get a detailed roadmap for each step we needed to take. 
We sat down with Elliot, who was so incredibly knowledgeable, and broke down the entire process for us, along with details that were specific to us. He spent plenty of time making sure we understood each aspect and the actions we would need to take. After our meeting, we left feeling much more empowered and educated. 
I can't recommend this bank enough!
Not impressive at all, I ordered turkey hummus wraps, turned out that half of my wraps barely contained any turkey! Only green and hummus. What a surprise!

Had a grilled chicken sandwich on bun to go. Couldn't hold sandwich due to bottom bun being soggy.  So I decided to just eat the meat.  I saw a piece of hair as I removed the meat. I haven't ate there in years and will not eat there again.  Zero stars from me.

The customer service was horrible. I called to place an order for pick up. The kids menu was not posted online so I asked the lady who answered for the kids menu. She proceeded to tell me that she was too busy to tell me and placed me on hold. However, she didn't realize that I could still hear her. She proceeded to complain that someone was on the phone asking her to read the entire menu and she didn't have time. I told her to cancel the order and I drove up there. When I got there and asked to speak to a manager, I discovered that the person who answered the phone was the manager. I have never experienced such rude and unprofessional customer service. RUDE RUDE RUDE!
Free beach parking if you can grab a spot. Bartenders are good and food as well. Great sunsets.

This was undoubtably the best meal I have had all year. We came in on a Friday evening around 8 PM without a reservation. There was a community table available so we sat right down. A live band was setting up and we had a front row view.

Our server Philip was extremely friendly and went out of his way throughout the night.

We started with the fried pickles which were phenomenal. Fried pickles are one of my favorite appetizers in the world of appetizers and I have had many a fried pickle in my day. These were delicious! You can tell they were made in house with a deliciously seasoned batter. Go easy on the dipping sauce though...it's spicy!!

I ordered the chicken fried chicken and it was delicious! So good. The mashed potatoes that came with it were a little spicy but still very tasty. The gravy that came on the chicken and potatoes was the best part of the entire meal. The only disappointing part of the meal were the green beans. I could tell they weren't fresh and my husband's meal came with fresh green beans. My only feedback would be to replace the green beans that come with this meal with fresh ones.

My husband had the smoked meatloaf and he loved it. It came with a mushroom gravy and he was in heaven.

The Pecan Skillet cake was highly recommended by our server and it did not disappoint. This was hands down the best dessert I have had in years. It was like a pecan pie with a cake with fresh ice cream in a cast iron skillet. It was amazing. It literally changed my life for the better and no other dessert will ever compare. I will continue to have dreams about that dessert until I have it again.

We will definitely be back next time we are in the area! We stayed for a couple of hours and watched the entire set performed by the band. It was a wonderful Friday night.

We stumbled in here on our way to the animal shelter and I'm so glad we did, this is now my new favorite place! The bartender Brittany was so helpful and informative, she is really a 10 in my book. She suggested several items on the menu and I'm so glad she did because they were amazing. Wonderful experience, great food and outstanding service, thanks Brittany and Granite City!

RIDICULOUS establishment!! I had to call corporate multiple times on a single employee think the name is Jasmine.  This young person has BY FAR THE WORST ATTITUDE EVER!!!!! Quick snapshot I am a public servant went through the drive thru to pick up my order which is NEVER an issue with any other employee I while in uniform asked can you apply emergency service employee discount? She said "WHAT" I again repeated myself same question she immediately turned her back and threw my bag of food on the counter and said I can't believe he wants a discount.  That made me be not so kind in response...my wife spoke to the manager and then called the corporate office they were going to look into it.  Fast forward about a month later went inside same location hadn't went there for a long time because of the little jerk employee she strikes me as the type that would spit in your food... anyway went in there with regular clothes on not sure if she recognized me from the month ago anyway she said "is there a reason you are looking at me?"  Again my response was not to kind as I wasn't staring or giving her any reason to say anything to me.. She just in true HOODRAT format I guess called herself challenging me! The manager while seemingly a nice guy has ZERO control over this little young employee to the degree my assessment was I have to reach a higher level to speak on this.  I know that CHICK FIL A everywhere and I have lived in many places has an extensive hiring process to include keeping Bokeefa and dem out dat spot.... through multiple interviews, ensuring no visible tattoos, no mixed hair color, assume a personality check.. Although the aforementioned person doesn't have the hair or tattoo issues the personality is indeed dysfunctional!! SO obviously they missed one!  Had to call Corporate again on the second incident they said they were sending someone to this location based upon second complaint on the same person! Again manager was a nice guy but lacked the control of the establishment! CHICK FIL A is not the cheap place to eat as such (fast food) u just expect a little better in the service department! Do better or change the staff!!! Other than that further up Roosevelt Boulevard is 100% always on point ZERO issues!!!!  Which in my opinion is the best option..... to ensure the correct location I am speaking of the TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE this was at Rising Sun Plaza at Roosevelt Boulevard and Adams Avenue! The one to go to is up by Red Lion Road!

My first visit to the area the menu by the entrance of the pier caught our eye.  My wife, son (3) and I enjoyed the service.   The mussels with white wine sauce was amazing 5 stars for sure.   The grouper blackened was well seasoned but was essentially an average dish and for the money expected a little more elegant finishing touch, like a fruity or garlic salsa / sauce.   My Tilapia was average, blackened was good but average in flavor and presentation.   I could come again but will likely try something else.   Nothing wrong with the place but nothing making me feel I need to come back.
Love this place! First time going and I will def be back. Got gel manicure and eyebrow wax. Staff was friendly, store was quiet & professional. Def a little hidden gem.

The first time I ordered from here it was solid. Matzo ball soup was good and they gave me crackers. The turkey burger wasn't that great, but edible. This time, I got the soup with a tuna sandwich. I asked for no extra mayo but got it anyway. I asked for a Dr. Pepper and got root beer, and then this time no crackers! Bummer. so yeah, I've had better experiences with delis. The tuna is pretty good though. I guess I'd order again, but wouldn't be my first choice.
This place is amazing. Staff is friendly. Food is great. Don't miss out on the chorizo and cheese empanada! Chips and guacamole are also amazing. Make sure you check in to get a free empanada.

Wow. What a great idea. I was stationed in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, for my "twilight tour" with the Navy so I am well acquainted with Poke in all its various forms (poke is fusion Hawaiian food and refers to bite-size chunks of raw, marinated fish - Ahi tuna is a favorite - or other seafood, which is tossed over rice and served with vegetables and umami-packed sauces). This place does a very good Florida version of that delicacy. Their scope is quite limited in that they only do tuna and salmon poke (come on, guys, try something exotic - like octopus, or  snapper, or albacore tuna), and their sauce is way too light to be authentic. But I am hoping as business grows, they will rise to the challenge. Just so you know, this business is located in what was once a drive-through coffee bar, so there is no seating. In fact, there's no parking - you drive up, place your order through the window, and they hand it  back to you from the window. And since their location is the intersection of Himes and Gandy, trying to enter their driveway during afternoon peak traffic hours can be challenging, to say the least. Overall, they have room for growth and improvement, but this is an excellent start, especially for south Tampa!

Groupers is definitely one of my favorite spots on the beach. My boyfriend and I come here at least twice a week. The seafood is FRESH and delicious. The staff is amazing and will always remember your name. The location is perfect and the restaurant is clean. A must try in Irb!

Always worth the wait. Filling this review out after I've gone a few times (5-6 times). Immaculate baked goods, inspiring latte combinations, creative soulful brunch food. I recommend grabbing a latte and a baked good to munch on while you wait. 

I've had few dishes I haven't loved.  I normally find it hard to narrow down the options, I normally ask the wait staff bc there always seems to be a few dishes that rise above the others. The sorghum bacon is always pretty impressive and a crowd pleaser and I've definitely ordered a few different versions of the Dutch baby. Happy brunching!

The husband had a hankering for Asian food so we decided to check out this new Thai restaurant based on the reviews. We were not disappointed. We started of with their pork & shrimp dumplings. They looked more like Shu mai which was different than what we expected but very delicious. They have 4 spice levels; mild, medium, hot, & Thai hot. They are not kidding around with how spicy their food is. Normally I order the Pad Thai the first time I visit a Thai restaurant but decided to try the spicier Garlic Beef at their medium spice level. It was delicious & perfectly spicy. The hubby got the Panang curry chicken, medium spice, & it was delicious & perfectly spiced too. The portion sizes were just right. We finished off our meal with their sweet, sticky rice with mango. OMG, it was the best I've ever had! They use the black rice & it was warm & drizzled with hot sweetened, condensed milk. The mango was perfectly ripe & there was more than 2-3 slices. We will definitely go back. The hubby wants to try something hot.
Attention Vegans - they have a separate menu of dishes just for you!

This place is cute and I enjoyed myself. The salon was beautiful and well kept, and the owner or manager desk person was a total delight and I would go back for lashes or just a pedi bc the pedi there was honestly incredible the tech had me in heaven. Also the prices were reasonable.

But the mani is just meh. I didn't really inspect my nails when I left bc I was in a hurry. It's just frustrating I can do my own nails better and paint all the way to the sides without leaving a gap. But toying with an at-home LED lamp is a pain.

So the nitty gritty: There are little bumps and bubbles. I had to pick clear and colored gel off my skin later and trim where it had pooled in cuticles with nail scissors. Several nails were filed slightly assymetrically. Also they do something called wrapping their tips with a extra layer so it's sealed under and looks kind bulbous on the nail, like thicker visibly and to the touch at the tips. 

That being said the tech was super sweet and genuinely nice. But if I went again I would just stick to a pedi or request someone else for a mani.

I eat here a lot and the food is very good.  Our server was gross last time with a dirty apron, licked her fingers and then touched the top lip of my water glass.  At least a couple of critical health violations.
Please train your servers on the health code.

When I went to pick up my pizza, I saw that the girls making the pizza were not wearing any gloves! I asked about it, and they confirmed that they don't wear gloves to make the food! Well, I went against my better judgement and still ate it after reheating it. Big mistake! After eating my Chicago style pizza, which was pretty average, I ended sick for the rest of the night. Definitely not going back here!

Mobile check-in was easy. The location is just off I40 at Donelson near BNA. The guy at the front desk was super friendly. They put me in a suite, but I did not care for it. I called down stairs
And the front desk moved me to a standard king room. Much more comfortable. About like a Hilton Garden Inn.

Tuna Bar is a new sushi digs in Old City, a relatively upscale neighborhood in a city flooded with mediocre sushi restaurants. I frequent laban's favorites, bubblefish being one of them and the last visit left something to be desired. The fork in the road left me with two options, Royal Izakaya or Tuna Bar, and boy am I glad I chose the latter.

The ambiance is on point, and the service is friendly and welcoming. The menu is curated beautifully, from my understanding they narrowed it down quite a bit from the other location. This means everything on the menu is guaranteed to be fantastic and FRESH.

We started with the steamed chicken dumplings which were light and steamed to perfection. The ginger salad followed with slices of avocado and wonderfully balanced ginger dressing that wasn't too sweet. And they even do spring mix, which was great considering romaine isn't the best these days. 

For our sushi selections we went with the classic dragon roll, the east roll, the j & j roll, and 4 pieces of the tasmanian salmon, which is a fattier cut of wild caught alaskan salmon. The fish absolutely melted in your mouth and highlighted the night beautifully. The dragon roll was crafted wonderfully and the rice on every selection seemed to highlight the delicate subtleties of genuinely fresh fish. The wasabi was even a notch above. I don't know what else I can say besides try it for yourself. The preparation of everything was so wonderfully thought out and you can tell they care about what they do here. Ken was also present and very humble about my compliments.

6/5
Always make a visit to a Delux when I'm in town.  The burgers are always amazing. The turkey celebrity burger is outstanding.

Great transportation company. Easy to work with. Prompt, polite, thorough, competitive pricing. My family has used every year and even when I have called last minute, they politely handle and if I have cancelled and not used, they still are extremely courteous. 
I've never met a bad driver either. Always early to pick up, cars are clean and water provided.

I assume this is the BP we get delivery from. Which is always amazing! I admit they are a few $$ more but in the end they are my fav. pizza delivery place. Prompt and tasty. Lunch wasn't that great. The service was good. I mean not amazing. I did ask for a second to pick a drink but it did take a few minutes. The ceaser I had was great though. While the ribs were tasty the size was tiny. Overall it was a decent lunch but I wish I had stuck to the pizza or pasta I know is always good there. It is the delivery that gives this place a 4/5 in the end!

This was without a question, one of the best sales and delivery experience I have ever received in my life. Below I will explain why I say that and how it came to be.  What I want everyone who reads this review to understand is a few simple strategies. 1) Know what you want before you go to a RV dealership; 2) Do your due diligence on choosing Make, Model, Options and the Fair Price you will pay; 3) Order the coach so you have time to sell your own if possible; 4) Don't be in a rush; 5) Have all your communication in writing and if something is missing, take responsibility that you did not prepare prior to your commitment.  
All the above is what I did.  Why, because I read every blog I can find on the subject, watch every YouTube™ video I could and listen to folks who have been RVing for decades. Every single part of my requests to Tampa RV were fulfilled prior to me even setting foot in the dealership. My sales consultant, Stephen Weaver, communication with me consistently throughout the ordering process (three months).  Everyone from the General Manager to the PDI manager called me prior to delivery.  Even the dealer sent me an email after I took delivery.  
Folks, every aspect of my sale to delivery exceeded my expectation.  Thanks to the entire staff of Tampa RV for working so closely with me.  My hopes are everyone does their research and preparation prior to even thinking about the purchase of an RV from any dealership.  Bravo to all involved.  See my addition comments below for more information.
This not my first purchase of an RV/Coach.  Prior to every transaction, I do a level of due diligence that most people can't or are simply not willing to do. In the past I have been asked to speak on the subject at national conventions, pod casts, YouTube™ reviews including my own and my personal blog on the RV Industry.  My goal is to be a advocate for clients to have a seamless and transparent transition with most RV dealers in the United States. I am called the "RV Advocate".
On to my review. When I finally choose my brand (AirStream), model (Interstate Grand Tour) and option package (Tommy Bahama) it was time to choose my dealership.  Since I had purchased an AirStream Trailer prior, I had gone through this process before.  It seems my prior dealer did not communicate some critical facts to me on my potential new purchase, so we parted ways as friends. My money, so my choice. I knew every single Airstream dealer is a five-state radius.  I had visited most of them. I was referred to Tampa RV (A member of the RVone Group) by a trusted Airstream friend. Tampa RV's reviews were not stellar to say the least, but I studied them very closely.  It became clear to me the issues, not only with Tampa RV, all RV dealerships I dealt with was "professional communication" on both the client and the dealers side.  I created a process in writing to leave "no stone un-turn" and the result was OUTSTANDING.

Went on a google/yelp search.  I had been to the Italian Market a few times and did not know that it existed.  All I can say is WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE?????   Ordered a couple of pounds of Broccoli Rabe sausage and 4 aged strips.  My sons were raised on top end places for steak and asked me to go back for their birthday dinners.... well I am on my way today to pick up a few large steaks for the Q.  NOT CHEAP - but as with most things in life you get what you pay for.  I will be standing in the snow cooking tonight!!!!!

Just pizza has really good pizza, we order from them every weekend. I order their bake potato with cheese and bacon and talking about delicious OMG. They also have awesome subs, but tonight i order a ham & cheese (only) and when we got our food everyone elses food was good but mine. My sandwich had lettuce and mayo on it (which i didn't want on it) and on one half of it, it has little pieces of ham like someone ate it and put on the bread, and one or two pieces on it. The other half had 2 big pieces of ham on it. And it wasn't even cooked. So i called them and told them about it.When the delievery guy got here he said to toss the old one, i showed it to him and he said that wasn't even cooked. And the owner is there and he will take it back to show him. So they send me out another one and this time the ham was really sliced thin like for pizza and not much on it and alot of cheese, burnt. Bread burnt. I won't be ordering anything from them anymore. They lost my busy. Since they moved to 16th Street they went down. We pay alot of money each time we order from there EVERY WEEKEND!!!!!

A happy and satisfying out-of-the-blue discovery today. That's an understatement...more like "Blown away!" Biggest, tastiest (and not greasy, at all) deluxe gyro I've had in St Louis, and I've been eating gyros for nearly 30 years...

p.s. The orzo salad was a gem too :)
Karina tended to our order and the quality of the products are extraordinary and so fresh!! Such an amazing quality fudge and such great customer service.

Our first experience at a Vietnamese restaurant and it was amazing. 

You can taste the freshness of the noodles, the vegetables and the meat. 

We are sold and will be back again.

Stunning atmosphere, great live music, friendly, knowledgeable service, great wine selection, and amazing charcuterie boards you help build and they absolutely crush. I loved this place; it's great for couples or for groups.

Even while picking out wine, cheese and meats, sometimes I'm overwhelmed by my lack of knowledge of wines, and what meats and cheeses go with it, but we were helped by a lovely member of the staff who put us at ease right away, listened to our insane food allergies, and helped bring us out one of the best meals I've ever had in New Orleans.

After a beautiful autumn walk through the Botanical Gardens I stopped in for lunch. It is basically a old service station turned restaurant, but don't let that throw you off. Trust me - you will love this place. 

Think vintage oil cans and crystal decanters with silver trays and copper tagines. Add to the mix a variety of artisanal gin, rye and Japanese whiskey served over an upbeat but chill background music (Like ARE & BE on Spotify).

I ordered the Ugni blanc with some baba ganoush and the autumn root vegetable tagine. Homemade bread was amazing and everything was delicious. I'll let the photo do the talking.

I'll be back!
Love this place. Come in sit in the back,  relax and have some me time.  They have all types of spiritual  items for sale. Really nice gifts too.

Having my hair done at the same place in NJ for 8 years, I was super nervous to switch hair colorists when I moved to the area. Kadi, however, exceeded all my expectations and did an amazing job on my color. I am so happy I bit the bullet and tried someplace new!

Wow! The food here is EXCELLENT! My husband and I had the buffet today (22 items since it was New Year's Eve) and everything was delicious. My favorite was the goat curry. Loads of meat with very little bone in a luscious sauce. There were several different kinds of chicken all very good, vegetables, plain rice, chicken biryani, soup, appetizers, salad, chutneys, desserts, mango juice, and masala tea all for $10.99. Can't beat that price anywhere! Before you sit down you are asked what kind of naan you would like to have and then it is brought to you in a basket. Water is constantly replenished. The food is piping hot at the buffet. Service is quite attentive. It is a small place, but homey and quiet. A friend who is a chef highly recommended this place. We finally have a new Indian restaurant to go to and I cannot wait to return for another meal.
Two visits on my trip. Excellent food and service! Had the oyster Benedict and the seafood Benedict.  Awesome grits as well!

Tremblay Financial Services helped my family member with a time-sensitive retirement account issue. They were thorough in explaining options and in reducing the number of steps he had to take to complete the transaction. We are happy to have them on our side.

This is a wonderful style steakhouse that also offers fantastic seafood my wife treated me to go here for my birthday I had a delicious prime rib and she really enjoyed her crab Imperial fantastic service very elegant atmosphere probably recommend
Probably the worst cioppino I have ever had in my life. So disappointing that I paid $16 for it

All I have to say is NANCY! She is the best waitress I've ever had. My friend and I love Cracker Barrel and it is always such a treat to go in and see Nancy's welcoming smile! She is attentive, funny and excellent at making great food suggestions. Go there and great service and great food!!
This place has gone downhill in cleanliness. Who wants to do their was in a dirty place?? Owner needs to get on this.
The Churros are mouth watering Delisious service was amazing there tacos are fabulous overall they are amazing

I'm not sure what happened to this restaurant , they were awesome;  but the doors are closed and a sign in the window just says CLOSED so its too bad. You finally find a place with fresh food, and reasonable prices and they close, its hard to keep afloat with the bullshit prices these plazas charge for rent!!  They would rather lose months or a years worth of rent rather than lower their leases!!! Idiots

Wow, what a disappointment. It's a pretty building in a pretty place, hence the 2 stars. The service was terrible. I very rarely leave a bad review but this place deserves it. When I booked the room it was for 2 people and their "bay breeze package" but when I got here I was told the reservation was only for 1 person. This resulted in an additional charge of over $50 to add my daughter back onto the package. Since it was my first time at the hotel and it was their error, I asked if there was a comp- 1 front desk person and 2 supervisors later I was able to get 1 free drink at the bar for a house brand drink. Really? All that work for a $4 glass of wine? When my daughter's cold got worse and then she couldn't use the additional service I just paid for, neither the hotel or the spa would work with us to rebook the service, issue a gift certificate or anything else. The room was ok, nothing special. The hot tub and pool were ok, but creepy later in the evening due to poor lighting and minimal staff. Save yourself money and stay some other place that is more customer oriented.
This was an amazing restaurant. Our server Doug was very accommodating and professional. We were hungry so no time to take pictures LOL

The Bridgestone Arena is where the Preds play, big name concerts are held and I'm sure the occasional Monster Truck rally. But the review is really about the fans rated number one by ESPN. While I am not sure of the formula the "mother ship" used, I'm pretty sure they got it right.
Everyone seems to be dressed in team colors, the anthem is often sung by some recording star, a veteran is recognized for their service all before the puck drops.
The fans taunt the opposing goalie with a verse that questions his ability. Loud music is played when the Preds need a lift. Live bands play between periods. It must all work as they often have the best home record in hockey.

Overall great experience, vibe, location and atmosphere. 
Great service and food
Bread should be included - not extra
Poke was very good - but should be tuna. 
Cheese plate was great
Fried chicken - very good- but not the best I've ever had, moist and delicious though, jalapeno grits tasty, collard greens very good
Strogranoff was good- meet a little dry, could have been a little more flavorful
Overall deserts were a let down- mousse was ok, cookie tray average- only saving grace was the caramel/toffee, carrot cake sunday- meh. 
Lastly - everytime they brought a course they gave the plates and drinks to the wrong person- I'm sure this will improve with time
Wine list decent - but way over priced.
We will return- and I'm sure some of these things will improve.

Good find for Greek food in a cozy restaurant with beautiful decor. Seated immediately on a Friday night, slightly before the dinner rush. Service was quick and to the point, the menu included many traditional options- unfortunately the moussaka was unavailable at this time. The food came out in a timely manner and our server was attentive to our enjoyment of our meals. Overall good food and a great environment. A little pricey, however seemed fair given that this is a intimate family run restaurant. Would eat here again.

We were slow to try Pica's....our loss. Quality is outstanding, portions generous. Grilled chicken Alfredo, chicken Parmesan sandwich and seared scallops. Yum, yum and yum! Warm bread and sautéed peppers to table at start. Reasonable pricing for quality food! We'll be back. And, staff is friendly and professional. An all around win.
I have been here a couple times now with some great friends and the service is always amazing and the food is even better. Its is totally worth the wait to get seated!

Didn't feel like cooking so i ordered the crabs from uber eats. I guess they were having a bad day yesterday because when I ate their crabs I got food poisoning. Threw up all night. My suggestion is if you want a near death experience get the crabs.

We had to wait a while for a table, then the order I made was made incorrectly, granted the server was new. The Peanut Butter Chocolate waffle was good, my companions had the pecan waffle, which we agreed was too many pecans in the waffle. Fluffier waffles would have been nice.
My favorite grocery store, I think they are wonderful but they need more gluten free items like Safeway.
why did you burn the building down that was my favorite pizza place. I know you guys wanted to vacation but you don't have to burn it down. whatever now I have to eat pasta Mista

If you know me, you know I do not try different burger joints at all!! Nothing compares to my local Beach Corner joint. Well I tried this Smashburger place and it was tasty. I've only been twice, and both times was great.

One my last visit, I had a double cheeseburger with bacon on it. The meat cooked perfect. One my first visit, i had fries to go with it but it was not regular fries ( I prefer the regular fries over the fancy fries that were ordered). 

The location is great. Magazine street right where all of the great bars are located. The service is good and the location is impressively clean. 

The only complaint I have with the burgers are, they are very very greasy.
The Classic Roast Beef sandwich was excellent!! The baked Mac and cheese was ok and the Chai latte was low key! :/
Lyndel our waitress was helpful and accommodating for our family and 2 year old daughter. Appreciated the care and many thanks!

I read about this Restaurant in the Sauce magazine and thought it would be a good spot to dine. I was disappointed in the seating,food, and price. 

For the price I would think you would have a waiter or waitress. Food was average. Portions where ridiculously small. 2 deviled eggs for $6.....GEESH.

I'm not sure if the cook knows what the original recipes looked like before he prepared it but h has to do some research. 


I had the catfish, sweet potatoes, and pork cracklings cornbread. Catfish was average and small portions. Sweet potatoes where bland, and the cornbread had NO pork cracklings in it, google it when you get a chance. 

Overall I didn't enjoy it.

Having purchased our home "used" and living here 3 years, we have encountered numerous problems (roof leaking, plumbing issues, water heater dying, etc) so we decided to do an inspection before other issues could arise.  Our search for an inspector began with suggestions from neighbors and many suggested Waypoint. After reviewing their background with the BBB, (which was an A+ rating) I contacted them for a basic 4 point inspection. Wilmer was the gentleman who came out and he was amazing (and very personable)!  Not only did he complete the inspection, but he offered very helpful hints that would be beneficial for lower insurance rates and help preserve the longevity of home.  We would highly recommend this company (and Wilmer) for either a basic inspection or if you are moving to a new home.

What a wonderful surprise to find this gem in downtown Reno.   Food was delicious.  Try the Fried Chicken salad.  Soooo good.  Also had the burger that tasted like it was grilled outside.  Their fries were thin and delicious.  The service was five star.
They offered a variety of wonderful dinner fair.  Check out the menu online.  I will definitely go there again.

Amazing food and good value for what you pay for. Very decent amount of food, I have leftovers for both of my two visits here. The dolsot bibimbap is really good. Perfect ambience for conversations, it's not too loud and the music is on point. Definitely will come back to try more dishes!

Stopped here after a cold day at Busch Gardens for one last Mexican meal before heading back up North to NY. Probably the best tacos I've ever had. The chips and salsa were amazing, too. Definitely recommend.

Great pizza, salads, and amazing desserts. Also very good entrees. Quick and really nice service. Very reasonable prices. My number one choice for pizza.  Try the Christopher Columbus if you like lots of fresh veggies. The carrot cake and cannolis are sooo delicious. Better in the main dining room than in the larger room.

Literally spent 2hrs+ making sure each curl is strategically placed  constantly asking how I like it so far and if I need any water, coffee, wine etc  and I was seriously shocked when I saw the price as it was way lower then I had expected, considering the princess treatment I had received. Thank you again. Hubby also approved
The menu is great but unfortunately they are inconsistent with food prep. I've had great food, then cold food, then undercooked food all for the exact same dish.

Thanks so much for the help in finding a last minute rental! Love that it wasn't just the dress but I got the pearls and headband to go with it and for a reasonable price. Beats having to buy everything separately.  The ladies were so friendly and helpful too. Can't wait to come back for the next theme party :)
Food was really good and the staff was great! LOVED the live performer tonight! So talented!! Definitely coming back

This place is great. Service brought us extra cherries for baby without asking. The fried seafood and drinks are the best. I love norleans! It's like Vegas with great food everywhere here hoooraaaaye.

Checked out this new sushi spot after hearing good things and I'm glad I did! The fish was clearly very fresh and the portion sizes were generous. The seasoning was excellent on the dishes. The J&J Specialty Roll was really good and I highly recommend it.  All in all, a great experience with delectable food and lovely ambiance. Will definitely be coming back!

Well, good food, reasonable price. But as they themselves advertised, the service is indeed slow. I waited 20 mins to get my water, and another 10 mins to place the order, and yet another 20 mins to get the food. I went there twice. Both time, I experience good food + slow services. 

Will I come again? Well, maybe. I will make sure I sit inside or near the door at porch so that servers could see me.
GREAT BRUNCH!!  Service on point. We are always in search of a great place for Sun brunch. Did a search and this place came up. Looking forward to having a D-n-D there soon.

A colleague and I were in town on business and stayed at the attached hotel.  We stopped in here on two occasions during our stay.  The first experience was great.  We wanted a quick appetizer before meeting friends.  The BBQ nachos were delicious.  A decent-sized portion. Not too large and enough "stuff" to make your tastebuds happy. I also tried their in-house beer.  It was pretty good.  I was surprised.  Our bartender, Kevin, was very friendly.  Turns out he's also a damn fine musician too!  

Now, our second experience was quite the letdown.  We popped in for lunch.  I tried the fried bologna sandwich.  I was intrigued by something new.  I shouldn't have been.  It was a bit too fried for me and on plain old bread.  I opted for American cheese, which looked plastic-y and didn't cover the entire sandwich.  I felt slightly ill afterward, perhaps from the grease?  My colleague had the brisket sandwich.  She said the flavor was okay but that it was super fatty.  She also didn't feel great afterward.  

So, maybe stop in for an appetizer and music, but then head out?  I was disappointed that lunch wasn't as positive of an experience as lunch. Whomp whomp.

The Hispanic man with the glasses is the nastiest person I have encountered by far in a long time. I went to go grab some napkins and he made me ASK FOR HIS PERMISSION. I hope someone heals your rude soul. Will never be going near this place ever again

Great little place ....and it is little.......but the service, food and price can't be beat .......I have been driving by this place for three months now and finials stop in    Should have sooner.  Nice place.   Wil return again

It was my first time getting this type of massage- Michael was great, personable, and made me feel comfortable. After the massage my body felt rejuvenated and relaxed. I recommend it for anyone that feels like they have a stiff back- I feel completely aligned after working with him.
I love this place. The food and coffee are excellent. On the weekends, expect a bit of a line but as a local, It's great and I would highly recommend their "Build your own" hashes.

The best of the best! Great outfitters with great employees. This business cares about its customers,even to the point of closing if conditions are unsafe on the river. That costs them revenue but they put safety first!
This was our first visit, Zoey did a GREAT job grooming our Maltese, we will be returning soon! The facility was clean and inviting and Sophie was as happy as could be when I picked her up!

Nothing fancy but it does have some delicious Vietnamese food.  My son loves it here especially the shrimp rockets and shrimp & pork noodle soup.  The beef pho is yummy.  Perfect on a cold day too!  Great service - quick and attentive but they aren't obnoxious about it.  Love coming here.

The best chocolate croissant (petit pain au chocolat) I had in USA!  I like the atmosphere, very industrial look. The place is shared with a wine bar, so you can have an excellent sandwich made with a French baguette and a glass of wine. It was too early for me. I would recommend this place.

You know, all I did was stand in line to buy a suit for my little boy.  I realize the clothing is used and certainly don't expect it to be treated as a new buy.  All I needed was a hanger to hang the suit on so it wouldn't get wrinkled in the bag.  The older lady with glasses checking me out told me I could buy a hanger for the suit.  If I wasn't desperate, with a sick kid at home, whom I'm trying to nurse back to health for a piano recital tomorrow, I probably would have let this pass.  Saver's I hope a hanger was worth losing my future business.  I suggest you provide some kindness training for the rude and non-compassionate human you have working for you....Transaction 8797, register 7, operator 1515, 10:34a.  I'll go elsewhere next time where I can be treated with little kindness and respect.
Place looks like a speak easy from outside. I went on trivia night, it was fun, didn't try the food.

We came across this place as my family and I were visiting New Orleans and we were taking a walk from the hotel to the French Quarter around 11am on a Saturday. We were seated immediately and the staff were all absolutely friendly. I was not familiar with Louisiana food so I appreciated the thorough explanation given when I asked what's bayou etc. Since we were there for brunch, we had two omelettes which were both good, friend alligator, shrimp po-boy, and a bayou bowl. Everything was great except I'm a little disappointed with the alligator meat - because it was fried it tasted like chicken to me, I can't really tell I was eating alligator. I wish there were options to choose from in terms of how you want the meat cooked.

The Looking Glass is great local boutique. The majority of the store focuses on engraving and etching vases, cutting boards, wine glasses and various household items. The great thing is the engraving is more than just a monogram. The other part of the store hosts local crafts, jewelry and children's clothing.

This is probably the blandest pizza in East Nashville. The crust has less flavor than most frozen pizzas. I gave them more than 1 Star just because they are in my neighborhood and I want them to be better than they are. I order from here about 1 once a year and that reminds me why I go other places. Their wings are good but if your looking for pizza I'd suggest going elsewhere.

3 words... donut bread pudding. OMG. Insane. Not too sweet, light fluffy goodness with coconut & fresh cream. It's a dream. Trust me, save room for it. Service was also divine. Servers who weren't even ours stopped to ask if we had what we needed, if we were liking things etc. Really an awesome experience. We will be back for a dinner! 

Update: we came back for dinner and the burger will change your life!!

Celiacs in the area def need to check out this place!
They have a number of gluten free options and accommodate to preventing cross contamination to the best of their abilities if you mention your dietary needs.
My fav thing from there is their chicken quesadillas.
Nice bakery, with plenty of goodies to choose from. I bought the Paleo Pumpkin pie, which was deliciously amazing. The staff and service is great, place is clean and inviting.

I've been here 3 times before and loved it. But tonight... the kitchen is SO slow. My family and I waited on our food (two sir chicken sandwiches and a cheese omelet) for twenty five minutes. Our server was really nice and apologetic. But it really shouldn't have taken 25 minutes to make two sandwiches and an omelet.

Cool ambiance, great food! Definitely order the Yakitori, we had chicken thigh, very tender and moist. The duck fried rice was yummy too.  The Japanese beer, Orion, was really good too, never had it before but good drinking beer.

First time at this local restaurant. The meats were tasty but served cold. Collard greens were unusual but not in a good way. Garlic bread and cole slaw lack flavor. The fried green tomatoes were good. The waitress brought our food out, already cold but did not bring us plates or utensils. Had to ask for sauces too. She didn't bring straws with the drinks. She forgot my wine altogether. Food and service need work!

The place looked interesting enough, the live music was pleasant enough, the food and drink were over priced and marginal at best, but the coupe de grace was delivered when I received the check. I had asked for an additional portion of herbed mayonaise that accompanied my Cuban sandwich, upon examination of the check, I found a $1 charge for a table spoon of mayo. Unbeliebvable. I said something to the manager who did nothing but say "that's how it is."
Don't be lured by the interesting exterior......this place is not worth your time or money and the management is completely tone deaf on customer perception of value; $8 for a 10oz glass of common IPA, $18 for lack luster fish tacos plus mayo for $1. There are much better options in that town or accross the river.

We are regulars. Its one of our places for sushi rolls. Very clean place. I think they need to change up the menu a little more often. I personally dont care for much of the hot foods. Just dont like the sauce. Soups are GREAT. I would tell you to go.

Came back home to visit some family and friends in the philly area and a friend recommended this place to me. At first I was hesitant to go because I heard it just opened and thought they would be understaff or have low quality service but I was completely wrong! As soon as I walked in, someone by the name of Najette greeted me at the door with a warm smile, and asked me about my day before inquiring about what I would like to eat. Although, it was a small moment, it left a big impact on me. Most businesses you walk into don't care about there customers on that level. But wait it gets better.. I sat down and placed my order: 

- Chicken sandwich BJ 
- Kafta kabob 
- Mezze plate
- Man'ousha flat bread 

Everything tasted AMAZING!! During my meal the manager (or owner) Greg came by my table to inquire about my experience and asked if I needed any extra pitas. My expectations were completely blown away!! I would highly recommend this to anyone!! I can't wait to come back!
We are from out of town here on vacation. We really enjoyed the restaurant and the fish tank display. There is a lot of interesting Guy Harvey merchandise up front also.
Great food, love all their options! Just don't expect a quick in-and-out during lunchtime rush. This location is particularly busy around noon.

Stopped in for breakfast on a rainy Sunday afternoon.  We didn't have to wait but a minute for our table for two. It was the smallest table for two I've ever sat. Despite that, we had an amazing meal. You don't come here for atmosphere or experience....just amazing food. I had the shrimp and grits. I'm not a southern so grits is not often in the top of my list but it's one of the things out waitress recommended and I am so glad that she did. It was out of this world. Warm, creamy, cheesy and savory with ample and flavorful shrimp.  My partner had a more traditional breakfast with eggs bacon toast hash browns and pancakes. It was good. But he admitted he chose poorly once has tasted mine. The pancakes were excellent btw. Cake like.

Amazing food and service. Excellent EXO coffee. 
Vegetarian and gluten free options. Highly recommended!!
I used the app to put our party on the wait list and by the time we arrived we were seated In under 10 minutes. 
What a gem of a place!!

I was really good pizza and wings. I would definitely come back. We came with kids and it was ok. I guess it depends on what you have in mind for the atmosphere. There's a lot of tvs so with kids it can be distracting but that's what people are there for to watch a game and eat pizza. Overall good and definitely good food.

Sahm's has the market cornered when it comes to family friendly restaurants! I'm well aware of the several Sahm's locations, the Big Lug brewery, and recent acquisition of Bent Rail in South Broad Ripple, but this was my first time at Roost, despite working in the area for over 10 years. 

During an early errand run with my daughter, I checked the area for a breakfast spot. I was reminded of this spot I've passed dozens of times, on the SE corner of Allisonville and 116th. We were seated quickly and greeted by a festive woman donned in sparkles and a Santa hat. 

As with other locations, they had specials, in addition to a full breakfast & lunch menu. I ordered a scramble and bacon that came with hash browns and an order of biscuits and gravy and toast. Z got an omelet with a side of fruit and a waffle. 

The portions were large and the hash browns were just the way I liked them. The gravy was a bit on the runny side, but not terrible. 

There's a breakfast 'bar' that several people were seated around and the restaurant filled up quickly while we were there. 

While they don't serve cocktails, its a perfect spot for a family meal. You can even order their famous bundt cake to go!

Very good.... my daughter loved the food and thought the staff was very nice.  The owner or manager was at the table several times and delivered our food.  The seafood ravioli was excellent and so was the fresh tomato and basil sauce.  It was authentic and well done.  (Italians in the restaurant business- so not easily impressed)

My first time here.  Service was good, and the sushi was good quality.  But I'm giving it three stars because of the Wasabi.  It was terrible.  Not spicy.  No flavor.  Like puréed potatoes with green food coloring in it.  Sorry but if your specialty is Sushi, you need to have at least decent/passable wasabi.  Everything else was good.
Great steaks! The flavour of their beef is wonderful and not duplicated anywhere else. Always popular, efficient service and the Caesar salad sure isn't lacking of dressing!

For the price-which is not cheap for a pizzeria- this place falls far below average. Food was not very good. Also, I went during a time where there were only 3 groups of diners, and the staff out numbered us 2:1. However, it took forever for them to take my table's order, and to get my food, and drink, and did not even receive proper utensils to remove the hot pizza from the dish. 

The whole time the wait staff were chatting behind the barriers by the register. No respect for the individuals who are paying their wages. Idk how the owner isn't more on top of this. It makes your establishment look very bad.
Love this place. It's a perfect Italian place to take your kids or family. We always get the pizza, anti pasta salad and penne all vodka. Never disappointed and the price is perfect.
I recommend getting the migas. We had to wait about 20 min to get a table but we had 5 people in our group. If you're looking for a lively place for brunch, check this place out :)
Incredible incredible food. Atmosphere is quiet and comfortable. Definitely recommend.

The staff was veey helpful and the place was very clean!  I also loved the fact there was both a resturant and cafe in the hotel....so very convenient.   I only had two issues...one....my room was very noisey.  Idk if it was the heat kicking on or what...but every 20 min or so there was a loud clinking sound.....i had to sleep with ear plugs (which im glad i had).  My only other issue was the price of parking.....it was $49 a night!!! I know im im a major city....but i would think they can be a bit more reasonable!

Fantastic place for lunch or brunch with friends.  The food is always good, wait staff very friendly, and the ambiance is unbeatable.  I would recommend Wildflower Cafe to anyone who wants a unique and cozy dining experience.
Wow!! Amazing food, amazing atmosphere. The short rib grilled cheese and the chai latte are a must. Yummy smoothies and deserts too! 13/10 yum yum yum

I've been coming to this restaurant for 25 years. The nostalgic layout is appealing. Waitresses are friendly and familiar. Unfortunately due to its size gets too busy on Saturday and Sunday mornings. You have to pick a good time or prepare to stand. Raised prices a few years ago. Taking it from a really good bargain to a moderate one. 

My first bad experience was today otherwise I would rate it higher. 8:30 AM on a Monday in December and the restaurant was almost empty because I was by myself I was not allowed to sit at one of the eight open tables. I was not interested in sitting at the counter and there were plenty of seats and no one at the door. That's just bad business. I left embarrassed because I happen to be alone this time.

Amazing! Great food! Great ambiance! Great service! I got the bacon cheeseburger on a gluten free bun. The best burger I have ever had. I love finding great places that offer gluten free options. I'm definitely going to come back here! Prices are not to high. My burger was $10.39. The price is great for how big the burger was!

I think most people can agree that no one "really" likes to go to the dentist but I can say that going here is always a great experience. The staff is friendly and Dr. Lawyer is very easy going. I came in today because I was experiencing some pain in my jaw from an old root canal and was not looking forward to having my teeth cleaned. Deanna was so nice and super gentle. I have to say that my appointment did not suck. Having tooth pain is the worst but it's always a relief when the people there to help are always so helpful. Hope that helps.

I love love love the Teriyaki Burrito tonight it was all burrito and no teriyaki. This is something special so when it is ordered someone ought to take great care to make it what ii is supposed to be. Maybe next time.

We stopped by for a quick lunch and ordered a classic and the Depot burger, we asked specifically that they be rare, the classic came in closer to medium, and Depot burger had no pink at all, why is it so hard to make a rare burger. Any way the food was good, the grilled onions we're awesome. Our waitress was great and the over cook burger was removed from our bill with an apology. Talk about being a stand up place, we will go again and most likely recommend.

Very good food served fast and friendly,   Meal was hot and beer cold like it should be.  It's in the station so weather effects room temperature it's 18 outside so it's cool in side the station.   Would rather not watch CNN (Fake News) or NFL but little story telling is good to laugh at.  I would eat here again if passing through on train. Had the philly streak, fries very very good very good. Cost with a Philadelphia pale ale (bottle) $20.82

Nice little restaurant/ bar near Vanderbilt. Free parking for 1.5 hours (which is super awesome because there's barely any free parking in this town anymore!) service and food are good. Menu and drinks are also reasonably. The verde dip is one of my favs, as well as the gang feathers on a Caesar salad!

Good place for hangover ,not a usual place to eat . Great food (Mexican) people are very nice . Is not a fancy restaurant with all kind electronics things . It's a mom and pops place . Food is real you can get as Mexican culture . Try!!! But be OPEN MIND

Think I found my new spot in town.  Ish is the man if you're looking to get groomed up!  I came here to clean up before an interview for my grad program, and the barbers here proved great at doing just that.

11 different protein options. Each are 3oz. Unlike other places that squash their patties flat and removes most of the juices, these are thicker and juicer with more flavor, they are just smaller in diameter. These are truly mini burgers with many fresh toppings. Sliders are typically 1oz or less. The sweet potato fries are awsome.

This was a great meal! So worth the money!! Had the Hey Lucy omelette and it was just so good! Plenty to fill you up for a long day on the beach. My daughter wanted a salad that came with salmon on it and she's a vegetarian so she asked it without and they did it and then adjusted the price which was really awesome!! Fun drinks and great services! I would recommend this place to all.

Went last night before his company Christmas jamboree and the food and service were wonderful!

This place was moderately busy on a Friday night, we were way overdressed because we had to do his party afterwards. The hostess was quick to greet us and super friendly.

We were led to a booth and our server was Katie, who was on the ball and incredibly charming. I ordered the scallops, subbed out mashed potatoes for the rice and my food was perfect. The scallops were perfectly cooked and succulent. The mash was tasty and even the vegetables were fantastic. The two drinks I had were really tasty and strong too, the bartender is on it! 

My date had the steak which comes with a killer marinade and was perfectly cooked and juicy. I was delighted with my scallops but the steak was so good! I wish they would do a surf and turf! 

Finished with cheesecake that was dense and creamy and it ended the night perfectly. 

Bathrooms were cute and clean with kitschy beach signs in the stalls. The crowd was upbeat and the staff were all smiles and laughter. 

Wonderful. We can't wait to go again!

We dropped by 21st Amendment for some late-night cocktails in French Quarter without going to the rowdier spots. Given that this was close to where we were staying (the Marriott), it was easy to pop out and roll over to 21st Amendment, which was only a few minutes away. There wasn't a line outside, but it was packed by the time we made it inside (sometime between 10-11 PM)...standing-room only, with the seats at the high-top tables and the bar taken. The decor and ambiance is a bit more retro, but like all New Orleans spots in this fashion, it feels homey, and it was enhanced by the fact that the band in the bar playing live music was absolutely entrancing the audience, with some folks even doing some dancing right at the front.

That said, I did come here initially because it was rated highly for drinks, and on that front, the cocktails do not disappoint. The bartenders make the drinks expertly, whether you stay on-menu or stray off by giving some general preferences. The beer selection is more generic, with specific bottles being the big-label brands, and no names given for listings like 'seasonal' or 'IPA'. Nonetheless, the drinks are made quickly but consistently - something I appreciated given how busy it was that night. Pricing was reasonable, relatively speaking - $13 a cocktail is a bit expensive, but the quality was very good, making it a bargain compared to some places in New York that I have been to.

21st Amendment really has a nice cozy feel to it, and with great drinks and great music, it's hard to go wrong. It doesn't have the kind of 'fun' you'd find half a block over on Bourbon Street, but at my age, it's the kind of fun that I'd rather have. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.

Cornell and Nicole are great.  Funny and personable.  In terms of personal training it is very personal.  Exercises are goal directed and they go at your pace. Hours are really flexible. I work late so being able to go at 7 or 8 pm is great.  They also are very understanding of last minute changes and are happy to reschedule. They are open on weekends and will also do Skype or give me home regimens when I'm out of town or can't make it.  Gym is clean.  They vary the workouts so it never gets boring. And unlike big chains you don't feel cheated or taken advantaged of or some faceless customer.  I already convinced some of my family to also attend. They do couple or friend/group sessions too.  They have different packages for at little as 1 month to much longer if desired.

Hubbard's Marina Offers 5 hr trips that go out about an hour offshore, fish for 3 hours, and then travel an hour back to trhe dock.  I do not recommend  these 5 hour trips to experienced ocean anglers. Simply put, this 5 hour trip does not go out far enough or deep enough to get to large grouper, large snapper, amerjack, tuna and other larger fish that most of us experienced fisherman are looking for. It is strictly 3 hrs of bottom fishing for grey snapper, hogfish, sand perch, and many other fish that are not very big at the approximately 50 ft depth they fish at on these trips.  I went on 10 trips from December of 2017 through July of 2017, then quit going because I never saw a fish bigger than 6 lbs caught on any of the 10 trips. This 5 hr trip, in my opinion, is a good experience for tourists, and children, but not for serious fishermen.  The pictures of all the huge fish they display on their website and emails, I conjecture, were probably taken from rare instances over long periods of time, and from the more expensive longer trips to deep waters.
