Recently joined and have been really happy with the gym!!  It has good equipment, classes and staff, couldn't be more excited.  The bonus is having multiple locations so can always stop at another facility if I am out of my neighborhood...the cost is GREAT:-)

This might be my favorite Indian place in Bucks County! The service is great, the food incredible and dietary restrictions are met by everyone at the table. (Gluten free, dairy free and vegan) all at the same table. The recommendations are incredible and never disappoint!

What everyone else said about this laundromat is true: it is exceedingly clean, well kept, safe, priced right and the people who work here are friendly and helpful. What more can you want from a laundromat?

I came here to get my duvet washed. I could have washed it here myself, but as someone smarter than me recently said: "Ain't no one got time for that." So I dropped it off with the friendly launderette who was sitting at the counter. She took my info, told me when I could pick it up, and asked me what kind of detergent to use. (She listed off like five different kinds. I chose unscented Tide.) Three hours and $19 dollars later, I have a clean, fresh, nicely folded duvet ready to be put back on my bed. My clean duvet also came in a nice plastic bag with a handle. It's a dang miracle, I tell you.

If my washer and dryer ever conk out, this will be the place I visit to wash and dry my laundry. In the mean time, I like knowing that I have a place where I can drop off random things that are too big for my washer, and they will come back sparkling (and it won't cost me a fortune).

Very good experience. There were five of us. Everyone enjoyed the appetizers, main entree and drinks. Service was excellent and personable. The prices good.  Ambiance is pleasant and relaxing. Cost is reasonable. Looking forward to our next visit!

This is a great urgent care clinic with caring staff and built to last. I need to keep writing this review it's the thing I have to do. Why go anywhere else? Expect the best and leave a thing on Yelp.

This place has grown on me over the years. I find myself going here more and more, despite the (fantastic) proliferation of coffee places in the northern Camden County area. It's just a solid place to come back to again and again, and hopefully this'll give you some insight into why.

Let's start with the seating. It's got a lot of different areas to hang out; aside from two large seating areas on either side of the counter, there's an awesome courtyard right on the corner of Haddon and Redman Avenues and plenty of sidewalk seating out front for the warmer months. Not enough places in the suburbs have outside areas for hanging out, so these spots for people - and puppy - watching is much appreciated.

Their coffee's always been pretty good, and I think they keep switching up what beans they get. From what I can remember, I've seen Rival Brothers, Square One. They do pour overs, which I love, and they've got some more exotic things sometimes, like the Gibraltar (a variation on a cortado) and the "Americola", a fascinating mix of Mexican coke and a shot of espresso. To eat, there've got a variety of pastries like muffins and homemade pop tarts and quiches.

Also, it's worth noting that this is one of the only coffee places open on a late Sunday afternoon/early evening worth going. There're a lot of coffee places around here, but they all seem to close between 1 and 3PM. For years now, Jersey Java's open open til 6PM on Sundays, which I really appreciate. I don't know if the other places think people just hide out at home on Sunday afternoons or what, but it's great this place stays open.

My favorite -- the chicken pot pie on Sundays and their herbal iced tea!  Much of the rest of their food is good -- I try to avoid the fried foods as my heart isn't appreciating those these days, but the sweet potatoes, cauliflower (OMG -- yum), and banana pudding are pretty darned good.
Definitely give this place a stop if you enjoy good old comfort food.

This is a beautiful restaurant. We dined with a large group and it was not good. Food was served cold and 2 hours after being seated. The City Park salad was very good and served a little more promptly than the main dish. The redfish was below average. Service was slow and with a poor attitude.  It is off our list.
I love this place. This is my #1 spot for sushi. Food  is fresh and the services is excelente.

Always delicious. Fresh, beautifully prepared food. This is a must-visit locale anytime I'm in STL. Wait staff is always very nice and friendly. Sometimes you have to wait for your food but it's a tapas restaurant; things come out as they're prepared. In nice weather I always enjoy the outdoors seating and summer drinks. In winter it's cozier seating inside this old gas-station turned restaurant. Fun & funky decor. But come for the food! Best hummus (King of Kings) but just know it's heavy on the tahini (it's in the middle so you can swirl in as much as you'd like). Zucchini carpaccio (it's actually grilled think ribbons) is sublime. Charred tomato bruschetta... these are my go-to three choices and it makes for an amazing and delicious vegetarian lunch. My friends always get the egg salad (w/anchovy) and rave about it.  Home made breads. The larger dishes all look beautiful and scrumptious. They also do an honest and generous wine pour-/ which I always appreciate!
Had the coffee ice cream here and it was fabulous! It has little chunks of coffee beans in it as well. The staff was very kind and attentive. Definitely look forward to visiting again.

The food was good (definitely on the pricier side), but the service was terrible. Probably the most hipster restaurant I've been to in Reno, but I would not recommend this place if you're trying to have an intimate date night. The music in the restaurant is super loud. 

Service: After my boyfriend and I were seated, it took the waiter at least 15 minutes to get us water. The food took a long time to come out and our main dishes came out at different times. After finishing dinner, we asked for the check and I think the waiters completely forgot about us because we had to wait another 10-15 minutes. I would expect restaurants to want to turn tables over quickly, but for some reason service was super slow. For the poor customer service and overall dining experience, three stars.

Food: Tried the crab croquet. Pretty tasty, but I don't think it warrants the high price tag. Three crab croquets for $13 is a little steep.

Also had the spicy miso ramen ($16) and the wicked fried rice with duck cracklings ($14). I'd say the ramen here is probably better than other places I've been to in Reno, but nearly double the price. The broth wasn't super rich, but presentation and little vegetables were nice. The wicked fried rice was pretty good. The cracklings definitely add texture and the duck on top was cooked well.

This is by far my favorite place for amazing tacos and sunset watching in the area! High quality food, huge portions, delicious fresh fish and excellent ambience. Family friendly, also perfect for romantic occasions! Love, love, love!

What a poor excuse for a restaurant, and I already expect hotel restaurants to be expensive and mediocre but the prices here were ridiculous and not posted on the menu. 

I asked if there were any other options on the breakfast menu for kids and he said they do things a la carte, like eggs, bacon, fruit....one of the a la carte things we ordered was three eggs....we paid $5 for the first two and then $3 for the 3rd. What's that about? And $5 for a drip coffee? The most overpriced coffee chain doesn't charge that for a venti. 
In the end we paid over $50 for 1 order of croissants (2), 2 miniature danishes, a small bowl of cold oatmeal and 3 slices of bacon and 3 scrambled eggs. 

We should have just braved the cold like we did for every other meal when we were staying at Hotel Monaco.

I absolutely love this location. The cashier I spoke to was very friendly and energetic to everyone around and made the experience of shopping here that much better. I bought some eyeshadow here and although a little expensive it's very nice.

This restaurant is consistent with good food, new kinds of dishes, excellent choices for vegetarians, the best coffee in town and servers who Are always friendly  and efficient. Super nice patio To bring your dog who also get excellent service. One of the best restaurants in town.

I had the worst customer service last evening. My boyfriend and I went into this gas station for some beer and waited at the counter for 10-15 minutes because they were having a shift change. There's nothing wrong with that, but the lady at the front desk didn't have to be so Snyde about it. Once he waited for so long he came back out to the car and I went in and basically yelled hello across the counter and then was finally checked out, and the lady who rang everything out was rude the whole time because she didn't care, and the other employees were laughing the whole time. Terrible, ignorant customer service

Delicious. There was a huge crowd when I went and it's the middle of December, but the lines always move quickly. Plus you always get to see dogs there. Chocolate ice cream with hot fudge and cookie dough  never disappoints.
Best Thai food I've had in Philadelphia, definitely recommend anyone who loves spicy food to check this place out!
Food was so amazing! Andy made the best Guacamole... his food and drink  recommendations were spot on! We will definitely be back... hopefully we will be lucky enough to have Andy make our guac!
This McDonald's is always slow and very poorly run. Please hire better management for this location.

Being a Missouri girl, I was raised on BBQ. Eli knows how to bbq. It's all about the meat and the smoke. The ribs are my favorite. They are tender, pulling off the bone just right. The chicken, sides and bbq sauce are great but the meat is the KING.
Improvement is slow.  Food is same but at least they have a few friendlier people.  I wish they offered some specials.

It literally pisses me off how fucking fantastic Three Carrots is. Like, I'm mad when I'm done eating/full, I want it for every meal of every god damn day (sometimes I do actually get it for every meal, WHY WOULDN'T YOU?!). It's not only great vegan food, it's great fucking food!

Roger,
Seattle wins AGAIN!!!! You're an awful bartender with awful friends. I keep you in my spank bank, exactly where you belong. Let me know if you need some redecorating, because your front door looks like crap. Drizzle rain? Better grab your umbrella. 

Folks,
If anyone wants soda water in your 'Old Fashioned', this place is for you. Bad people making bad drinks. They would mess up a cup of coffee if you asked for it. It's Folgers btw. I would recommend the trek to Firkins Tavern in Ewing, NJ - the real deal! The further you can get from this trashy, low-class bar, the better.

Went on a Sunday. Very limited menu, much different than what is listed online. If you only serve brunch - let people know! Only one kids option. Food was just okay - we had migas and huevos rancheros. Eggs were over cooked in the huevos rancheros and it came with cilantro on top although that wasn't listed on the menu.
Delivery driver didn't bring entire delivery, said he would go back to store to grab it and didn't return. Store refused to refund money!
F*** this place I will never come back here, the people told me to pay before they did my manicure, I mean I know not many black males or males in general come in to get these things done, but dam.

This was my first visit so I went with the steak teriyaki. It was so good but I was jealous when I saw my boyfriend's dish. He ordered the Bibimap which is pictured in the large stainless bowl. Both dishes were fantastic. Note: it gets pretty busy at lunchtime during the week so plan ahead.

The service was horrible. We waiting on a table forever luckily the waitress came over and cleaned one for us.(due to the large group we needed a big table) The kitchen staff trying to rush out messing up everyone food. The silverware was so dirty. It wasn't as packed today thank god. They really need to step it up with the kitchen staff. And yes it wasn't that packed yet we waited to be seated and they had 7/8 empty tables.  The games was fun and the kids did have a blast besides the bad food experience.

This is pretty much one of my favorite stores in the city and I've found some really great deals recently for gifts and for myself. I don't think I've ever left this place empty-handed! 

Besides enjoying the historic architectural details, I routinely find the staff to be helpful and knowledgeable, whether I'm getting something $ or $$, or just asking questions about something I can only afford to add to my wish-list for now. 

I've only had them gift wrap my purchases a few times and, unlike another reviewer here (perspective dude: First World problems!), I'm a little more forgiving when it comes to a free service. When it's busy (weekends, holiday time, weekends at holiday time) there's going to be a big line, and the people who stay in it are the ones who are going to get their things wrapped before the people who leave it behind for later pick-up. At least, that's what I'd expect if I continue to wait. If you ask, they'll probably just give you paper to wrap it yourself (though, Lord knows it will look like crap if I do it!), or you can go down the street to Papyrus (beautiful wrapping job, but they charge).

Really 2.5 stars.  Arrived shortly before 1 on a Saturday to an empty hostess station and not a server in sight.  There were three tables with customers so not busy.  We waited a few minutes and the bartender saw us and seated us in the bar.  She was fairly friendly.  As stated in other reviews the chips are not complementary.  I had a craving for nachos as my meal anyway so I didn't care.  The bartender recommended the buffalo chicken nachos so that is what I ordered.  You do not want the nachos.  The tortilla chips are too thick, under salted and boring.  The toppings were quite good.  Hubby ordered the restaurant's equivalent of a pulled pork sandwich and fries.  Sad fries... too greasy so they lack crispness.  The sandwich he found to be just ok.  The pork in my opinion had great flavor.  We were underwhelmed and in a town with lots of Mexican food we will not be back.

Food is always great here. I've had one really bad experience here with the Daniel guy here, he's a very unfriendly guy and should not be working here. But the server Sofia is definitely the most friendliest server there. She's always smiling and talking to you making you feel comfortable, so always ask for Sofia.

What a fun place to come and walk around.  We were staying in downtown but took at 15 min Uber ride over to check it out.  The decorations for the holidays and great and fun.  This place goes on and on and on. Lots of tour buses and tour groups but it didn't feel to crowded.  This is a money making machine so you'll see bars every 100 ft, gift shops and they have things designed for you to spend.  We took 15 min boat ride which was kinda funny and it let us rest our legs - it was $10.50.  We walked over to the Grand Ole Opry and went by a christmas gift store - again designed to make you spend money, when we got to the Opry - it was $26 for a 45 min tour - we decided that was too much - we would have paid $5 for a peek!!.  This was a great spot to get in some steps, look at the beautiful gardens inside the hotel and check off the bucket list.  We did not stay on site so have no idea what the rooms are like.
This place is dead. We saw too many empty store fronts that we got back in the car and went back home.

Wow, first time stopping in and definitely impressed. The restaurant itself is very nicely set up and decorated. We were seated right away at noon for the lunch buffet.

The buffet was amazing. I've only been to another Indian lunch buffet before and this one definitely surpassed it. The amount of vegetarian options was awesome- I went back for seconds! Make sure to come hungry because you will leave stuffed!

Really enjoyed our breakfast at Two Chicks. I had the Under the Sea omelette and it was delicious. If you enjoy seafood and Brie this is the choice for you! Creamy grits were amazing and the mimosa was delicious as well. Prices were very reasonable. Would definitely visit again
My first time at Cracker Barrel, and I really liked it. The food was good, and I could not believe how inexpensive it was.  Our waitress was very sweet and attentive

I'm running errands at Walmart and Home Depot and as my tummy gurgles, I look out onto the horizon I see the qdoba sign, like a beacon of hope. I was greeted happily by the staff and they prepared my big yet affordable burrito. I even thanked Manager Marcus as I left. I appreciate it y'all. Keep it up!

On an extended weekend trip, we made 3 stops here, we sat at the bar and had great service from the bar staff.  

The Chargrilled Oysters are some of the best I have tasted and the bread that is served with helps them stand out from the competition. 

Another standout dish was the Shrimp Ya Ya, which has a great blend of spice and flavor.  

Make sure to order a Bloody Mary with their house infused vodka too.
Just ate here, with my wife, for the first time. Chilled at the bar, had a beer, and ate some pizza. Great service and good times!
Very accommodating and nice. The food was delicious and the restaurant was packed on a Friday night. This is a BYOB and we can't wait to go back and try more on the menu.
First time here, but the beer is outstanding and the Baja fish tacos were excellent! Really nice atmosphere for a brewpub, my server, Andres, was very attentive and got a nice tip for his service.
High quality comfort food. We braved the cold for over an hour, standing in the queue. Was it worth it? Sure, by a nose.

I usually would never complain about this Texas Roadhouse but I had to wait over an hour for my food last time I was here, not to mention my waiter didn't ask if I wanted a refill or even come up to us for me to able to ask for a refill I had to ask a different waiter for a drink/straws/ etc.. Sucks because we came here for my brothers birthday, after waiting an hour for our food they came to tell us they dropped his steak and had to make. New one just for us to wait longer. Everyone at our table was already done eating by the time he got his food. Hopefully next time we will have better service.

Visiting SB from the Midwest and after a long day in wine country, our host treated us to carry out Pizza Mizza.  All pies were tasty, but my favorite was the one with chicken, mushroom, and rosemary white sauce.  Not a combination I would have come up with, but they're the creative people.  Yum.

Vientiane Cafe - oh I love you dearly. Not only do you always provide an affordable meal that all seem to enjoy - you are consistent, every dish is made to order, and OMG can you accommodate all food preferences!


This visit is bitter-sweet, as I am departing the Philadelphia area for a new career opportunity.

While I know I will be back from time-to-time, as I do have family in the area, I still can't just pop on over to one of my favorites when I need a good friend's couch to sit on. Because of all realistic measures, that is exactly what Vientiane is - a good friend's couch that you can come hang out in a laid back and chilled BYOB atmosphere.


It's that friend that makes you that big bowl of comfort food to help you celebrate the highs or to crush to lows... and for all of the amazing experiences I have had here - I thank you! I thank you for making eating out and being social a possibility for a gal who has multiple food allergies, is a bit of a food snob, and living on a budget. You are amazing and I will continue to spread the word that all of Philadelphia needs to come check out Vientiane, if they have not already!


This evening, we were seated and handed the revamp menu - which, is visually much more appealing. It is also helpful that this menu consists of GF (gluten-free) codes so I know what is and is not safe for me.


I ordered a good classic for a table share - Lao Porridge (jow-piek) or congee. It is a smooth and comforting bowl of heaven - not too many more ways to explain it.  It is a subtle dish with simple flavors meant to heal. Good thing I planned on sharing and that I ordered the large because the entire table went nuts over it. P.S I order it with the soft tofu rather than fried - it is just a preference, but I think it makes a world of difference.


Then, despite having a huge list of things I wanted to try (aka the casserole, Laab, any of their fried rice dishes, Banh-Xeo, a dessert, and more.....) I had to go out with the first dish I ever ordered.......


Drum roll please..... the King Soup - or as I like to describe it as a Pho with coconut milk and much more spice! We all know I love coconut, love a creamy dish, and we LOVE spice - so win was always written all over this dish! Oh, and did I mention that they can make it gluten-free, vegan and it comes in a GIANT bowl for under 15!?


A friend of mine did order the new dish, Bamboo Stew (gang-naw-mai) which is bamboo shoots mixed with pumpkin and mushrooms (very earthy) and served with their famous sticky rice. Note, while this dish is not marked gluten-free, I am sure that if you ask, they are able to modify it for us gluten-free folks! 


In conclusion, it has been real Vientiane Cafe and I will certainly be back to visit! In the meantime, keep making some more awesome additions to your menu and oh, if any of my readers try the other dishes on my wish list, PLEASE SEND ME REVIEWS!


Until next time.


Oh, and check out all my other reviews of Vientiane Cafe below:
http://gf-flamingo.blogspot.com/

Love this location. My favorite and just around the block from me. I really could have sworn I have left multiple reviews of this place but apparently I have been to busy eating to do so.

Best part of this location... FAST and great service, the prices are lower than all of the other locations (i can just be imagining that) and everything tastes way better

Con: they literally never have maque choux, which is my favorite dish there.


must do's : hot sauces, peanut butter pie, sour cream-onion-cheese combo - worth it
I believe the owner greeted me at the door. She was rude and threatened service if I didn't get gel. The quality received is not worth the price.

I went to the old Sunset Grille location at sunrise this morning to give Biscuit Love a try. I shared several intimate lunches over the years at Sunset Grille with native Nashvillian, John Siegenthaler. So the location holds special memories for me. I was apprehensive about visiting the "super hip" and "trendy" Biscuit Love for fear of having to stand in line with tourists and hipsters with their beards w/ wool skullcaps that have become the rage in determining local restaurants success. I found neither. 

The place was quiet, the staff super friendly and "loving". Reasonably priced, for Nashville, the food was awesome. The coffee was intense and I am sure sourced "locally". I really enjoyed it. As I sat there thinking about my last lunch with John, I could see that this would have been a place we would have enjoyed together. A win for the locals, the tourists, and the beards! Watch out Pancake Pantry, there is a new breakfast joint in "the Village"!

Wonderful atmosphere, friendly staff, and a delicious menu make The Love a top Center City pick. 
The warm and slightly salty Parker House rolls, delicious pasta second course as a savory starter, followed by the entrees. Tasty. If you are a fan of grits and collard greens, don't miss 'em. They are excellent. Dessert was green tea sorbet that was light and a happy ending to the meal.
When I order nachos from a restaurant I expect the cheese to be grated cheese, not  the liquid dispense from a nozzle movie theater variety. Gross
Had some for a building holiday party. Very good food. Meatballs and sweet potato's were delicious

Avoid!  

Pulled up here for a quick oil change and couldn't even get help.  

Some unfriendly, unsavory type rattled off a dozen excuses about how none of his bays were working and he had a car in front of me that would take 45-minutes.  I reminded him they closed in 45-minutes and he just stared at me.  Then he asked, "Is there a problem?"  Uh, yeah.  Your inclmpetence and your attitude, dude.

All their outdoor lights are burned out, the place looks ragged . . . avoid!

Great color selection. Good prices. Friendly staff. If you don't want to destroy your nails with gel, they have weekly polish for a few $ more than a regular manicure that lasts about 10 days. Very clean, and you get a drink with your service. All good things!

We came here on a Sunday evening around 730 and had 7 people in our party with chicken tender , club sandwich and grilled chicken orders and it took 50 minutes to get our food and it was missing 2 people's side items . While it wasn't the waitress's fault she also didn't attempt to recitify the situation and we saw her a total of 3 times during our wait with one of those being when she took our drink and food order. The manager did take 2 entrees off the Bill but we won't ever be going back .
Received as a gift. Was told the products were all natural. I looked at the label and they are filled with parabens and other chemicals. Very disappointing!

What a great find! Great family owned, local spot! Took a chance during a busy Saturday and so glad we did. The food was fantastic. Husband and I split the cinnamon bun french toast with the homemade sausage and the spinach omelet. Yum! Owner and staff were super kind and personable. Great family vibes!

Sarah is amazing. I had a great night singing with the red piano and having fantastic drinks. Come here for a break from shopping or just passing by. This bar is great the people are friendly & Amazing.  Definitely coming again! Thank you l!

I ordered the steak bowl with some flour tortillas, the meal was okay. The tortillas was small, the bowl will be enough for you to get full for lunch. This spot would be ideal if you want to grab something on the go for lunch but you don't really care how good it taste. The steak itself is thinly cut and little or no seasoning on it. If you dine in they have complimentary tortilla chips but when I was there it wasn't refilled. It can get packed during lunch hours so if you're planning to dine in with more than four people, I suggest you come a bit early to grab some tables. Would I come back? Most likely not, I rather go elsewhere.

We recently moved to the Tampa area from Austin and have been searching for a good place for wings and football. We found our new home!!

North 30 is not very convenient to where we live (Northdale), but worth the trip. The hot naked wings are excellent! Not obnoxiously spicy, but perfect amount of heat.

The number of tv's and variety is just what we are looking for. And the staff is very friendly.
I had the short rib and had a taste of the sautéed scallops from my wife's dish along with sharing the cheese platter. It was delicious

Wow. So I emailed a request for 18 powdered jelly filled donuts. I spoke with Ellen  and confirmed 6 raspberry, 6 strawberry, and 6 lemon to be picked up Saturday at 10:30. I drive in and lo and behold, NO DONUTS!!! Yes, apologies, but this is embarrassing! Thanks for nothing. This is no way to run a business. This is inexcusable. If I could give less than 1 star I would.

First time here.  The atmosphere is nice.  Busy spot. 
Pros: Wonderful menu,  amazing - delicious food, generous portions,  friendly - good wait staff, outdoor seating. 
Cons: You have to pay to park - no validat ing, limited outdoor seating. 

Summary: Overall a good place to eat. Nice for brunch as well.  Needs better parking or offer validating.

Salty's is great!  The service is awesome, really friendly and enthusiastic and completely welcoming to the swarms of tourists like us.
The shrimp appetizer was a bummer, just warm shrimp with old bay floating in a bowl of water.  The water was yucky and distilled the flavor, so these really should be served dry.
The fish and shrimp tacos were both really great and nice and full of seafood. Drink specials were good, and the sour/midori margarita was delicious.

Ho. Ly. Crap. This is place is unlike any place I've ever been in my life. It's huge. It's got everything you need. W didn't even spend the night. We just walked around the place for hours. So much stuff to see and do. And it's a great location in relation to other attractions in Nashville, if you ever get bored here, which is unlikely. We will definitely be back to spend a few nights.

Originally was headed to get food elsewhere but they were fortuitously closed so our group headed here for lunch.  What a great place!  Unpretentious. Super friendly. Absolutely delicious Po boys and drinks. Those bloody Mary's and beer in a large chalice were key.  Katey, our server, was precious. She made this place even more enjoyable! Would highly recommend!

We stumbled upon this hidden gem one day while mattress shopping. I googled mattress stores in the area and this came up. And boy are we glad we stopped by! Victor was amazing at helping us find just the right mattress. I felt like Harry Potter in Ollivander's wand shop, as Victor dug through his stash looking for just the right one for us. Not only was the mattress we bought hundreds of $$ cheaper than what we would've paid anywhere else, but it is the most amazing mattress we've ever slept on. We've never slept better, and I mean that!! I highly recommend stopping by to see Victor. If he's not there, call the number on the door.

Sandwiches and sides during lunch were OK but we had poor service. After our server delivered our food he never did check back with us. Finally had to flag him down to get what we needed. In the past Cheddar's was enjoyable but the last few visits haven't been.
The food is very good but the prices seem too high unless you get their lunch special.  Service can be a little slow too but the food is great so just order take out.

It's been a while since I've visited a BJs and coming back it did not disappoint from what I remembered.

First visited in the South, this time it seemed like best option around the outlet.

Tasty and huge salads is what I remembered. And it still is!

The staff were friendly and place is spacious. They have a very large variety of beer. It's not your hipster placed of beer, just simple beer of different varieties that could be passed off as craft.

They have coloring for kids. And a lot of babies and kids seem to frequent here.

I was really excited to try this place since it's the first place I've heard of that has boba, Thai rolled ice cream, and crepes. It's about a 15 minute drive from USF campus and the GPS doesn't take you to the exact location which is within a large shopping plaza next to Aldi's market. 

There weren't that many flavors of boba besides the staple flavors. I opted to try was the galaxy tea which came in four flavors: Passionfruit, mango, strawberry, and lychee. It comes in a plastic light bulb cup and has basil seeds already included. The drink tasted similar to lemonade and was very sweet (most likely because I chose passion fruit). It was interesting to taste but I wouldn't order it again. The crepe menu has about 8 options you can choose from sweet or savory concoctions. I ordered the fruit crepe that had blueberries, strawberries, bananas, and kiwi. I was really disappointed that my crepe was cold when I got it and the filling was mediocre. The fruits were fresh but the crepe itself was chewy and bland so It wasn't enjoyable to eat. 

Overall, I feel like this place has potential if they were to improve the quality of the crepe and had a larger drink selection.

I don't do five star rating often, but this place is great if you are a cigar smoker. I treated a few friends to a cigar and then enjoyed the lounge for an hour while we smoked. It was a perfect experience. 

The staff knows everything about cigars and helped my friends make some great selections. 

We stayed past closing... they did not care. What a great shop.

Chef-made barbecue. Bold flavors and unique sides. They use premium meats, and cook everything precisely and brilliantly. These are not attributes of a typical barbecue place. 

You get what you pay for, and therefore their prices are higher than typical places. For about $15 you get a reasonable meal. I'm not a huge eater but never seem to have leftovers.

This is barbecue for foodies, not cheap eats like most bbq places. 

I definitely recommend it and prefer it, but my wife likes more traditional and generous bbq. 

Treat yourself and give it a shot!

A tragic facedown fall yesterday left my iPhone 6S screen shattered. After thorough research, I found this location to be both the most reasonably priced and best-rated option. I got almost a dozen quotes within a 15 miles radius and Experimac was the only one that cost under $70, provided both the glass and LCD replacement, and didn't require an appointment.

I decided to bring my phone in at lunch and pick it up in the afternoon. I had never been before, but when I went in, the store was very clean, well organized and pleasant to be in! Justin said he'd get started on my phone right away so I decided to wait for it. It was repaired in about 20 minutes and they even threw in a glass protector screen for free.

Their products come with warranties and are clearly high quality. The people at the store are pleasant and helpful! If you find a lower price for the same repair service, I have a feeling they'd be willing to match it.

So glad I got my phone fixed instead of paying an exorbitant amount for a replacement!

Great lunch deals on weekdays. I got this lunch combo for $7.50.  A choice of entree, soup, an egg roll, a piece of fruit and  salad.     I don't think any other restaurant can beat this deal. Food and service was good.

I came here for a work dinner and we all enjoyed ourselves. Our service was pretty good! He was really nice and answered our questions but he did offer to go over the specials. I mean the specials were listed at the table but I thought It was weird he didn't say anything about them. The waiter said the rigatoni was their most popular dish, so naturally I ordered It. I thought It was good but safe, It wasn't busting with flavor. My coworker ordered the octopus ink pasta and said he felt like It was undercooked. Overall, I enjoyed the restaurant and I would go back!

Food: 2 / 5 Stars

The Breakfast Poutine: (4 / 5 Stars) The real highlight of today's brunch was my friend's Breakfast Poutine - I stole a few bites. The Poutine had a rich flavor and was very satisfying. 

The Duck Confit: (? / 5 Stars) Did not try but was told that the dish tasted great. 

Smoked Salmon Beni: (0 / 5 Stars) Although I was looking forward to my dish, the Smoked Salmon Beni was a huge disappointment. Not only was the salmon in small supply, it tasted like over-cooked frozen salmon rather than smoked salmon as advertised (definitely not a deal with the $12.00 price tag that comes along with it). Even though the eggs, potatoes, and other fixings of the dish tasted great, the core aspect of the dish was severely lacking - especially compared to the other items ordered at the restaurant. I was able to use hot sauce to mask the flavor of the fish. 

------------------------------------------------

Location: (Not a factor in the rating)

Prep & Pastry is a very nice and aesthetic looking restaurant. There are a lot of places to park even if the lot is full and we only waited about 30 min on a Holiday Sunday at noon. 

------------------------------------------------

Service: 5 / 5 Stars

The servers were very nice and accommodating at the restaurant. Additionally, they were thorough on ensuring that the kitchen staff was notified of my allergy to nuts. 

------------------------------------------------

Overall: 3.5 / 5 Stars 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience at Prep & Pastry and will most likely return to try some of their other food offerings; however, I will be avoiding their Smoked Salmon Beni.

I really wish they wouldn't put BBQ in their name. I hail from Memphis, so I am a bbq snob. This is NOT bbq! I like their brisket, cornbread, and Mac and cheese, but if you want real BBQ, go somewhere else.
Always a pleasure to come here. Relaxing and such a great pedicure. They make you feel so relaxed while pampering you.
Rude, rude, rude! Hung up on me on the phone twice when I was asking about wait time. Food can't be their redeeming quality if you never get that far.
Stopped in for lunch. Had the patty melt. Like most places all bun and no meat. Homemade chips are delicious though. Atmosphere and service was great.
We love the rolled ice cream here! The choice of toppings is also a big hit with the kids. A nice change from those other ice cream shops.

This was my first time having Soup Dumplings outside of NYC and I was very impressed. It's kind of a hole in the wall, but the food was excellent. I had the Chicken Dumplings and my friend had the pork. She had previously lived in China and said they were very authentic. I would go lunch as it isn't the most filling of food, but I would definitely go back!

This is my favorite restaurant! My husband and I go to Nirvana Indian Bistro every chance we get. We've probably tried the entire menu at this point and it's all fantastic. The owner is the nicest guy and he's very health-conscious, so you never need to feel bad about ordering extra! The staff are all incredibly helpful and attentive. Don't forget to order orange kulfi for dessert!

With a reservation from start to finish was over 75 minutes for an acrylic fill in.  The polish was tacky and never dried. I ruined my manicure on the way home.  I had to take it off when I got home and paint them again. Maybe it was old polish but that is not what I paid for

This place is awesome! The mimosas were strong, the chicken and waffles are hands down the best I've ever tried, and the coffee was perfect (i also had the Smores latte and my tastebuds were very happy). The only downside is that the wait was pretty long but well worth it. Best of all, it's right around the corner from the angel wings mural so during the wait we stopped by to snap a photo.
I have been coming to this salon for years. Every stylist is super qualified and fun to talk with. Rodney the owner is always around and remembers all clients names

Okay so I have to start this review by saying (1) that the food was actually really good and (2) that this was one of the weirdest experiences of our entire lives.

We came here to use my $30 off birthday certificate and it was also our first time at Benihana.  We'd been to Hibachi before so somewhat knew what to expect but went into it with no expectations.  We sat down with two other couples and immediately knew this was going to be a weird night.  The couple next to us told us that they were regulars and came roughly once/week so we leaned on them for guidance and expertise.  I ordered the Rocky's choice and my husband got the teriyaki steak - both were good but the problem was our experience.  Immediately my water was overfilled and the woman to the other side of the table made a huge deal about it and we knew that they were going to be persnickity and make all of the servers and chefs very flustered and because of that my husband and I just tried to smile, laugh and enjoy our date night and not pay attention to them.  They went on to correct the chef multiple times during his presentation, tell the servers that they were getting them the incorrect sauces, extra dressings, multiple waters and sodas even if they weren't finished with the ones that they had (people, i tried to tell you that this was the weirdest experience we've ever had).  With how shaken the staff was, our presentation was not the best and our food wasn't cooked properly because the chef had to cater to this couples ridiculous demands (more butter, cooked more, i want my vegetables and meat mixed together, cut my meat in the opposite direction).... and then the weirdest part was that the couple ordered an additional steak which when the server went through to ensure that our orders were accurate was never brought up but then when the couple didn't receive it at the end of the meal were OUTRAGED.  To the point where the manager came over and assured them and guaranteed that he put the steak on the plate himself (he didn't) and they called his bluff and everyone got even more uncomfortable.  phew.  Now they forgot my white rice as well as the entire table's ice cream and tea and gave us the incorrect check twice.  The bathroom floors were incredibly sticky and gross and two people at our table had to request new flatware or plates because they weren't cleaned properly.  This review is after a dinner on a Monday night so maybe it was just an off time for this crew and I know that the customers were not helping the cause but we're not willing to try again to find out if it was just a fluke.

My favorite brunch spot in Tucson!!! Always the nicest servers and most unique food. I haven't found a brunch spot that balances sweet and savory like Prep. I have gotten the duck confit twice now which is saying something because before prep & pastry I had never tried duck before! Pro tip make sure you spring for a dossant it's well worth it.

At one point in time, The Foodery was the ONLY place to go for mixed six-packs of good quality craft beer. The times, however, have changed rapidly. The Foodery has not!

This Foodery still hasn't decided whether it wants to be a bodega or a bottle shop, which in a store that small means that there's not a lot of room to walk around. Once you get more than 5 people in the store, you're literally pressed up against each other as you try to open the fridge doors. If you go before 4pm, you'll have room to shop, but the staff the works during the day don't know shit about beer, including one woman who doesn't drink beer at all. The night time staff is more on the ball.

There are literally dozens of other bottle shops now that have better selection and lower prices (Beer Heaven, Beer Love, the Bottle Shop, Pennsport Beer Boutique, the Beer Peddlers, etc.), so it's not worth it to pay the extra $5-$10 per bottle unless you're really, really lazy. It's especially galling when you consider that they own their own beer distributor, Global, but are still overcharging you.

Overall: Grassfed Missouri raised cow with homemade patties! Can you ask for more?

Ambience: This place is located in a busy corner of downtown STL. Parking is street only, just like most places in downtown. When you come inside, you'll notice, this restaurant is pretty big. You almost never need a reservation but it is good to have one for larger parties. The crowd is here everything from families to college friends to tourists.

Food: The place offers Missouri raised grass fed beef. So you know you're getting good stuff. If you're not into beef, their chicken burgers are also really good. I will say though their vegetarian patties aren't as flavorful. I have been to very few burger places that can do a good veggie patty. After all, this is a burger joint. We hope you didn't come here for veggie patty. We asked for ketchup and they had a house made version. I'll say, I'm not a fan of it. It tastes like puree than ketchup. The sauces on burgers could use some inspiration. They have the basics such as siracha, mayo, mustard, bbq... But if you really want to set your burger apart, step up your game on the sauce!

Drinks: They have a pretty nice bar with TVs, if you're looking for a place to eat by yourself. With that said their spiked shakes are pretty awesome. If you haven't, you should try their normal shakes and ice cream too!

Service: It was pretty busy when we came here, yet the service was fast. Our server cared for what we wanted and checked up on us a few times.

Price: $12-$14 for a burger with no sides is alright. You could throw fries with it and charge extra for other sides such as sweet potato fries or onion rings. Still can't complain.
If u need a little history on IPA etc. Frank is your guy! Great food & one of the largest variety of cold brews I've ever seen in a local spot.

We found a cock reach in the bathroom and trash had not been emptied. We asked for other room and they showed us two others, one that had ceiling flakes all over the bathroom counter and floor, and the other with a nasty stench. The lady showing the room said that they flakes were from the room being painted recently and didn't offer to clean it and expected to stay there. Supposedly it is under new management and they're renovating soon but I wouldn't stay there until they do. They would not offer a refund for the one night we had checked in to so we will definitely be calling corporate to complain.

Exquisite. We went here for the second time this fall since they started the chef's menu. We'd been to Vetri a few times in the past, when it was a fabulous, traditional Italian restaurant and it was great then. This is food, wine and service taken to a new level. On both occasions we had the wine pairing and it was spot on perfect with the courses. We started both times with a palate teaser from the chef which promised the joys of what was to come. Unlike most multi course chef's offerings (such as Alinea in Chicago) Vetri actually gives you a choice of dishes within a limited range of beautifully prepared courses. We opted to have the chef choose for us both times so that we could taste what he thought was interesting and so that we could share each other's plates. When I say that this rivals the best restaurants that I've ever been to, it is not an exaggeration. The blend of flavors in each course and plate was magnificent.
In addition, we had the same wait person both times and he paid meticulous attention to us and was friendly and understated. Such a pleasure. Finally, one could actually have a lovely conversation here. It had a pleasant low level vibe without intruding on conversation. For those of us who hate loud restaurants, it was heaven. Vetri is pricey, so it's not an everyday, casual kind of place. But you get what you pay for.

We had great service, the grouper was really good and very fresh.  Wasn't crazy about the potatoes. It's very casual,  you get served on wood seafood plates, hasn't been updated since they took over from last place.  It was an older crowd there. They had  live band on Friday. A little overpriced but good food.  Key west martini was amazing.

The ambiance was lovely. So nice to be able to have a conversation in a restaurant. Having said this ---- Terrible service. We were sitting for 25 minutes before the waiter came to get drink orders. I had to ask the hostess to light a fire under him. Not that the young man wasn't nice. He just was poorly trained and slow. Looking around it seemed as if all the servers were away from the tables and out of the dining room most of the time. Back in the kitchen perhaps? Certainly not attending to our needs. At this price point I expect more and have gotten better service almost anywhere else in Philly. 
The food was just OK. My husband and I had the prime rib. I've had it elsewhere in Philly for a lot less and it's been comparable flavor wise. My friend had salmon which, again, was OK. The sides were OK. Nothing special. When it came time for coffee it was not presented with cream or sugar and when the sugar came, there was no teaspoon with which to stir it into the coffee. Don't know what the rave reviews are all about because we won't be back.

This place is great. The staff is friendly and fun. My son wanted to try and they got him set and and learning quickly and safely. Will be coming back! Recommend to anyone in the reno area looking for a fun way to spend the afternoon.

SO GREAT!

From the drinks, to the bread, to the main course everything was great and seasoned perfectly.  I really enjoyed the filet mignon and parmesan risotto. The only thing I didn't care for was the garlic mash.. they seemed dry and the presentation was bad.. literally looked like it came out of an ice cream scoop.  But honestly this was super minor compared to how great everything else was.  I will definitely be back!

Everything we had was great, filet, truffle fries, bbq shrimp and redfish.  Len was our server and was so personable or and friendly.  Even if the food had only been ok, I would go back for his service.  Brought our kids balloons and was just so attentive to our table and others.  Highly recommend!!

I have to agree with majority of other Yelpers here - the quality of both the food & customer service are way off. I ordered a buffalo chicken wrap & sweet potato fries & the delivery man practically threw it onto my porch like a newspaper. The flour wrap was stiff & tasted kind of stale & the sweet potato fries were way undercooked. I have had their lasagna before & really liked it so maybe I'll stop in & try that to see if redemption is possible.

Cracker Barrel rarely disappoints. Wish there was one on Long Island. Went with a party of 4 and ordered the special cinnamon French toast special. It was as good as advertised. The wait for a table was a bit long but the food was fast and the waitress attentive.
Boyfriend and I were in Tampa for New Year's Eve weekend and had a great experience. Fun conversation and delicious food. Would deff come again.

These are some of the BEST cookies I have ever had. I bought a six pack of snickerdoodles and chocolate chips and ate them up faster than I should have. They are gooey and warm and definitely don't skimp on quality. I can't wait to go back and try an ice cream sandwich! I would recommend this place over Insomnia Cookies.
Best Donuts in St. Pete! Highly recommend to all. The customer service is top notch and prices are great as well. My favorite is the double chocolate donut. I think I could eat about 50 of them.

Delicious chicken and po boys. I've been eating at Chubbies for over  33 years and still crave it all the time. Very tasty and good sized fried chicken. Good dirty rice. Best roast beef Poboy and oyster Poboy you will ever taste. Great fried seafood. One of the best hot sausage Poboys in the city. Reasonable prices. Designed mostly for take out. Small dining area and no bathroom. Overall very good food.
I come here regularly for manicures, pedicures, & some waxing. Love Phong & Tram! Good selection of gel colors. Great attention to detail :)

The building is beautiful inside and out. The place is First Class with all fresh made,in house dishes. We had a large party but our food came out in a timely manner and was hot. Everyone enjoyed what they ordered and the service was great! We will definitely be back next time we are in Reno!!

I freaking love this place. The food and drinks are alway top notch.  The jukebox has amazing tunes and the service is fun, friendly and I just want to take them home.  They rock.  Don't miss out. Go here and tip well they deserve it.
We tried this place while we were in town and really liked all the food. We ordered the burger and wings. You can't go wrong eating here! The staff was very nice and helpful with the menu!

Easiest 5 stars I've given in a while. I got the grilled ham n cheese with egg on top. Omg I savored every bite. My wife got the raclette Patty melt and it was luscious and perfect. Beers were on point too. Just eat here.

Went about 1am after Lady Gaga concert on 12-1-2017 for something to eat. The woman that waited on us was pleasant however coffee was not hot just warm and as we are sitting eating our breakfast a small roach appear at the end of the table. I kill it with a napkin and proceed to finish my meal when another roach appear. Was not able to finish eating.  Upon paying the lady at the cash register provided a discount since I almost finish my food. Was not happy at all with this. Its a shame since I live nearby and have eaten here before, don't think I will again.
This is a really cute place!!! We love the customer service and the food is really good! We also had coffee and tea. Would totally recommend this place!!!

Came in town for a friends wedding had been here a very long time ago and i hadnt realized how good this place waa until i tried it again this morning! You are going to have a wait so be prepared to wait or get there super early. I got there about 930 on saturday morning and had to wait about 15-20 mins to get seated. After having a hard time deciding between the sweet potato pancakes and the cinnamon spice i decided to go with the sweet potatoe and lets just say hands down you have to try those! Even if you aren't a big sweet potatoe fan you will love these!! I cant wait to come back to Nashville just to try these. My girl had the blueberry pancake it was still great just no as good as mine! Def worth the hype and give it a try if you are in town

Only giving two stars because the decor was nice. We were there for Sunday brunch and it was literally the worst brunch I have ever had in my entire life. I will recommend to go to a diner for more quality food. I got the 8th st egg Benedict and it was came with two very small pieces of eggs on English muffin plus a weird green salad and bland meshed potato on the side. Boy, their cook couldn't even poach eggs. The Egg was hard and solid inside, not runny at all. The ham was dark and over cooked. Too much acidity in their bearaise. Overall worst egg Benedict I ve ever had. They can't even do it better than a causal diner. My husband ordered the chicken and waffle. The chicken was in pale color and has no flavor. KFC chicken is much better than that! The waffle has the same pale color as the chicken with minimum flavor and very soggy. I think it's easy to surpass that with just your home waffle maker. Overall, save your money and go to a diner instead!!

This is the best lunch spot in the area. Everything is made fresh, so it's easier for them to customize dishes for dietary restrictions. I became vegan in July 2017, and they've been so accommodating! My favorite dish is the tofu teriyaki and yaki udon. You can't go wrong with the Traditional or tacos or hot chicken if that's your thing.

This is the WORST D&B I have ever visited. The restaurant was filthy, with napkins, food and other trash all over the floor. The food was cold. The waitress ignored us while she cleaned liquor bottles for 10 minutes and we had to ask for assistance. When we asked for the manager, he was rude and dismissive. Don't waste your time!

My daughter and I drove to Tampa just for the night. We walked to Besito. The food was amazing, but the service was even better. If you go, ask for Andy and give him an awesome tip. He gave exceptional service!! Tell him Ananda from Tennessee sent you. :)
The staff is wonderful, the coffee is great, and the concept is different. An Indonesian cafe right in the heart of fishtown!

A local and tourist favorite near the Vanderbilt Campus in Nashville. Lots of street parking nearby, but we snagged a spot in the small lot behind the building (still had to pay though). We arrived around 9 on a Tuesday and there was no wait, we were seated immediately. Their website also has a pancake cam to check the line before you venture out! As much as I wanted to love their food, the pancakes did not stand out to me. I will admit I had the pigs in blankets so I didn't try any of the gourmet flavors but the plain buttermilk were standard pancakes. My sisters had the small appetite plate and it was just the right portion.

This place is delicious! Consistently. Their smoothies are amazing, sandwhichs and wraps are well balanced and delicious, their salads are flavorful, though a bit wet towards the end. Friendly service. Be mindful of lunch time as it can take quite some time to get your food but if you order ahead, you'll be fine! LOVE this place.

All I have to say is BEST FRENCH TOAST EVER. Seriously. If you think you need their pancakes, you don't. You need their French toast. Also the service is wonderful and quick since everyone is basically ready to order as soon as they sit down. And again. THE FRENCH TOAST.

I love the menu,but im a local an i been here many times and there is never a good satisfying  good welcome or would u like to oreder!! Nothing not even a hi! Just a straight face!! Love love the items on the menu!!! But costumers service sucks !!!    
 Worst part!!! When i ask for a container to go! The cashier did not even bother to strive to make up for the straight face! Without a word she just pointed at the to go containers!!!!

Room smells like cigarette smoke, Dog in room 505 or 504, barked all night, No towels, no room service in two days. Clogged up bathroom sink, with someone's hair Ana no toilet paper in bathroom... slow .. very slow elevators... Come on guys you can do better then this. The Super 8 is better then this.... very disappointing...
Guess you need to be a local. Service sucks, meals take forever. Not like the Pinocchio's from the past. I won't be coming back. Enjoy if your a local. Don't visit if your a stranger.

I LOVE the food and drinks here, I've never had anything I didn't like. My favorite is the grilled cheese, mixing apples and cheese is my favorite, so this sandwich is a hit for me. The decor is awesome as well, very unique and and fun. What I find really disappointing is the service. The past few times I've been in I've had the same male server who has been less than stellar. We wait maybe 10 minutes to give an order, waited 30 minutes for our first drinks, and then another 20 for the check. I would have loved to order a couple more drinks and maybe some desert, but waiting on the server 30 minutes per drink is something I don't have time for. The other staff seemed to be working really hard and even helped us out a little when our server was no where to be found, I wish I would have had one of them instead.

So I went to this location because I had the feeling that this location would not try to get over and be perfectly honest...I went there for a noise in my steering wheel. They told me they didn't find anything wrong. So I picked my car up, noise still there. I pointed it out they put it right up and told me it was my rack pinon  costing around $1,500 -$1,800 dollars with labor, parts, etc. Mind you I just brought my car probably three weeks ago. I said scratch that and took it to the Hyundai dealer and got the car fully inspected. I did not, I repeat did not need a new rack and pinon!!!! It was my coupler or however you spell it in the steer wheel that was worn out. Want to know how much it cost me? $0.00 under warranty. Now if I was naive I would have handed over that money to Pep Boys for no reason. I don't know if they were trying to take advantage because I am a woman but I wasn't for it. I won't be returning because of the misinformation. Nice customer service though! That's not enough.
Friendly owner and great atmosphere. Food is decent for the area. Will definitely visit again

Love this place. Good food and pleasant servers. 
Pancakes are wonderful as well as the California BLT.
St. Louis stable! So yummy and reasonably priced!!

I had the Bello Manicure which includes masks and stuff and tried dip gel for first time. Came in at noon on a Tuesday and only 2 other guests there. Very nice place and good customer service. The dip cracked on one nail about 2 days later but I blame myself as I was lifting boxes - it was my first dip so I don't know what to expect.
This is our second time to order . The shrimp taco was always great, the rest of the meat choices was dry.
Pizza...too small too much had better way better especially for the $$. Like wood fired pizza but not into cremated crust.
Awesome. Had the eggs Benedict. Hollandaise sauce was perfect. Don't miss this place.

This is one of my favorite places to eat in New Orleans. I make it a point to get the combination plate with gumbo and Red Beans and rice. They are as good as you will find anywhere in NOLA. The atmosphere is great. We the doors open you can hear the sounds of Jackson Square. I highly recommend this to everyone.
Awesome your!  mike is one of the best story tellers we've come across!  So worth it!
Totally recommend this place. If I lived here I would probably stop in once a week. The Bloody Mary was one of the best I've had and the sandwiches were killer!!

Visiting New Orleans for the first time... my sister had a taste for oysters and we found this place here, so we decided to try it.... turned out to be amazing. I order oysters, crab mac and cheese, and southern greens, everything was delicious!!!!

We had a great experience here. Nkechi, our waitress was great! & her recommendation to start with a cinnamon roll or biscuit sounded so good. We had both.  We plan on coming back the next time we are in Nashville.

We ate here on a Friday night and had a great time!

Our service was the best we've had anywhere in a long time. Christina was super nice and helpful as well as attentive to us. Great food and drinks as well. 

Located in a good spot on the strip next to a few hotels, you can't beat something this good within walking distance. They have a lot of seating which is always nice (and a good sign).

I had the shrimp tacos which were amazing. They were sweeter than I normally like, as I normally like spicy, but they were delicious. They had jicama coleslaw with pineapple in it. The sauce on top really perfected it.

My husband had the blackened grouper sandwich which was cooked perfectly. 

Definitely recommend!

Let's get this out of the way right now: it's pronounced "Ah-vuh" NOT "Ay-vuh" a fact that distinguishes the restaurant from the young lady it is named after.  I have been to Ava plenty of times but never wrote a review prior to now...it's time to spread the love! 

My first experience at Ava was during Creative Loafing's Restaurant Week Tampa Bay in 2015. Since then I've been to Ava several times, mostly for dinner with family and friends and sometimes for lunch. I've also visited Ava to pick up food as an UberEats delivery person.  

Having visited Ava several times, I am certain about a few loves: 

1. The ambiance. It's perfect -- lively yet romantic; trendy yet comfortable. Ava offers al fresco dining (covered outdoor seating) as well as a variety of table styles inside (from classy high tops to traditional table seating). Be sure to ask about the "Secret Dining Room" if you're in need of a reservation for at least 10 guests! 

2. The Casarecce al Pomodoro. I love to order this dish with extra ricotta and sometimes, if I'm feeling frisky, with the Nduja sausage (this is a spicy sausage which is different from the fennel sausage). 

3. The Ava House Salad. It's a bit on the pricy side at $8.00, but the ingredients (mixed greens, cucumber, radish, tomato, red onion tossed in a house Italian vinaigrette) offer the perfect explosion of flavors pre-entree.

4. Joe Maddon. He is part owner of Ava and he is former manager of the Tampa Bay Rays...so duh, he is a love.

Also, for solo diners, Ava is one restaurant that has an incredibly welcoming bar that erases all of the unnecessary shame in dining alone. Trust me, I've done it time and time again.  :)

Deserves zero stars.  Their staff can't handle basic requests, they never deliver on what they promise (download codes, freebies, merc, etc), and yet have attitude like no others.  Really CID, time to reassess why your "product" keeps getting worse - otherwise you're just the fraud you appear to be.

I've been meaning to come here for the longest time and I'm so glad I finally did! It's a hole in the wall and the menu is very minimal, so you know that they've perfected every item. I got the beef bap and the sauce is so good, they have a bottle of sauce if you'd like to add more. You can dine in or take out. The inside is a cute little spot and the man taking orders was very sweet. As you can see I killed the bowl.

This is easily the best cuban sandwich, pastelito and espresso i have ever had. the espresso shot is included with your meal, which is a nice touch and a nice caffeine postwould definitely recommend and will be back for more!

The staff was extremely nice, the service superb and fast!  Was visiting and got a bit sick of all the fried foods.  I'm Vietnamese so pho is always a staple and nice to have as an option when you're dehydrated from non stop adult beverages!  Went here with the husband and friend.  The pho was good and I also enjoyed the Vietnamese coffee. The atmosphere is super cute.

The place makes you miserable... The only good thing about it is the music. The prices make no sense and the owner is always feeling the need to introduce himself to his customers and to bother them. My friends and I certainly couldn't enjoy our stay here.

We were in town visiting and looking for something fun to do. Liveminds was our answer, and what an amazing adventure it was!

This was the second escape room type place I've been to. Liveminds goes above and beyond anything similar. It was comparable to being on a movie set. The experience was all immersive and each and every little detail was carefully thought out. From the decor to the sound effects- I was blown away! 

We chose to do Treasure of Pacari. We had a small group (4)  of varying ages and everyone had a blast. This specific room felt challenging but also doable (that just right level of difficulty). 

Each second we spent inside made us feel like we were indeed exploring ancient ruins in search for the item! 

If you are looking for a fun birthday plan or something new to do on a Friday night in the Nashville or Franklin area, I highly recommend Liveminds! I can't wait to go back and try one of the other rooms. Thank you for an awesome experience!

We were a bit scared to order food here. The place had some stale smell. But, we decided to be brace & order food anyway since we were starving & felt lazy to find another place. Ceviche is awesome. Would go there again. Burrito & quesadilla were good too. Very reasonable too. Good food & portion!

I've used ANCO for 28 years. Not often, thank goodness.

But they've always been reliable, trustworthy and knowledgeable.

I called yesterday, December 1, kinda late in the afternoon. It wasn't an emergency, so I didn't need overnight or weekend service. But they said I could get service Saturday, which is today. Wowee!

The battery in my garage-door opener was depleted and making insipid yet piercing BEEPS. This is continual. It happened before -- in 2012.

This is IN THE GARAGE. I can hear the beeps in the house. You can only go so far with this situation without pulling a Jack Nicholson.

IMO, you need the battery. It's there so you can use your garage door when the electricity's out. I went through this conversation in 2012 with Greg.

Today, Greg came again.

I got a call ~8 a.m. giving me an 11 a.m.-1 p.m. window. Very tight. Very good and very much appreciated.

And Greg called after his previous appointment to say he was on his way.

Greg arrived ~11:15 a.m., and we had the same conversation about the need for the battery. I opted to get a new battery . . . my luck being the electricity would go out tonight right when I want to go to the grocery.

He totally understood and proceeded to replace the battery.

THEN I mentioned how the two light bulbs quit working after a few ups and downs of the garage door. I'm thinking it's vibration that loosens them, and then they don't come on. And Greg confirmed that is the problem.

Greg had tips on this conundrum. He asked me how tightly I tighten them. I said loosely. He said tighten them as tightly as you can. Wear a glove, in case the bulb breaks. THAT'S how tightly to screw in the bulbs.

He took out my bulbs, filed them (to get back down to the core), used a screwdriver in the socket -- yes, electricity was turned off -- to reduce debris and then blew into the sockets to get rid of the detritus.

BINGO!!!!! Both lights worked.

Greg knows of what he speaks.

I got a new battery. I got big tips from Greg re the lightbulbs. $199. Check this one off the list, and I don't have to pull a Jack Nicholson.
I came in with pretty high expectations about there pizza.   I do have to say that I'm pretty disappointed with it. The atmosphere was Great. Since, being from the Chicago area. My search continues..

Please go here. Everything was incredible. The bartenders were amazing. Lee waited on us and made our Anniversary Celebration. He was so attentive, entertaining, and knowledgeable. The food was spectacular. We will be back. I wish I could give them 6 stars and Lee 7

Good eatery.  Very crowded but the food was filling and delicious.  We went to Sabrinas with family on a Sunday for brunch and it did not disappoint.
Fast, friendly service.  Decent prices.

This is a double restaurant. During the day it seems to be a brunch place and in the evening they are brazillian steak house (a la fogo de chao but cheaper). I ordered the chilaquiles for breakfast and they were really good. They came with pancakes or toast (i got the pancakes because pancakes are awesome). The decor is rustic with wood everywhere. Our server was on top of things and made sure our needs were being met. I would definitely go back.

Decided to do takeout pizza for a little get-together. Ordered large plain pie, large supreme pie, and a small special calzone. The pizza arrived still crispy, the cheese didn't slide in the box. The calzone was also still crispy and not soggy. The calzone was the best part! A great idea for pizza in the area!

Absolutely great customer service, our waitress was awesome and food delicious...to add very affordable first time there will become a regular customer 

Yelonda J

Really nice family owned jump center. Great selection of bouncers, nice secluded toddler area. Love the giant air bag, great attraction! No outside food or drinks allowed, but they have a stocked snack bar and a large area to sit and eat. My only complaint is that the air conditioning could be better. Other than that, great indoor play area with LOTS of room to grow!
Legit mom & pop joint. Food was good. Don't expect fresh veggies. Everything is canned. Very southern salad bar. Service was fine and everyone was really nice. Wish they had healthier options.
Went in and spoke with the staff about starting this as a hobby and a way to quit smoking. They were extremely friendly and patient with my questions. I will definitely be back.

The place is very nice & if your a sports fan they have TVs placed so you won't miss the game every seat here is placed so u can see the tv, ordered the 1/2 plate chicken & fri-tip pretty good & the servers are very friendly & great selection of libations

Mixed feelings. It has a very rich history, and is definitely a great place to visit if you're in town. It's an upscale place, but they have this indoor patio area that is not as fancy but the same menu. The indoor patio area might as well be outdoors because I was FREEZING. I could barely drink my water cause it was so cold. 

Our waitress was also terrible. She was very inattentive, slow, and forgetful. We waited a ridiculous amount of time waiting to order, for our check, etc. 

My friend got the Cajun chicken, and I got the pork chop. The food was GREAT. the bread they bring in the beginning was also out of this world, very unique. My friends wine glass was dirty, and they quickly got her a new glass. 

Did definitely appreciate the sanitary door opener in the bathroom!

Pretty good breakfast/brunch place.  Honeybee Crepe was a great, balanced, sweet-savory treat -- if maybe a little too carb-y (crepe was pretty thick).  I also would have liked a side salad with that.  I stole my partner's and it was fresh and good.  I ordered a cortado and received something more similar to a latte -- espresso-milk ratio was too milk-heavy.  The space is nice, but was very smoky both upstairs and downstairs.  Don't come here if you have asthma?

Overall, a friendly, cozy place with good food.  Crepes (and omelettes) are pretty massive, so if i come back i'll likely get something to split.

We were in town for NYE and always try to find a local spot to eat,  this one is a definite return visit spot!  BBQ nachos were good,  she got pulled pork and I got Brisket platter.  It was all great!  The Brisket is the best I have ever eaten!  You can't go wrong!
Excellent and fresh sushi! Started with the soba noodles and ginger salad. So delicious! I got the J&J roll and I wish I had ordered two!! Best sushi I've had in the city by far.

DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! First off they were hours behind. My daughters ipad had a small crack on her screen. It was still fully functional. No issues whatsoever. The technician, Naseeb, came out and was watching YouTube videos on how to perform an ipad repair. He then stacked 5 heavy books on top of it and stated to leave it. I did not get a chance to look at his work. He stated to leave the books on for 24 hours. The next day the screen was lifting and halfway hanging off. The company then sent another technician out and he stated the first technician took my frame with the screen. Which they are not supposed to do. No one could get ahold of him. Now my screen is only half lit. I was told when that happens there is no fixing it. I have reached out to this company. No response. They said they are going to have management call. No response. I have no issues getting my lawyer involved. Do not waste your time or money with this company. They will send you around in circles. My daughter us devastated that she lost all of her contents on her ipad. These technicians are NOT certified. If they are, they are definitely not tested to make sure they really know what they are doing. Save yourself the headache and find another company!!!

I was starved and this tiny place served up some deliciousness. I had an omelette, hash browns and toast. My hubby said his banana pancakes were the best he ever had. The oysters Benedict was loved by another member of my party. Everything on the table was eaten. Sorry no pics, we are it up too fast. The long wait was well worth it. I'll be back next time I'm in New Orleans. I rank this a full point above Ruby Slipper on taste.

Huge portions, great service. Had the fried chicken with the crawfish sauce. The chicken wasn't seasoned at all but paired with the sauce it was very good. I only ate half have a whole meal left over.

Below average pricey Thai restaurant with a full vegan menu.  

Visited on 12/2/17 at 5PM.  I must have passed by this place a hundred times and never noticed it which is ludicrous because the sign on the outside of the building is absolutely enormous and they have a unique round entryway around the front door. It sits in a small strip mall next to a consignment store and a laundromat.  

Inside it's rather un-inspiring with plain tables and clutter.  It is one of those sketchy looking places where you want to order "something safe" if ya know what I mean. We were seated very quickly and service was fast and friendly.  $41.57 got us a seafood entree, a chicken satay appetizer, and a kid's meal. 

I got the $7.95 chicken satay appetizer which came with four chicken skewers, a bowl of peanut sauce, and a bowl of cucumber salad.  The cucumber salad was fantastic...chock full of fresh jalapenos and onions and fresh cucumbers.  The peanut sauce was a little bland but a very generous portion.  The chicken skewers were yellow, hard, dry, flavorless, and barely room temperature.  I am certain that they were cooked either yesterday or earlier today and re-heated.  For the price, I'd expect some freshly cooked chicken.  

My son got the $9.95 kid's chicken pineapple fried rice which came with apple juice and a spring roll.  I do not like paying ten dollars for a kid's meal at any restaurant but I will say their portion was enormous.  They give 3-4 times more than any child can possibly eat.  It was the best thing I tried tonight...hot and fresh and well seasoned. I found it unusual that it was smothered with fried onions which I wouldn't think is very kid friendly.  My advice would be to cut the portion in half and lower that price and nix the onions.   Also the meal was supposed to come with a dessert which they never brought out. 

I watched in horror as my husband's dish arrived.  He had the $20.95 "seafood basil delight" which the menu said had shrimp, calamari, mussels, and scallops stir fried with basil and onions and an herbal sauce.  What arrived was a plate full of green peppers, onions, calamari, shrimp, and mussels.  The scallops were missing and the green peppers were not on the menu description.  This is not the sort of place where I would order something like this but my husband is a brave man.  He said he'd give it a "4 out of 10" and that it was hot but bland.  

The prices here do not match the quality of the food.  Serving old chicken is absolutely unforgivable.  I would not go back.

I had been wanting to go here since it opened and I finally made it! Thankfully, yelp has the new handy reservation feature and I was able to make a reservation from the app just 30 min from when I looked. That gave me enough time to jump in the car and make it for my reservation! So simple and super useful on a Saturday night!

First off, the modern decor inside the historical building makes for lots of easy conversation. There are some really cool, old city planning maps and trendy butcher block table tops. I loved everything about it! 

I also loved that when I sat down, some very delicious cornbread fritters were delivered. They are so tasty and have the perfect amount of jalapeño kick balanced with a bourbon honey sauce. 

The cocktail menu is definitely worth making a couple visits for. I got an Albee's Knees and it was the bees knees! I'm not usually a fan of gin, but this cocktail was delicious!

We ordered an Artichoke, Cheese and Kale dip appetizer. It was heavenly! I would go back exclusively for the dip! It was served with fresh pita and was a great appetizer. 

I couldn't decide what to order for dinner, but landed on the shrimp tacos and was happy with my decision! The corn tortillas were very crispy, almost tostada like and the spicy slaw and cojita was perfect! I would definitely order them again.

I was too full to try any dessert, so I'm going to have to come back! The Mac and cheese bites are also calling to me, so it won't be long!

This is a restaurant/bar that is part of the hotel. The menu is small and doesn't have a lot of options but they have an extensive drink menu. Personally, the food is significantly overpriced, especially the half chicken entree. However, the food was flavorful and delicious. I think this is a great place for anyone who doesn't mind spending money and wants to enjoy a good meal and drinks. 

The mussels were delicious and a good amount for the price. The fingerling potatoes were a little dry but still yummy. The waitress was very attentive.
We really enjoyed this place. Good atmosphere, great staff, and delicious drinks & tapas. We had the scallops, chicken spring rolls, and charcuterie board. All fantastic!

Yesterday, our breakfast experience was the low point of our stay in Montecito.
