The dismissive wait staff and the manager overseeing a nearly empty room who couldn't be bothered to refill a coffee cup so eclipsed the food that we will never return. The food was decent, but the "service" earned our server a $2 tip.

Where was I before Orange Theory? Oh that's right, on my couch drinking wine every night complaining about not being in shape. I had a friend that praised this place and after awhile when one popped up in mid city, I decided to give it a try. Initially I said no because of the price, but once you calculate the cost it's really not so bad. Health is wealth baby. Immediately from my first class, I knew I had made a good decision. Not only was the staff extremely welcoming and personable, but I loved everything about the concept. It literally pushes you to work harder and get in shape. I don't have the drive to do it on my own, so fortunately this was exactly what I needed. I've been coming for 3 months now and no workout has ever been the same. I love the energy when u walk inside. For people like me who have extremely hectic and inconsistent work schedules, this is perfect. All you do is download the app and you schedule according to what works best for you. They have classes all day at all different times. If your wondering about bringing headphones or making a playlist, don't bother. The instructors have the music bumping when u walk in. I haven't taken everyone's class, but Brandon, Jeff, and Josh's music selection definitely will have you in the zone. Everyone needs a little trap music in their life lol. If I haven't convinced you by now, then go in and see for yourself. They willingly will give u a walk through and let u do a trial class. Thank me later!

Solid spot for brunch. 

Mr. F always goes to Jones when in the City of Brotherly love.  This place is always hopping so be sure to make reservations in advance.  

Mr. F always goes for the monkey bread with that sweet semeny glaze.  It's so delicious. Mr. F also enjoys the make your own Bloody Mary. They have plenty of options for everyone's palate (cucumber ice cubes are awesome). 

Other favorites include the cheesesteak omelette, chicken & waffles, and the mac & cheese. Mr. F did not see the delicious potato pancakes on the menu last time he was there.   He hopes they bring them back. 

One word of warning to my fellow bears. The booths here are a little tight. If you are truly big, sexy, and burly you may want to choose a table.

We'd heard about this opening recently at the KOP mall, and my wife had tried it a few days ago, so we decided to stop in after a walk at Valley Forge. It's pretty close to the mall entrance near Cheesecake Factory, and it's a nice little space. No real place to sit and drink the bubble tea, but cute shop with a section with lots of Asian snacks. There's not as much variety of choice of tea here compared to other bubble tea places, but it's largely because they focus on using fresh fruit in their teas, and don't use powders.

The tea is definitely tasty, though a bit on the pricey side. My wife got a cold mango tea with sago, and I got a hot ginger milk tea. The mango tea was very refreshing and light, and the ginger milk tea was really great for a chilly day. It wasn't super hot, so I could drink it through a straw. I probably wouldn't have minded it being hotter, but it was delicious. I would totally get that again, or try another ginger tea...

Pei Wei is the American version of the Asian cuisine. There dishes are made to order in an open concept kitchen. The food and servive is always good. I love the quick atmosphere. Keep in mind It's not a full service restaurant.

I recommend there Mango california roll and there crab wontons. On there main dishes they offer two different sizes. Make sure you let them know if you want the small or regular because if you don't most likely the will give you the regular and trust me it's a nice portion.
 
  We have eaten here many times and always enjoyed it.

My hubby was craving wings. We pass here often and decided to give it a try. I tried calling 4 times to preorder, but there was no answer. We got there and were greeted by a mumbling cashier. I had to have her repeat what she was saying with each new statement. I ordered a small boneless wing combo plain, with sauce on the side. My hubby ordered a medium traditional with the sauce on the side. All the tables, except for a small one were filthy. A guy halfway bussed one table, so we sat at the only clean small table near thr front window. It was miserably cold!  We waited 17 minutes for our order, which was packed to go, even though we said we were dining in.  We, however, were happy to take it to go because it was miserable to sit there and shiver. Once we got home, (less than 2 miles away) the fries were barely warm. My husband's wings were partly covered with sauce (since when does plain mean cover some with sauce, if you want.  My boneless wings also had some covered and some plain. The fries have some fake barbecue tasting seasoning on them that ruins a perfectly good, partly warm French fry. Another establishment I won't be frequenting!

Met a friend here over Christmas holiday. 
I was immediately a fan of the relaxed and creative ambiance. 

I N T E N T I O N A L I T Y.

The word that best describes Room 901. From the decor, to the drink list, the owner, Peg, has worked tirelessly to create a Whiskey Bar that celebrates the brown liquid through and through. The pours have all been carefully curated for those looking to enjoy all that whisk(e)y has to offer. Her passion really shines here. Would absolutely recommend to anyone who's a fan of fine distilled spirits. Will absolutely be making the trip back to visit the next time I'm in town.

Haven't had Thai food this good, this cheap, and this bountiful in a long time. Small but cozy shop and I love the Polaroids they have on the wall with customer reviews! I had the pangang curry with chicken for $10 (comes with white rice). Got full on about half of it, took the rest home and had it for lunch the following day. The food is served to you in to-go style Tupperware so it's perfect for leftovers. Can't wait to visit this restaurant again and try their lunch bentos!

We went on a quiet Sunday evening and sat at the bar. Service was great. We ordered the bacon fat French fries as an appetizer. They came out hot and crispy and delicious. I ordered the posole and the cornbread which went great together. The posole was better than my dads (don't tell him!). My husband ordered the fried chicken which came with collard greens and coleslaw. It was all perfectly delicious. We will be back.

New brewery: beers are hit or miss but better than I expected for the first few tries.  Small but has a nice feel and very clean cut. Crowded but it's just opened probably a good sign ! iPas better than expected. Will come back to check out new beers as they grow. Welcome addition to Haddonfield
These guys are artists! Their beer selection and relaxed environment is always great. Love this place!
Amazing experience at Tuna Bar tonight. The food was amazing and service was great, as well. I would definitely highly recommend.

Since I was a child I've been visiting after hours pediatrics. They have always shown great professionalism and kindness to my family and now my children. I have never had any issues with transparency with the staff, wait times or anything else.

Fantastic customer service, did a great job on my screen and expert install of new screen protector.  I'd say, move over Apple Store! I really enjoyed my time here as they had snacks and drinks in the WeWork facility.  Get the manufacturers screen as opposed to the cheaper one.  

Mac helped me out and was very nice and thorough. They even stayed late to help me!

Ordered from here before they moved to the new location, so maybe the food has also changed. Ordered delivery for a few co-workers. The wait was long. In fact, a prior attempt to order from here was cancelled because the delivery time was 2 hours...we didn't even get things that were cooked, so this was confusing.

I got a salad. It was fresh enough for a deli that probably specializes in sandwiches, but the dressing was awful.  It was thick and gritty with sugar. I actually had to add a few spoonfuls of water to thin it out and dissolve the sugar. I would have actually preferred bottled dressing at that point. 

Overall, no one was impressed. Prices are decent, but the food was just average.
Best burger ever! The sauce makes it perfect! The French 75 cocktail is a must have ! ( cognac and apple cider)
Food here is amazing! Ordered beef ragu and chicken ragu. Both dishes are very tasty! Plus it's BYOB!!!

Was not expecting much when my husband suggested we stop in here for breakfast as we were out walking on a Sunday morning. They had a very inexpensive, not fancy, but adequate "buffet ". Bacon, eggs, sausage, the basics. No wait! This is practically unheard of on a Sunday morning!

Went for the Saturday lunch buffet. Beautifully set up, lots of dishes I had never tried before. Service was ok- water guys were obsessive as in most Indian places around here and very accommodating to our two small children. Food was excellent! Well worth the few extra minutes drive!
I'm a coffee lover and this place has the BEST LATTE ever!!!! We had hot latte and my boyfriend had iced vanilla latte. He likes his vanilla latte and I LOVED my hot latte!
I can't think of a better place to drink at in Philly when the sun's at its peak than Dirty Frank's. Aretha and the flying hot dog will always live in my mind's eye.

Visiting the Tampa/Sarasota area the last 4 days, I ate out for breakfast, lunch, and dinner daily. This was singlehandedly the best place I ate. Authentic food (I ate with 2 middle eastern friends and they confirmed), friendly service, and delicious authentic homemade meals. I ordered the chicken shawarma entree which came with 2 sides, along with vegetables and pita, friend ordered the beef shawarma and the other friend ordered the shawarma sandwich (all pictured). Only thing I noticed was the lack of tea options when there are countless teas served in the Middle East. I got their mint tea (only option) which was decent but I could've made it at home (mint leaves and tea packet). Great place.

Wow! The manager Brian is the worst! I'm sorry but what manager cusses at customers and refuses to fix a sandwich? Don't come here if you want your order to be right. Sorry there are other Bully's locations that can get things right.

Craving some BBQ I stopped at this establishment for take out.  I ordered the pulled pork without the bread.  Two sides where baked beans​ and the mac n'cheese.  
The pork was so tender and went nicely with the sweeter version of there  BBQ sauce.  I would say you get a little over a cup of pulled pork.
The baked beans themselves were just as I like them.  Not overly mushy but, tasty just the same.
The mac-n-cheese was to me nothing really special.  
Overall I would come back and try different menu items.  Probably​ this time dine in.  Then​ when I get an​ uncomfortable looking at a  bag with too much grease on it.  I would not frown--as you must​ already know about me presentation is the king.  Nothing like an unclean takeout ​bag.  I want to look into the takeout​ bag just like I received​ the best present in the world.
Good pizza and great delivery.  Right on time.  I liked the eggplant parm pizza a lot.  The pepperoni was OK.  I'll definitely order from there again.

What an awesome place with a great vibe. Very professional. My artist was Archie and he did everything I asked for and then some. His creativity is amazing. My concept required very intricate line work and he is extremely talented . It is truly beautiful work.

Ox tail pho made for a great meal and the crepe appetizer was a hit with the table. My gf got the crab and garlic noodles, but they were out of crab so they upgraded to the lobster at no extra cost. Turned out the lobster was fantastic! Only down sides were the duck was dry and touch and the taps were not yet installed, the taps will be up and running soon. Hopefully the duck prep will improve or change to something else...
I love the marts Mac basic Mac n cheese. Cute, clean, polite, helpful staff. Just a few seats.YUM!! Almost as good as Smac in NYC! Next time I'll get the basil pesto chicken Mac!
No more Maine Root???? No more Pimento cheese??? It's these items that made this place a go to for us. No longer.

Easily the closest hotel to Independence Hall. 20 yards to the IH security checkpoint. 100 yards from the Liberty Bell. Easy to walk almost everywhere. Scores of great restaurants and bars close by.
Perfect service. Had a king room over looking the "park" - which really means your room looks right at Independence Hall and the Liberty Bell. Definitely pick that option! Xmas week prices under $200/night?? Easily worth double!
Best sushi. Highly recommend. The sushi rolls were very good especially the crunch roll and the service was fast..one of the waiter looks like Jared Leto too!

Just had my daughters graduation party there this weekend. We had 12 guests in the Harbor View Room. I planned the whole event over the phone and email from NY, Katherine in catering was a delight to work with and took care of everything. The party far exceeded what we were expecting, first- the place is beautiful, and was decorated for the Holidays. The room was set up perfect, so much attention to detail went in to making our party perfect and my daughter feel so special. The food was so delicious... every guest commented how good it was. The drinks were excellent and very plentiful. The waiter that took care of us that day really put our experience over the edge! He was attentive, so polite, and just a pleasure to work with. I can't wait to come back to Tampa to eat here again... by the way the Filet Mignon beats any steak house in NYC ! It was perfect- fork tender! I can only imagine how beautiful a wedding would be there. Thank You Rusty Pelican for making this a very special celebration!
We had 4 dishes. The best was the Mee Siam; it was superb. The iced coffee was good. Plenty of free tea. Restrooms were clean. Staff friendly.

Awesome community. Beautiful, clean and well maintained... staff is quick..units are clean and free from bugs and roaches... we have a great time living here at preserve.. would definitely recommend this community

Hard not to enjoy yourself with all the excitement popping around you at a casino like The Hard Rock!

What fun.  1st off I must confess I've never been a huge fan of slot machines.  Never understood some of the crazier games, and I usually just end up losing money there.

Table games, however, that's where it's at!  I enjoy Let it Ride - a 5-card stud poker game you play with the house where 10s or better pays out.  Sounds easier than it is - but if you play at a $10 min or less table you can last awhile through a losing streak and bounce back.

They also have a poker room with $1/$2 blind no-limit tables.  I'm personally used to tournament play but this is great if you want to drop in and play without the tournament commitment.

Plenty of food options, no charge for parking (smart - when they changed this briefly I was stunned), and live entertainment.  Wish there wasn't smoking, but hey, it's a casino!

We went on a Monday around 9 am and avoided all lines. There is parking behind the restaurant, the first hour and half is for free. It has a cute little wood and brick style inside. The food came pretty quick, and I liked how you could do a combo meal and substitute their buttermilk pancakes for specialty ones. They had a great variety! We had the chocolate divine, sugar and spice, and the cornmeal pancake. All of it was tasty! The pancakes were smaller, the ham was pretty salty, but overall it was great.

Wow! All the positive reviews are spot on. Sabrina's is amazing, we started with the stacked ceviche and is was so good, should have taken a pic, but we dove in too quick. Hub ordered the Torta Mexicano and loved it. My Nacho Cubano was delicious, warm and tasty!! Can't wait to come back to sample some more tasty treats.

Absolutely love this restaurant. I sat at the bar and ordered a glass of wine and dinner. The staff was wonderful. High energy and very attentive. I ordered the General Wang with the brown rice. Excellent. Great atmosphere. I will be back with customers. Keep up the great work.

I've been here twice and it already feels like I'm visiting a favorite family member when I go in. I had the tres tacos, tomato soup and the lime tarte (like my personality) made me a converted dessert lover. Sabrina and her staff are authentic, gracious people. I can't wait to go back.

OMG the seasoning they put on those wings are like crack. So freaking tasty and addictive. All I need is a good chicken with dinner. Not a long wait even when I just walk in and order. Nice people too.
Woodhouse provides a luxurious spa experience. If you're looking to be pampered this is the place!

Great service,  perfectly seasoned fajitas, and the cheese dip was super fresh! Never had to wait for refills.  

I can't wait to go back, it looks like a great bar area.

This was a "happen chance" visit and we were pleasantly surprised. My mom, sister-in-law & I had been next door getting pampered at Woodhouse Spa and we didn't have time to go anywhere else. So we decided to try Stone Creek. We are very glad we did! I had the burger and salad, both of which were good. My mom and sister-in-law enjoyed their meals as well. The burger was off their sister restaurant's menu (Bru Burger) and I love that place. The burger wasn't exactly as good as it is at Bru Burger but it was good. Stone Creek is a strong 4 stars

This is my favorite spot for my fueling needs the people are super friendly, polite and usually the lowest price for fuel. Its also Liberty gas!! Home of Edward Snowden!! Go get your tank of Liberty!! Go on now!

Over cooked burnt chicken just what I always wanted! thank again for your great food! Arby's definitely isn't what it used to be. Used to be when you do Arby's you knew you were getting good food now it's the same as McDonald's except for you pay twice as much. Arby's you lost another patronage!
So worth the wait! The staff are amazing and so is the food. Perfect place to grab brunch if you're visiting.

Love Ethiopian food especially the injera bread!   My favorite vegetarian dishes so far are the mushroom dish and cabbage dish.  They give you plenty of injera and if you have leftovers. It lasts about a day more and can be heated slightly in the microwave.
This is an update to the review I posted in July. Since then my family has returned several times, and the food and the service have been fine. Needless to say, we will keep going back.
Stoped in for lunch and ordered the crunchy fish sandwich & fries. The waiter was professional and polite. Cant remember his name but never the less the entire meal was worth it.
Gelato was amazing, light and creamy and full of flavor, very similar to ones sold at famous/popular gelato places in Italy.

Very nice and relaxing atmosphere in each room. The waiting room is comfortable and the staff is very friendly. I had a facial with Daniele today and I would recommend her. She was very knowledgeable and did a very good job. Overall I would recommend this facility!

I come here often.  My little mexican mom enjoys the food and the pleasant servers.  My wife always likeds coming here as well.  I love the soups.  They have a variety of soups, I have tried them all.  Authentic flavors , like my abuelitas.  Very good mexican comfort food. As well as sonoran seafood.  Mmm mmm.
This place is so cozy and comfortable! I love coming here as there is prepaid seats and never a large loud crowd.

Yummy pancakes! I got the peach pancakes and it comes with 3 pancakes with peaches and whipped cream on top. There could have been less syrup on the peaches as it was a little too much sugar, but the peaches were spiced well. The whipped cream was fresh out of a bucket. They scooped it on to the plate right before serving. It was a busy place, but I still got out in about 30-40 minute (it was just a party of one though). I would recommend it!

Maybe this place is still new.. I don't know.. I'll give it a few months and go back to see. I got a burrito bowl... Gave me one scoop of rice..  and one scoop of everything .. I know I can ask more but man I'm not about to say it for everything. I expect a little more when I'm paying $9  . I'll  just have to drive over to the one in Voorhess cause I love Chipotle ! ... They know what's up lol

The seating hostess was quite rude and made a terrible, lasting first impression. When we arrived she was leaning with her elbows on the front counter as if standing up straight was too difficult. She was on her phone texting and acted as if my husband and I were an annoying interruption. Walking us to our table seemed to be physically exerting for her. That is the level of service you can expect here. Attitude reflects management and the employees behave like they hate being there. Perhaps it is because the servers do not get to keep the tips. They ask if you want to leave a gratuity BEFORE they bring the check and ask for the amount making it awkward. The check comes totaled including the gratuity. This is an indication that they are pooling the tips and management gets to decide how they are distributed. It's tipping the business not the server. How much does the restaurant keep? We had the fried chicken and the batter coating was very heavy, improperly seasoned and burnt. It was pricey for a bbq place but the quality of the food and service did not justify the price. Hendricks has extremely poor service and poor food quality. My recommendation is to skip this place. There are so many restaurants in St. Charles that actually want your business but this isn't one of them.

We didn't really feel the love here. First off, we were greeted by an unenthusiastic waitress who was very cold and short with all of us. We started off by ordering 3 apps: the pierogies, crispy duck salad and cheese board. All of these items were delicious, however the portions of the cheese were completely underwhelming. Four people were suppose to share the cheese board. While the presentation was cute with the mouse shaped goat cheese, the portions of the individual cheeses seemed as if they were fit for a mouse! Each person basically got a crumb of cheese to taste. Moving on to the entrees, two of us ordered the scallops, one person ordered the lamb and another ordered the beef stroganoff. The scallops were good, but the best dish was the beef. We have dined all over the city and the country. The aspect about The Love that left us with the poorest taste in our mouth was the fact that this place charges $1 per person for water (still or sparkling). Mind you, it's not bottled still or sparkling, it's super filtered Philadelphia water. To top it off, there is no complimentary bread or rolls served. You must pay $5 for the Parker house rolls with chive butter, which, in my opinion, were not worthy of the price tag. Overall, the food was good, not great and we do not plan to recommend or return. At $200 per couple, these ancillary charges made us feel as though we were being nickeled and dimed.

Hey guys, thanks for slamming down the corrected plate of my friend's food on our table. We couldn't tell you were pissed at us for actually speaking up about the crappy service  Umm, some of the food was ok, but all in all it was inconsistent. Things came out at different times. Some food was hot, other food wasn't. One person's entree was spicy when we speciFically asked for it not to be spicy. They forgot my fries. Guacamole was not fresh. Margaritas were just... not good, not fresh. Like the bottom of the barrel. Manager didn't seem to care and acted sarcastic. That is the ethos of this restaurant. Save your time--save your money. Go somewhere else if you can

This place is pretty small. I got the brisket ramen. The brisket was tender and tasted pretty good. I did not enjoy the Matzo ball in the ramen. The broth was pretty good. It says the brisket ramen would be spicy, but it did not meet my expectations.

I found my long lost love lol thank you Vick for fixing my nails and for my fill yesterday... this place is great i highly recommend going here i had a great pedicure and full set done here and like i said Vick is one of the best and  fast ... I've never had a bad set .

OMG. If you love #matcha or green tea, then DEFINITELY get the matcha galore!! It was so delicious!! I don't usually like matcha anything because they taste so strong but this was perfect and mild. I think it's so cute they add the little koala cookie as their logo, brings back childhood memories! I loved the atmosphere and various options for you to choose! Come here when you are done with your day bc the line goes out the door!

Waiter was very  good. Hostess was very pleasant. The quantity of food could be a lot better. I ordered the steak sand and there was only about 3 slices of thin steak meat on roll. There was a lot of roll with very little food inside. For$16.95 , I expect more steak meat. 
Total ripoff!!
Very expensive for the amount of food you get.
I would not go back!

Casa video has been a Tucson icon and in this time of Netflix video shops are not long for this world. Casa Video managed to change their business model to include a trendy craft beer, wine and cider bar. They too have big screens playing awesome movies, wonderful alternative to sports crazed other bars. I love the theme nights, Star Trek, Harry Potter Trivia, game nights. Free popcorn is always a big hit. And you can still rent movies. With a selection that doesn't come close to Netflix, it's totally worth checking out. It's one of my favorite places for good libations and great energy. So glad Casa Video survives!

I've had better. They're new so I'll give them a pass this time. Bowl was poorly put together and the staff lack professionalism. There should be some adult supervision and someone who can train them in customer service.
This is my favorite breakfast spot in Tucson! Expect to probably wait for a table, but worth every minute! My favorite is the Beni or the Steak & Egg Sandwich. Everything is amazing!

I've been a loyal customer since 2009, there was a period where I didn't come as much when I moved to South Philly but I returned to dining here when I moved back to Fishtown in 2016. I've always had a decent experience, good margaritas and good food, the wait was never good but tolerable. 

Well tonight, 12/29/17, we asked for a table of 6, we were told 40 minutes wait time which was fine, we get it people probably had cabin fever and they were busy. We scurried to the bar area, congregated at the corner ordered drinks, even got a pitcher of margaritas. The bar servers were great. 70 minutes lates, we were finally seated. 

We got our appetizers, they were great then we ordered our entrees. Three of us got fajitas, 2 out of 3 were cold. One of three that was hot. But the hot fajitas had such a tiny steak on it. 2 of us did not want to complain, we weren't there to get free food but eventually one of our friend did say something. Our server, Ashley, was great and she got the manager. He solved the situation by getting me a fajitas that was hotter, the way it's supposed to be. He brought out another steak for my friend. The food runner with the pink hair dropped off my hot fajitas but the literally dropped the plate of tortillas, sour cream and guacamole as if she was bothered by our complaint in front of my friend. The Diva in me wanted to snatch her hair and scold her for her behavior but in the real world I had to keep it cool. I was so angry that I lost my appetite. I don't expect to be worshipped, that's not what I wanted but a good customer service would have been great. As a frequent diner, that's all you want. Good food and hot meal with decent service. 

Look, I'm not here to get free crap, I literally eat out almost every single meal. I know what's it's like to deal with customer complaints, I respect everyone and do my best to fix the situation since I've had a job dealing with food and people at age 16. The food runner with the pink hair could have remedied the situation by acknowledging the situation and not taking things personally or even the manager could have tried to understand but none of that was done. I felt bad for Ashley, the server but she literally did her best and try to make things better. 

It just sucks because I don't think I could ever get my friends to come back here again and I think I am done as well.

I made a reservation for 5 people 4 days in advance but when we came in the table was not available. After 30 min of waiting and complains to the owner, Pasquale ( the owner) just wished us Happy Holidays and we have to leave or wait until a table is available. We left the restaurant and I am not sure I ever again visit this place.

They do all the little things right (and the big things too). I've taken my family 3 or 4 times recently and I've tried a different sandwich each time. They've all been awesome. My kids always get pizza and it's some of the best (maybe THE best) St. Louis style that I've had. The salads are good. The steak fries are tremendous. They source nearly everything locally (bread, coffee, soda). They make their own ketchup - and it's good. And the owner is engaging, friendly and is very honestly committed to ensuring you have a good experience. Give it a shot, you won't be disappointed.

To be honest I really struggle with this brewery. I love multiple levels of their establishment, but the beer is not one of them. And let's face it, it's a brewery. Isn't that kind of important? 

Let's start with the heart eyes emoji provoking assets. Their food is great. Their fried chicken sandwich melts in your mouth (I didn't order this but I always get a taste of my buddies palate ). Their bao buns were not the best I've ever had, but still tasty. I actually prefer mine more on the airy, fluffy side, but they choose to sear theirs so it's a little crispy on the outside. I'd also prefer. More crisp than fatty piece of belly inside but hey look who's being contradictory now (make up ya mind, Tone). Anyways, I was surprised at how much I loved the fried rice in my salmon taco. I actually enjoyed a few forkfuls on its own throughout the course. But even still, almost all of the portions are a little small for the price. Quality is important though here, and I feel they nail it. 

The atmosphere is definitely another pro. If you don't like noise, go away. People are having fun and drinking merrily. It's gonna be loud. So talk a little louder, look at your guests when they speak, and laugh at the kids next to you trying to steal their dad's wings. I'm Italian. I'm loud. I love noise. It makes me feel at home. So the tremendously open layout of this building is much preferred over their cafe location. 

So the con here. Guys. Whyyy are your saisons sour? No where else do I experience this, and saisons are my favorites. And guess what.. I hate sours. Don't get me wrong, I've had a few of their beers that I have really enjoyed, but overall I think this place is over hyped. My thought is they just try to get too eccentric, and just get a little nutty with their concoctions. Like I said, I don't hate it, but I rarely love it. I'll still keep going though. The atmosphere, food, and occasional slam dunk brew still reels me in.

I dug it. Small bar, great beer selection and delicious food. I had a smoked #Marzen and boubonic steak sandwich. I'm a big always sunny fan which brought me here, wasn't disappointed. They need one in Cali too

We had 3 people in our group. 1 -17 year old 1-49 year old and 1 -81 year old. We all had a great time. First you walk in and in the parking garage and enterance there are 2 statues to look at. They have several nice exhibits. Dinosaur, space, outside, science, Ryan, Ann Frank and Ruby ( I think that was her name ). The exhibits had fun interactive things to do. There are restrooms on each level. The horse ride was good. I do recommend it

I have tried many of the places in downtown St Pete so had to try this place. 
The pasta carbonara was not that good and the Cobia was over cooked. 
The Tryst drink was pretty good but 10 minutes to get a drink. They messed up on our order and service was slow. 
This may be a good place to have a drink but I will not be back for food. Probably not even for a drink either Too many other better places than here.

Had an absolutely phenomenal dinner. Started with both the tuna tartar and carpaccio both A+. Followed with mussels in coconut curry - now on my top ten list of best things I've ever eaten. The 36 oz dry aged porterhouse was amazing both in taste and presentation. But if you don't save room for dessert you're out of your mind. You couldn't live with yourself for missing out on trying the apple fritters however the carrot cake was the best we've ever had by a mile.
One of the best donair poutines in the city. The staff work efficiently, communicate well to make sure each order is correct, and are friendly.

In regards to the museum, it was great.  In regards to one particular staff member...  She was horrible.  My family came to visit from Columbus.  We have a three year old and a 20 month old.  When we came in, we were politely informed by three separate people in the space of 60 seconds that our kiddie 2 seater wagon was not allowed in the museum.  In case we didn't hear it the first two times in the space of ten seconds.  Even though I was trying to get my kids unbundled and out of the wagon so I could get my husband to return it to the car.
That's fine.  I understand the concern.  But what got me was the woman who was standing 8 feet away from me as we were waiting for him to return complaining to the security guard in a very audible voice about how she couldn't understand WHY anyone would bring a wagon instead of a stroller.  And how she wanted to make sure we got rid of it.  And why kids would need a wagon anyway?  And on and on.  

Incredibly rude.  I followed the rules.  I put up no argument.  And you're still going to be snide?

 The museum is nice.  The kids area was nice.  The trains were cool. I sincerely hope they do well and spread understanding and better knowledge of Native American culture.   But I'm not coming back.

I'd say this was five stars except for the fact that the adjoining bar/ restaurant was ridiculous- the staff was so in the weeds it was a twenty minute wait at the bar on a Friday night.  On an up note, hotel staff and accommodations were absolutely perfect .

New to Philly and glad to find such a great place like this! All great experiences from scheduling an appointment to the finished product. Great cuts, great convos. Excited to make this my new go to barber shop!
I love the chicken Parmesan, but i order it with spinach tagliatelle and they never get it right! So check your order if you are doing take out.
Wasn't a long wait right after leaving Nissan Stadium Titans game. They have various flavors and we enjoyed it.
The food is ok but  service is too bad. I think I will give them ZERO STAR if I can. I dont know the women who is at front desk is boss or manager but she is so weird and rude..

Best breakfast ever.  Haven't had a kolache since we moved from Texas and the sausage one here did not disappoint!  The most amazing thing was the brûlée cinnamon roll OMG....best cinnamon roll I've ever had.  We debated whether the Uber ride from the hotel would be worth it but I can assure you it was and we will probably find our way back again tomorrow!

The food was fresh and wonderful! The staff was friendly and accommodating. You can tell everything is made from scratch and the flavors shine though:) 

Great find and happy we stumbled upon this restaurant.

Many people have recommended Jasmine Rice to me because they say the food is delicious and the BYOB factor is an added bonus. I got the Chicken Pad Thai for myself and the Crispy Spring Rolls to share with my vegetarian friend. The food wasn't that great, but the customer service was good and I like how cozy the restaurant is. I will probably go back at some point but would definitely want to try something else on their menu.

We had a nice lunch there today. Nice they are open Sunday's. We went for the fresh shrimp... I had the Butterfly Shrimp and wife had the Shrimp Taco's. Wo and nicely done... tasted very fresh. Waitress said they get the shrimp from next door and considering the line of 20 shrimp boats docked behind the place it seemed the way to go. Waitress was prompt and courteous and all the food in a timely fashion. Definitely will be back!

If you only do one thing, do it well. Bab Cafe does some kickass bibimbap. 

I lived in South Korea, where the rice bowl is a staple, and this stuff was good. Veggies and add-one were tasty, you can sub brown rice, everything comes with miso soup and the portions are big. The homemade hot pepper paste is really good! 

Try the japchae for something different - they're delicious noodles with little bits of meat and veg. Kind of hard to find in the States but so worth it. 

Hit it up.
Best cheesesteaks in Philly!! Here's my plate about 30 secs after I started eating it. Lunchables somehow always taste better from here. 4 stars bc I will always pass on the donuts

Honestly this is the fanciest medical building I've ever been in. Even the scale is built into the marble floor and concealed. The staff is highly professional and kind. The medical assistant who took my blood was a pro! And I hardly even felt the 2 shots she administered. In and out in under 30 minutes! (Went on a Sunday morning around 9) Will definitely be returning in the future.

Wha...463 reviews. Make it 464..lol. One of my favorite burger joints that you can get a juicy turkey burger. (trying to watch my weight - don't judge me). The Buy The Farm burger is my absolute fave! Egg is always perfectly cooked, the red pepper relish balances the richness, and the turkey patty is plump and juicy, and bacon (nuff said). The buns aren't too thick, but doesn't get completely soggy. When they have the brussels as the chef's veggie - get it or else the tots will do. Always good service and fair prices for the area. I haven't had their shakes, but they look delicious (again - watching my weight). 

Patio seating available and free one parking in the Gulch.

Not a good experience.
This is advertised as an upscale restaurant and is priced as such.  Don't mind paying for good food and good service. In this case, didn't get either.  
We went for lunch during the week. They had one lady seating, taking orders and serving. While the place was not busy, it took a long time for everything. There was another lady walking around, looked like possibly manager or owner. She had no interest in helping out. 
The space looks like minimal effort was taken to convert this from a bar to a restaurant. Old tables and chairs placed randomly around the room and on a wooden dance floor. 
Would not go back.

Ordered takeout, possibly the best burger my husband ever had, and the macaroni and cheese I got was so good that it should be illegal. He said that every single ingredient on his burger popped, all distinguishable, and the house mayo is phenominal (I forget what its calles but you can ask for it), not to mention the supreme freshness of every single condiment/topping. It smelled as much as a salad as it did a burger.

We did not eat in, but just from picking up the food we agreed to go back because of the atmosphere, professionalism, courtesy, and care shown by every staff member. We were offered water while they brought our to go bags out, and were able to take in the laid back yet sophisticated embiance.....very impressed.
Just go this place is authentic the family who runs it is great, staff great, food is amazing. love love love this place.

My. Nails. Look. Great. 
I asked for an appt via yelp and received a response in less than an hour. I had to amend my scheduled appointment and I was accommodated. 
I arrived at the new scheduled time and I was greeted and seated. I received an overlay from scratch along with shaping and new polish in less than an hour. 
Excellent customer service!

I've now been to PokeDoke three times, at various times of day. Initially they were working out some kinks (ran out of fish, 15 min wait for rice) but I have had an excellent meal there every time! I feel like even the small is plenty filling. You get two scoops of fish for the small, which isn't a ton but is enough. You can chose whatever toppings you want, which is awesome! The flavors are great, they are pretty efficient, and the people working there are very nice and friendly. Great addition to the CWE dining scene! Get out of that shake shack line and try Poke Doke instead!

We bought a Groupon before checking reviews for this place.  Big mistake!  But we went there anyway last week.  My wife had a small pizza which she said was okay.  I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich which was the driest thing I've ever eaten.   Service was very slow...we asked for parmesan cheese with my wife's pizza and never saw our waitress again!  Finally we went into the kitchen to get our check.
Nope, not again...
A consistently good place for lunch. Good salads and good service. Relatively relaxing friendly place. Never had to wait for a table.

From graduations to theater productions, Centennial Hall is a versatile space. Warning, the seating is not very comfortable. On the plus side I have sat in different areas of the hall and have had decent seats every time. The acoustics are good and easy to hear what is going on up on stage. 

Right on campus it has beautiful scenery outside. Right next to University Park Blvd there is shopping and restaurants nearby. There is a parking garages that you can park in and walk to the hall. It is not a far walk from the garages. 

I hope to see many more shows at Centennial Hall!

First time here just,  love this place. It is one of the Cunningham restaurants which are all good but love the sitting with the open air area. The empanadas are wonderful with a fresh house made margarita. Had the red drum which is a mild white fish with plantains, oh so good.
The Cunningham restaurants offer A VIP card program which gives s $100 gift card for every $1000 spent. Earned my first gift card tonight, wohoo.
I have been coming here for several years, and I love this place. Tina and Jenny are the best. Always clean and reasonably priced.
Pizza was great as well as the sandwich the wait time after placing an order to go, not so much otherwise very good!

Just ordered the yellow eyed snapper special that's crusted in Parmesan.  It was good on its own but felt it needed sauce.  Chef George was cool enough to give me three of their sauces to try which were all good but not the right fit. Then, he brought out the volcano red sauce and man that was a perfect pair!! Coming back here again soon.  Tiffany was our waitress and she was fast and very friendly.

Sat down with another group in front of us and was ignored for 25 minutes. The group in front and behind us were waited on and served immediately. At the 30 min point we were finally acknowledged and asked for our drink order. Here at the 45 minute mark waiting in our food as the the group in front and behind finish their meals. Here on vacation and will not be coming back or rendering anyone to your establishment.

Had the Reuben and it was awesome. I have eaten a lot of Reuben at a lot of different establishments and most fail when it come to this sandwich. The cornbeef was made on the premises not sliced from a commercial made brisket. Take note competitor's this is what a Reuben should look like! Mallory was great, very nice and attentive. Service was quick, place was very nice and clean.

It was okay.  I purchased enchiladas and my son purchased a quesadilla.  He had to go inside because the quesadilla wasn't put in the bag.  The horchata was just mediocre.  It's nice to have authentic Mexican through a drive thru.  The prices and serving sizes were adequate but i think there are better options in the area.

This was a surprisingly great restaurant! It was across from our hotel so we wandered in to a short 20 minute wait during the holiday season and sat outside on their upstairs balcony. The service was great and the food was even better. The quality of the sea-food was top notch and the sides are cheap and yummy. The entrees are expensive for the environment of the restaurant but the quality makes up for it. A fun restaurant in a busy area!
Stopped in specifically for the oysters and was not disappointed. Bloody Mary was pretty good as well. Atmosphere is nice and service was pleasant.
It's like walking into another time and place, super magical.

Came in to try this place out for the first time on a Saturday night. The bar area was packed so I had to sit in the dining area. They have 120 taps of beer! 

I tried the broiled lump crab cakes and they were delicious! 

Jordan was our server and she was knowledgeable and helped us through the menu.

I'm not a big fan of Mac n cheese but decided to try the buffalo Mac because the only place I have had Mac and cheese is at the District Tap so I wanted to compare and I think honestly the Mac n cheese at the District Tap tastes better.

Met a family and my daughter 6 of us...ordered drinks then food , came out awesome and fast!!!! I'm impressed, the servers assist each other and I couldn't have asked for a better experience.

The wings were fat and meaty like they should be,  unlike what you get at Hooters now, they need to go to the same vendor as Glory Days ....Duh??

I did not stay in this hotel, however I went with family to enjoy the Christmas events there. The place is gorgeous!!!! They prepare everything in details with attraction to children. This year Charles Brown Christmas was a theme. Just a little pricey. You still have time to enjoy there.

Let me start by saying the food was "Amaaazing" we had the Duck Duck Rice, and the shrimp and Grits, corn and crab soup, shrimp and crab stuffed oysters, French 75 cocktail, apple fall dumpling, and a chocolate tort.

Luke has a great atmosphere the ambiance was very nice. Our server Gary was on point, and was excellent with all of his recommendations and conversation and the same goes for the manager.

 I believe her Name was Elizabeth though we had dinner there on 12/29/17, so it's been a few days....so sorry if I didn't get her name right. Gary and Elizabeth made the experience very enjoyable for us and our little service dog. We will definitely go back, everything on the menu looked appetizing.

I had a massage with Michael in early December. Overall it was a great experience - my first with Thai/shiatsu massage. I felt very relaxed after. I think the type of massage works well for my back and tension issues. I would definitely give this another try.

Came to New Orleans to visit and eat as much sea food as possible, so I went to Luke...randomly picked the place..didn't know what to eat but stuffed oysters sounded good so here I was 1/2 dozen stuffed oysters..shortly after I figured how to eat them (with the spoon to get all of it, as the manager said) there were none left!!! So good

India Palace apparently is under new management.  They sent out a mailer advising they had renovated the place and were serving a complementary buffet from 11am-4pm on Saturday December 16th, 2017.  We arrived at 3:00pm to find they were not honoring their advertisement and had locked the doors to the restaurant to ensure no one could get in.   On top of that they even had a policeman outside telling people they couldn't get in.   I called the restaurant asking what was going on.  They gave me the owners phone number and said the owner had ordered the doors closed early.  I called the  owner and left a message.  The owner responded via a text message telling me I shouldn't be contacting him and to basically leave him alone.  

There are other Indian restaurants in this city.   This "new" India Palace won't be getting my business again.   They won't have to lock the doors to keep me away.  I'll go somewhere else.

Great donuts in the Garden district. DD was a block from our Airbnb and we went there 2 times! So good and I love the atmosphere. Casual and local. I'm sure there were lots of visitors like us but it didn't feel like a touristy place. 

I ordered the cinnamon donut.. perfection!

This casino was a joke. So let me get this right, $900 for two night stay during the middle of the week. $900 for a basic room.The high prices were definitely attract people to spend money at the casino. What a joke

The clerk talked politely and acted rudely, but food was good.

I went there with 2 friends at 7pm on Saturday. I didn't make reservation, but there were not so much consumers waiting. In this restaurant, they have "reservation area" with booths and "non-reservation area" with a counter and small tables. The clerk led us to a very tiny table for 2 people though we were 3, then he left us there and had gone. He had unusual hospitality, but we got a another small table where we 3 could take seats at last.

We ordered two Prim Rib steaks and a roasted salmon, and a server asked us how we liked our steaks cooked. I think that their Prim Rib steak is very delicious and is better than that of Texas Loadhouse, because of not only the meat itself but also the 2 sauces.
However, anxiously, they didn't provide their bread for us. They have unusual hospitality and services.

I am going to try the restaurant again with reservation.

First of all what a beautiful salon it  has a very elegant feel. I had gotten a gift card for microblading which I never had and wasnt sure I even wanted it.  For some reason I was losing a lot of eyebrow hair for some time.  I had my proceedure with Annie Morris, she was recommended.  She took her time explained the procedure, was very gentle, and accommodated my schedule I went in on a Sunday.  My eyebrows make me look years younger I love them.  I will definitely be back Annie.  I love the freedom of being able to run out the door without any make up and still feel pretty.  That gift is priceless.

We're staying at Grand Sierra for New Year and the kids love Johnny Rockets here on the ground floor. Our server was Keith, an energetic, career made, fun and had a great sense of humor. Our foods were great, chicken strips, Route 66 with onion rings, Philly cheese steak and the shake of the month, too rich and sweet for my taste.
A simple lunch and everyone was full and happy. We got to bring our shake and Iced tea to go. Kudos to Keith.

After a big lunch, we decided to swing by District Donuts and give the donuts here a try. Being in the middle of the afternoon, there wasn't a long line, and getting seating inside wasn't too hard either. The vibe is pretty relaxed, with a spacious feel, some industrial finishes, and spacious booths, bar seating, and some outdoor spots as well if you want to sit down. Most of the attention was focused on the donuts, but as the name suggests, they also serve sandwiches and coffee here - so a little bit of everything for everyone. We ended up sticking with donuts, trying out the chocolate glaze, spicy maple praline, and cookies and cream.

How'd it shake out? To be honest, I was a bit underwhelmed given the hype that I had seen on here (and other places on the Internet). The donuts are very much on the thicker and denser side, and outside of the maple praline, I didn't think the frosting really stood out relative to other donuts I have had. I do have a soft spot in my heart (and belly) for maple donuts, which explains why I liked that the best flavor-wise - but it also didn't have any hint of spiciness at all, which makes me wonder why the description even bothered. The chocolate glazed donut was very average to me, and the cookies and cream was also pretty generic...there was only a small sprinkling of cookies on top.

Overall, the donuts are different from what you'd pick up at a Krispy Kreme or Dunkin' Donuts, but it didn't measure up to the uniqueness (and tastiness) of other donut-centric shops that I have been to. I would like to come back and try the sandwiches, which looked tasty, but from a donut standpoint, I came away full but a bit disappointed relative to expectations.
Great place, caring and compassionate staff. They have always taken great care of our pets, I wouldn't go anywhere else,  & Dr.  Haskell is the best!
VEGAN JUNKFOOD DELICIOUS!!!!!! Who knew you could get a cinnamon roll that taste so good, just so good and it's cruelty free, total WIN WIN! #stayWOKE

This chipotle is absolute garbage!!  The staff at this location is absolutely incompetent.  They under stuff your burritos, forget items in your order, ask unbelievably stupid questions, do not clean up the mess they make after each burrito and then proceed to drag your food through it.  

By the time you make it to the check out, they top it off by incorrectly charging you for your order, and because of the idiocy at large, they ask you to just accept their mistakes and move along because they can't figure out how to fix it.  

Horrible, this is all over several visits.
We have come here two days in a row now. Great food both times and a great atmosphere. Definitely give it a try.

I really wanted to like this place! I was looking forward to eating here for a long time. Finally decided to pull the trigger. When I had seen the menu, I was super excited. We ordered a few items from each category, we really wanted to get the full experience. Nothing really wow'd us at all. The concept, menu and food items are fantastic. The execution on the other hand was very weak. The food and flavors needs some work. I hope much success to them!

Such a cute concept! 

Mini cupcakes with great flavor! I absolutely loved these mini cupcakes! They are prefect size, you do not feel guilty after enjoying a couple! 

Flavor variety is awesome! I loved the lemon raspberry and the espresso!

I look forward to taking some friends and our fur babies to enjoy more!

Awesome awesome awesome!
Don't think twice. Long lasting. Covered every inch. So surprised and happy. 
I was skeptical about an airbrush tan from a random place. Not only being from South Florida where a tan is accessible but an airbrush is even easier.. Awesome chick. Awesome tan.

Not bad just not the same.
The service was good and the Pizza was not bad,
the restaurant itself had seen better days.
Part of enjoying a good meal also includes
the vibe or general feel of my surroundings.
Godfathers was a fun place to eat 10+ years ago
and while re visiting Reno we thought we would pay a visit.
Thank you Godfathers for the memories, but unless time and money is put in
 it may be time  to move on.

Yoon catered a dinner party for 20 people for my husband's 50th birthday. The food was fantastic, and she and her team were easy to work with. And I got to actually enjoy the party!  I would highly recommend her.

You wouldn't know this was a tequila cantina so I think they could do a MUCH better job of marketing it.  The servers should suggest types of tequila to try or at least some kind of mention of it.  Our server, Angela, was attentive and informative.  Very helpful when it came to the menu.  The salmon is great.

Spare rib is really good! But I think it's a bit of small amount for a price we paid. I went there with family and we are big fan of Pad Thai so we ordered it too. That was a bummer. It was red and taste different than the all other Pad Thai I've eaten in my life. I would go back there just to eat the spare rib dish and some tea.

I had fairly high expectation before I came but the serving here really upset me. We ordered at 1:06PM but the dishes didn't come until 1:45. What's even worse, our waitress brought our check 5 minutes later. We didn't finish half of the food yet. It's a very frustrating experience.

Staying at the Ramada so I ordered a meal for myself to go. I go and pick it up, and it's $18 for the fried steak meal (with eggs, hash browns and pancakes) and a cup of coffee. That seems a little ridiculous to me for ihop. Also, hours after eating it, I got food poisoning. Save yourself the money and your health.
Excellent food at a great price. Old country charm and friendly service. A must-see if you're in the area!
I don't normally eat burgers and this place was sensational! Great food & great service! The beers were awesome! Highly recommend stoping here.

Spiro's is a long-lasting, respected Greek establishment in St. Louis. From date nights to family gatherings, it suits many needs. 

My review is a short one. I decided that I wanted a gyro. Having had Pita Plus during my last gyro craving, I wanted something new. To begin, the inside is beautiful and classy in a revived 70's feel. That is not a slam in any way. It feels upscale and older, more mature. Everyone was very friendly and from the interactions of the other customers, I suspected many of the people eating have been there before, if not multiple.

While I ordered ahead, I ended up waiting a few minutes before the food arrived. After traveling back to work, I dug in. The fries were seasoned well; however, they were a little mushy. As for the gyro, the meat was a little overcooked (very often, once the meat is carved, it will go on a stove top for a little extra heat) and the Tzatziki sauce was very bland with the yogurt flavor dominating everything else, which was, possibly, the greatest disappointment. 

Ultimately, it was a very confusing experience. Spiro's always seemed like an iconic Greek restaurant in St. Louis and the feel of the restaurant fit the image I had in my head before ever visiting, but a simple dish was missed in a big way. It could have been a "one-off" or could have been a sign of a classic restaurant not keeping up with the times. I cannot say which one - that will have to be decided for yourselves.
Best authentic Mexican food in the area. The staff is great and the food is fresh. The price point is awesome as well. Enjoy!!

Not terrible, just not good.  Steak was pretty skinny cut, ordered medium, came super well-done (roadkill), and was over-seasoned, albeit acceptable.  Potato (baked) was standard fare and pretty hard to screw up.  Salad was not fresh, and mostly-all iceberg, with a sad little bit of tomato.  Glad I tried it (seen this place for years and curious about it).  Will not order from again.

Best cappuccino served at any of the drive thru merchants in town. Orders are always right. Service is friendly. Dark chocolate espresso bark bar is killer good and no linger available 
Strange layout to the lot from all driveways. Accessible from 39th and 38th. 
Walkup window and casual outdoor seating available

Great burgers. We tried 3 different specialty burgers and all were very good. Waffle fries good but would have been better hot. That's our fault for deciding on take out and not eating in. Nice place and atmosphere. Staff very friendly.
Best food I've had in a long time. This place should have 5 stars hands down. Highly recommend anyone that wants to try really unique and flavorful dishes.

My family and I made a quick trip to New Orleans to take the kids to a Saints game and soak up some culture. I was disappointed that Camellia Grill's line was out the door.  Even though it's not the same since Katrina and Marvin passing, I still wanted my kids to see my old stomping ground. 

Anyway, this place was open and ready to seat us. I did a quick yelp & the stars indicated that it was a go. It was a Sunday and were told that they were only serving brunch which was a dealbreaker for me. Another waitress quickly corrected the situation & gave us the lunch menu. Our party of seven was seated on the balcony which is always a treat. 

Now to the food: The food was amazing! I had the chicken Cordon Bleu. It was panned to perfection & covered in an amazing cream sauce!  I let others sample and everybody agreed that it was delicious. My son had the chicken Parmesan (he did not share but he's a picky eater and scarfed it down), my other kid order from the brunch menu.. maybe eggs with crabcakes.. it disappeared too fast to actually see it . There were also couple of sausage/beef burgers at the table.  

But the highlight (for us adults) was the $5 bloody Marys. They were deliciously spicy with extra horseradish. They could have used some extra garnishes but the bloody Mary itself couldn't have been better.

All in all it was a great experience and the lunch menu is definitely a good value!

Ordered a burger and salmon. The bill came out to $27.00 not complaining about that, but the salmon was over cooked and a very chewy. Plus not the most pleasant of experience with customer service. I got a very unpleasant stare. I probably won't be back.

Finally made it to this landmark that my husbands been trying to get us to every visit we have in Nashville. They were delicious pancakes - light and fluffy and simple. Really you wonder how special a pancake really could be- they're simple right? Well I was impressed with the down to earth, yet famous establishment and their perfected classic. These pancakes are buttery and so light. I also loved the portion sizes- substantial but not the comical Paul Bunyan style pancakes we see so often now days. 

We had friendly prompt service and the atmosphere was familiar. It was pleasant to see the establishment had stayed so true to its roots over the past 50 years.
Finally, finally a "real pizzeria"!!! Food is fresh! And absolutely delicious.  Service is great- so friendly and helpful. What a find!

Buyer Beware: Please be cautiously aware when placing an order that you are trying to get the advertised discount for.  They cited a BOGOF offer so I order two pizzas that I told the lady I wanted to use the BOGO deal on.  I then ordered cheese bread and regular breadsticks afterwards.  When I picked up the order and reviewed the receipt, I noticed that they had taken off the cheapest thing on the order (the breadsticks). I called them back and they would not refund the difference and stated that the discount applied to the cheapest thing on the order.  They were not willing to compromise at all so therefore please be aware of their business practices before ordering.
This is the absolute best ice cream I've ever had. Get the homemade ice cream in the waffle ones that they make in-house!

This place is very strategic with how the food is portioned. The special comes with little meat to force you to pay for extra meat. When I brought it to the owner's attention he dismissed it. Of course he's not going to stop the scam for little ol me who he still received a profit from. These ppl are very greedy.

The food was delicious and tasted really authentic. Moving to Indy from LA, I've been missing authentic Asian food! We will definitely be coming back. This is a family run business and the owners were really nice too.

Waiter was super impatient. Fish is not very fresh. Cover everything in sauce. No alcohol. Then in the middle of our meal every person in the restaurant stopped working and took over 3 tables and were slurping down food. Unprofessional. Would never go back.

Oh my goodness. The remodel is GORGEOUS. This place is so soothing, so clean and lovely!  I went for the first time in years recently, and was blown away by the new tank rooms-- high ceilings, music if that floats your boat, lights if you want them.  

I prefer the darkest of dark silent tanks and the room offered that too.  Amazing.

A friend recommended this restaurant. I thought the food was great. Service was slow and confusing (language barrier issues). I think the concept is novel - your seafood is served piping hot in a bag from which you just dig in!  

On a Saturday evening it was super busy and they don't take reservations, either, so get there early. Your entire party must be present to be seated, too. 

It's extremely noisy due to the open room and tables crowded in close together in the space. They DO have a full, bar so have a drink while you wait!

Prices for crab legs, shrimp and oysters are market so I have no real issues there. There's also chicken for the kids in case seafood ain't their thang. 

I'm definitely planning on going back; however some of my snootier family member were appalled that they had to eat from a bag, so they won't be joining me.

First cheese steak and I regret having it at the airport and not some famous place that claimed to have invented it. 

Still, wasn't bad. Price is not exaggerated, the bread was fresh and soft. Plenty of meat inside and I let them pick out Swiss cheese. Grilled onions and nothing more. I'll start with the basic and later on advance to more toppings inside. 

It's not 5 start because I wasn't overwhelmed. 
It's not 4 because throughout the sandwich I had a couple of bites that hit something hard. I figure it was bone or something but it wasn't meat, cheese, onions or bread. Didn't investigate too much.

We have eaten here several times for brunch, and I've had a great experience. We were here on Saturday, however, just to have a drink at the bar and the service was so poor, I had to let a manager know as well as write this review. I'm always amazed when people are rude because they're busy, isn't busy good? There were three girls behind the bar, one of them was relatively new, and the nicest of the three. The other two were visibly irritated either that they had to work or that they had customers I'm not sure which. It was so uncomfortable being there,We finally had to leave. I did let the manager at the front door no, not sure if she was interested or not.

So I'm a huge fan of the food and Charro Steaks had become our go to place for visitors and fun nights out. Unfortunately they have decided  to be more of a concert venue then a restaurant. Its incredibly loud so much so the waiters can't hear you, your companions can't hear you and I needed to yell in peoples ears and we were as far away as we could get from the speakers. Although the music was nice and well done I didn't buy tickets to a show, I want to enjoy dinner and talk with my companions. I saw hardly anyone talking. As much as I love the food unless they decide to turn it down (and we did ask) we'll have to find another place.

This place is "a-ok". Nothing spectacular to add. Quick regular sandwich, and able to use the Wi-Fi from the place next door. Not much business when I was here, so I was able to chill at a booth for a while.

I was really surprised to find an authentic Taiwanese restaurant in Reno on my way back home from Burning Man. You will not get your typical cheap greasy chinese food here - this is the real deal. Taiwanese food is a real delicacy. Traditionally it is salty but not too salty and has a sweet side :) I had tomato and egg over rice, dumplings, soy sauce boiled egg, oyster omelette, and salted fish. I wish I could eat here everyday! Can't wait to roll through Reno again.

I ordered a Peach tea with cream cheese foam, and it did not disappoint. Most bubble tea places make their teas too sweet but this place does it just right. My friend ordered the Rose tea with cream cheese foam and I would highly recommend that tea as well. The rose flavor was just right, not overpowering at all. In addition this place is so well decorated and the owner is so sweet. I recommend you give this place a try

I really think the sewing skills are wonderful. I'm a sewer. I don't have room in my house now for the sewing machine I used to have in my previous home. It's an industrial sewing machine. Anyway, the owner's sewing skills are excellent!
She can have my son's school shirts finished in 1/2 a day and the cleaning never smells of that strong solution. The clothes are always impeccably clean!
Don't hesitate to use them.
One of my favorite frozen custard places in St Louis (as it is an institution). Love the Hawaiian - it can't be beat!

Came in for the first time to fix the band on my Cartier watch and replace the battery in my Balmain watch. The owner and assistant barely welcomed me and seemed to act like I couldn't afford to be in there (my Cartier watch is well over $15k). I asked if they could look at it before I dropped them off and seemed annoyed to walk away from a customer with a Breitling watch. They gave a quick answer that he couldn't fix the band and refused to give any recommendations on where to take it. His exact words were "I don't know any reputable jewelers, but I can't fix it". I allowed them to replace the battery in my Balmain watch but I most likely won't be back due to the poor customer service. I will take my watch to be repaired by a jeweler who can give me more than a minute of their time.

The coffee is good, but over priced. Super convenient location which is probably what you are paying for. We got our coffee in to go cups when we did not ask for them and it was not much coffee in the cup. The big room is renovated and has some cool elements, but is missing the cozy feel that coffee shops beckon. Staff was not very enticing either.
Pad Thai was delicious. And now I know where I'll be eating on Christmas.

We went there for breakfast this morning. Although the beignets were great, the rest of the food was sub par. The Cajun hash was not good. And the breakfast sandwich was strange in that it was basically an omelet put on a croissant. The area where the cafe is is cute and it's nice that they have live music in the morning. On our way out we got some bloody Mary's and those were excellent.

Great little spot to grab a quick breakfast. Seating can be limited at times but I've never had an issue getting a seat. It is very easy to order and they have many items for self severe. You pay for everything at the end, the prices are very reasonable. Delicious egg, meat and cheese breakfast sandwiches and fresh fruit!

Came to grab some dinner and had such a great experience with Chris! We ended up in the middle of the dinner rush on top of the Music City bowl and he handled all of his tables like a true professional. Great food, great drinks, excellent service!

My first ever yelp review. I'm not the type to write reviews but Tuna Bar was just fantastic and I wanted to support the new restaurant in the neighborhood.

We ordered the pork gyoza, tuna crudo, toro sashimi and two sushi rolls. All were out of this world good. You could tell how fresh the fish was. 

Only house sake being served right now but waiter told us a full sake menu will be offered shortly.

I highly recommend Tuna Bar and I can say for sure that I will be back.

Stopped by here before a Blues game. The atmosphere is really cool and hip. They've got a solid menu full of burgers (chicken, bison, veggie and beef.) They also offer some appetizers, ice cream, and other dishes. I got the Buffalo Chicken Burger was good but small overall, however I got large fries and a shake so plenty of food. You get multiple dipping sauces with fries would recommend the Cheese and Siracha Mayo personally. Shake wise go for Cinnamon so good!

Awesome food! Get extra gravy for the chicken and waffles cuz it's awesome! Wife had the three tacos! Had to box one, she is a lil one so three huge awesome tacos did her in! Lol, place is a cool atmosphere waitress was fun friendly and fast! Thx for a great dining exsperience!

I placed an order through DoorDash and when it was brought to me, the fries I ordered weren't there. The driver told me to call Cheesecake Factory for a refund (which didn't make sense since I paid doordash and the driver wasn't about to go and pick them up for me which was the sole purpose of his job anyway) POINT IS, I called CF anyway and the manager Justin was so nice, he offered up one of his employees to bring me my fries. I didn't want to inconvenience them in anyway because that seems ludicrous for just some fries. But he mentioned he just wants his customer to be happy and I mean, duh, I got my fries. I'm totally happy. And happy with good management. 10/10

Delicious pancakes, crispy bacon, and friendly smiles from the staff all around. I love this place. So much so that I had to stop and write this review :) Great customer service is not always a first priority of restaurants and other businesses these days, so it really made my day to see that these people were so genuine and nice.

TERRIBLE service ruined the meal entirely. Our main waiter took our order and then never once did he come back to the table, despite the fact that after 45 minutes we still had no food and needed drink refills. He was checking on other tables around us, but he wouldn't even look at us. The second waiter (Rhett or Brett?) was trying his best, he brought us a second round of drinks and finally brought our food. My husband and I split a burger, each of our kids had pasta, and our granddaughter had fried fish. Our $18 burger and fries were stone cold, completely inedible (this should have been that big, delicious burger you can only get at a bistro). The two pasta dishes were both terrible - the Shrimp & Angel hair Pasta was bland and tasteless, and the Pasta Jambalaya was just gross, it tasted awful. My granddaughter's fried speckled trout was actually delicious. We sent the burger back and waited, and waited, and waited some more. Keep in mind, our main waiter could see all of this unfolding the entire time and still never approached us. Finally we asked to speak to the manager, he didn't seem too concerned and he never apologized, just said he would "go find our burger." After another 15 min or so, we got up to leave and the manager finally showed up with our burger. By this point we didn't even care. Finally, the manager became apologetic and offered to comp our meal, he boxed up our burger to go. After two hours of waiting in a beautiful restaurant, my husband and I ended up hurriedly eating our burger in an Uber on the way to City Park. We will NEVER go back, nor recommend it to anyone. We live just a couple of hours from NOLA and visit frequently; in a city with so many fabulous places to eat, why would we ever give our business to a restaurant that treated us so poorly?
I went there Saturday night the food is always exceptional and the service is great thanks guys for making my evening wonderful after I had such a bad experience earlierat another establishment.

Looked for a recommended place as we were traveling through, and this one had great reviews.  Decided to stop and walked in at 732 on a Friday night and was told by someone they were closed already.  Another person walked in behind me and was told the same thing.  Well they should fix their website so that it reflects their hours of operation accurately! Besides what type of resturants closes at 730 on a Friday night.

Super full on a budget.  Several different meats to choose from with the taco bar option.  Good hang-out atmosphere without too many people in the evening during the week.  Plenty of seating divided in a couple rooms.  Warm friendly staff.

Sometimes your curiosity gets the best of you and you have to find out what's behind the door. Walking around the neighborhood we stumbled upon The Saint and were curious what this joint was. Without checking Yelp and opting to just find out for ourselves, we walked into this bar to discover some flavor.

From the one-of-a-kind-altar, karaoke night on Tuesday, a sex toy arcade game, photobooth, and all the eclectic decorations- we knew we were in for a fun time. Drinks are very well priced and this bar is no frills when it comes to its vibe. Stellar liquor selection and ample amount of seating, inside and out, you can guarantee you'll have a great time. Bathrooms are definnitely divey but you wouldn't be walking into this joing if dive bars weren't your jam.

Brandon is the best electrician in Santa Barbara! I've worked with 2 or 3 others here in town. We've used Brandon for small jobs, medium jobs, and now adding a bathroom to our home. He's working with our Contractor. He shows up when he says he will and he does great work consistently! I tried to send him home one summer, he was working in our attic in unbearable temperatures (we were uncomfortable being in the house), but he stayed and finished the job. I have multiple jobs coming up during our remodel and he's the only guy I'lll use. He'll offer educated opinions and help you make the best decisions. Kind. Professional. Courteous. Smart! I can't say enough!!!!

I have been to Luxury Nails twice now.  Each time I've gone, I've been treated with the utmost kindness from all of the employees there.  It is a clean, calming environment.  Lots of colors to choose from.  I get acrylic fills with gel polish; each time their work has been consistent, and they give a lot of attention to detail.  I have had both Amy and Anne do my nails; both are lovely women.  I arrived without an appointment today, and I was greeted immediately and told there would be a brief wait; it was about 15 minutes, which I find completely acceptable.  I will continue to patronize this business, and I highly recommend it to others!

Chick-fil-A is always pretty great. I know it's a fast food restaurant but I think this one runs exceptionally well. The employees are always super friendly and accommodating. I ordered the side salad with honey mustard dressing and the spicy chicken sandwich. When my lunch came I ditched the bun and put the chicken on the salad. Excellent decision. I still got that spicy chicken flavor but didn't get the bun laden with white flour and refined carbohydrates. Delicious lunch in a hurry. I'll be back!

Never disappointed, great selections excellent customer service.  Food quality is excellent it's always a great time.
Excellent can't say enough about this place.

Great pina coolata, really good tuna bowl and very good shrimp Po boy! Had sausage on it FYI.
Nice and warm on patio because they had additional ceiling heaters not just the stand alone ones.

This was the worst brunch I've ever had. Ordered the Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sandwhich; chicken was pale white, soggy with oil, definitely not fried and drained well, and might have even been slightly undercooked. The side green salad was just leaves, no dressing, no veggies, bland and neglected. The sandwich had absolutely no flavor, no taste, undercooked chicken, and strong pickles. Overall just a terrible experience and it took 25min to get the check back. Never coming back; you're better off going to a local diner or fast food restaurant for higher quality/edible food.

We love Chase!  The food was wonderful and the service even more so. The atmosphere is warm, fun, inviting, cool! We came while in SB holiday shopping and were wowed by the amazing decorations; everywhere, hanging from the ceiling, atop the bar, and every other place one could be squeezed in. A complete delight. I had the grilled salmon which was excellent, and my husband loved his chicken piccata.  Terrific experience!

We decided on Milk and Honey for brunch after a long morning of flights in Nashville. Our original plan was to visit Biscuit Love, but the line was long and Milk and Honey had only a short wait.
