The sausage and pepper omelette was a perfect size for a hungry guy and was cooked perfectly. Fresh peppers and delicious breakfast sausage.  My girlfriend had scrambled eggs, caramelized onions and arugula on a biscuit which looked amazing. She said it was quite good!  


Update: upon further review of their wood fired pizza oven we decided to return for dinner. Excellent choice. The braised short rib and gnocchi was phenomenal and the pie was a perfect Neapolitan style margherita. Would definitely come back again and I recommend you try it! 

Pro Tip: save room for their cookies

Great happy hour food and bartenders. Doesn't get too busy on the weekdays or during Saturday brunch. 
Would only change the pickle spears that comes with the chicken sandwiches. They taste like they were brined in just salt.

I first got into La Colombe coffee from the cans they sell at the supermarket but this was my first time at a store.  I tried the triple shot draft latte and it was so smooth and light and even better than the can when you drink it on tap.  I also tried the Black and Tan which is half latte and half black cold brew coffee and it was good too but I prefer the latte.  They have coffees and sell some pastries but I'm coming back for more lattes.

I want this to be a four-star or more place, I really do. Alas, it wasn't in the cards. Let me lay it out real simple like:

Pros:
- excellent ambience
- central location
- easy (car) parking when I visited 
- line is infinitely shorter than Biscuit Love (no line vs. 25 deep)

Cons:
- no apparent bike parking
- coffee took 10 minutes from order to first sip
- portions were small for the price
- eggs benny were amazingly bland, and this is how I judge a breakfast location

There you have it. A solid 3 stars. If my tab for a mediocre small breakfast and slow coffee hadn't been $20, I'd maybe think about 4 stars. Maybe.

You better have lots of time to burn.  We were on vacation so we didn't.  Food was okay, bacon was under cooked, hash browns were over cooked.  We were there for and hour and half, that's a long breakfast.  They did take our drinks off for the delay.

Amazing dive shop with top rated gear and staff!  I've been diving for years and recently moved to the area looking for a dive shop.  I couldn't be happier with infinite descent.  Connor, Maria, and Eric "Hollywood" are all extremely knowledgeable.  I had great dives in the gulf where I saw schools of fish, goliath groupers, and a large turtle.  They also do spearfishing.  It's also one of the only dive shops in the area that has their boats go straight out from behind the shop.  Extremely convenient!  I can't say enough great things about this shop.  Be sure to check it out!

Stumbled upon this place because all the other bars were closed because of a water main break. We were going to order food until we walked in and saw it was a little run down and the bathroom was disgusting. Decided to just get a beer and leave. Wasn't worth our time.

This place is literally heaven , i lived in NY and still visit every few months , I've tried so Many thai food places there , nothing like this place , what ever you get , you genuinely can't go wrong, and then the owner and his wife are just Strolling in the store with there smiling faces , i tell everyone about this place and i always will  , can't imagine my life without there chicken cashew. GOOD GOD it's hella awesome

My wife and I went there for dinner last night. It is a bit pricey, but the variety is amazing. Now to critique the food.  things that I would say were exceptional; the Dungeness crab legs and the frog legs. I have never seen a bigger frog leg in a restaurant, much less a buffet. The boiled seafood with the exception of the Dungeness were over-spiced with crab boil to the point that they were not good. Most of the fried food was too salty.  For $40 per person I wouldn't return very often.

Look no further! This is where you want to get your alterations done! I have been here twice and both experiences have been so quick and easy. Not to mention, the people that work here are extremely friendly and understand exactly what you're looking to get done. I just brought an item in today and didn't realize they were going to be closed until after New Years and I had an outfit I needed for NYE. Without hesitation, she told me she would have it done the same day and she wouldn't charge me any extra for rush alterations. Boom- outfit done in LESS THAN THREE HOURS! I can't say enough good things. Just go see them if you need alterations done in the Nashville area!

Annamaria the GM is absolutely amazing! Her customer service is above and beyond, and we were thoroughly impressed!! We found this place by accident and stayed because the food, service and atmosphere was amazing!!!! What a gem!

Really awesome place to get home decor. We even found gifts here to give to parents, hosts, etc. we got 2 really beautiful and inexpensive vases. The recipients adored the vases! Pretty and unique. The man who worked there was very friendly as well which is always a plus. He also gift wrapped them for us. I really wanted to buy this tray of candle holders but my husband was being impatient. I am so upset I didn't buy it! 
Highly recommend. 
Definitely worth the stop

We were staying right down the street from this place and it was recommended by the girl at the front desk of our hotel. We actually went to get a few drinks and bite to eat on a Friday night. The atmosphere is really nice and the bar is really big. Definitely a good bar to watch football game at or any sports game at. My girlfriend and I both had different signature cocktails which were really good. I had the fish tacos which were out of this world! So good I can't even tell you, you'll have to try them for yourself! My girlfriend had the seared tuna which was also great, a little spicy so watch out for that if you don't like spicy. 

We went back the next morning for brunch. I ordered the Benedict Uno which was eggs benedict with short rib and a tabasco hollandaise sauce. I also ordered a side of the white trash hash. First off all, the white trash hash was out of this world! So different and unique and so good it was amazing. The reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because of the Benedict. I always order Eggs Benedict and no matter what kind of Hollandaise sauce it comes with I've never thought of ordering it on the side. For this Benedict I should of. It was drenched in the tabasco hollandaise sauce which wasn't bad but just was way way way too much. I couldn't even taste the egg or could see if I was eating egg or just all sauce. It honestly made me sick after we left. I wish there was half the amount they gave me or I should of got it on the side but like I said, I've never had a problem with too much hollandaise sauce. The picture below is deceiving because it doesn't look like a lot of sauce but there really was. Other then that everything was terrific! I just hope they over did my Benedict and don't do that for every Benedict dish they serve.

Ordinary sports bar with typical American bar eats. It does have a decent happy hour, which lasts til 7pm (at least add of the date of my visit) so it is reasonably priced. Brick offers one of many very similarly themed pubs in this area of Tampa. There was nothing extraordinary about this place compared to many others in this area.

Rescue is a world class spa and Philadelphia (and now, NYC!) destination. Sublime facials and skin products, wonderful manicures and pedicures that last and last, expert massages, festive events and generous samples, hair and make up applications like no-other. Again and again, I walk in frumpy and tired... and walk out energized, nourished, glowing and polished from head to toe. Thank you Danuta Mieloch and your superb team for creating a place of refuge, calm and beauty in the middle of our metropolis.  

Rescue Spa NYC is gorgeous!

My husband recently sold a car to car max. It belonged to his father, recently deceased. We didn't need to trade it in, and weren't too excited about trying to sell it ourselves. He took it in to them one evening. They looked it over, gave him an offer that was comparable to Kelly Blue book. The next day we took in the title and the written offer. The whole experience took 20 minutes! Hassle free!

You ask the community to support you.. And we do.. I come here ALL.. I spend more time waiting in line than I do actually shopping it's very frustrating to see ALL the closed lanes.. Hire some more people from the community and fix this problem. You're not only more expensive than Wal-Mart, but you're becoming more inconvenient as well

I am not new to sushi restaurants. I have been to many, and have a definite idea of what good sushi is and what bad sushi is. This was BAD sushi. As a USF student, getting 10% off by showing my ID is very exciting. Unfortunately, I would have rather paid more elsewhere and received an edible dinner. 

The first red flag was showing up at "happy hour" and there being only one other group inside the restaurant. The menu for happy hour sushi was also more expensive than their regular menu for the same items, which was confusing. Another red flag was that most of the rolls listed were marked with an asterisk as cooked...when there is only a handful of raw sushi options, you know your meal is going to be questionable. 

I started with the ginger salad, which was a laughable loose handful of iceberg lettuce, string cut carrots, and a swamping of dressing. I could have poured the leftover, watery dressing into a wine glass. I asked about their special, which I think was called "Smokey", because I am a fan of smoked raw salmon...the waiter cringed and recommended I try something else. I should have left after that. 

The smoked salmon was listed as cooked, which also shocked me because anywhere else I go, restaurants cold-smoke their fish. It shouldn't be cooked at all, just flavored with smoke. After inquiring about the Salmon Lover's smoked roll, the waiter said that yes, it's cooked, but it has the texture of raw fish. Sounds fake, but okay...I ordered it, hoping I was misunderstanding him.

The rolls came out quickly, but the meal itself would have gone quicker had they just thrown it into the trash after making it rather than bring it to my table. The "smoked" salmon didn't taste smoky, and they had the texture of raw fish because it WAS raw--and beyond safe food temperatures! it didn't flake like cooked salmon and was slimy. It tasted spoiled. The tempura flakes inside the roll also had a disgusting, bitter taste that overpowered the entire roll. I didn't eat the rest of it, and hoped they'd take it off my bill. It was $12 for that monstrosity, and I was praying that I didn't get food poisoning from the few bites I risked. I told the waiter I didn't like it, and when he returned with my bill, the nasty roll remained but it appeared he had removed the cost of my $2 salad. Yippee.

Ultimately, the whole experience was absurd and a waste of time. I was there with two other friends, one of which who also eats raw sushi and didn't enjoy her experience either, and one who exclusively eats cooked rolls. She thought her food was good. 
If your frame of reference of good sushi is cooked(?) or store-bought, this is your place.
Otherwise, save your money and avoid food poisoning--STAY AWAY!
I will never be coming back here.
Nice staff and clean little restaurant. Authentic and tasty. One of very few places that offers pozole.

Got in under the wire for their pre fixe lunch deal. Had the goat cheese and shrimp crepe to start. Must admit I've had these before at FQF,, and as usual outstanding. Wifey ordered the fire grilled pork chop with red beans and rice.  I ordered the blackened catfish. Oops, several minutes after ordering told they ran out of the catfish. Oh well, nothing wrong with a pork chop for lunch.  It was fantabulous..tender, and you could tell it was fire grilled by the grill marks and the flavor. Oh we had a curry tomato crab soup, also outstanding. Also included was a glass of wine. $20.00 bucks!!@@ are you kidding me. Going back tomorrow.

My husband and I ate here while shopping in Metairie. We decided we felt like having sandwiches, so I opened Yelp and this spot grabbed my attention. I was very pleased we decided to eat here. There are many sandwich options, as well as a really nice side selection. They also have small plates for those who are not very hungry and also kid options. Not to mention, there is also a full bar. The atmosphere is friendly, inviting and casual. It's not a place to impress a date at, but it is a nice, chill spot with good food. I had the Cuban sandwich with parmesan fries and the hubby had a club sandwich with regular fries. We both enjoyed our quick meal here and have stated we will more than likely be back!
Great beer selection, food is really good although the menu is skewed a bit nontraditional. Very lively environment, expect to wait a little even with reservations.

Great little Italian bistro- casual attire solid Classic American Italian dishes at a fair price. I had the House Calzone and subbed the Genoa out for their homemade meatballs. My wife had the classic stuffed shells in sauce which came with a house salad & garlic knots. Both were prepared well & were generous portions. Our waitress, Kirsten, was helpful and took care of all our extra requests promptly.

Wow wow wow wow. So good. They measure and use so much precision and care with each cup. Best coffee I've ever tried. Best fresh grapefruit juice (local) and best mocha. The cascara tea is really special too.

Love eating here. Staff is friendly and I always get seated right away. My fiance found a piece of zip tie in his food and they were so apologetic about it. They gave us that meal for free and gave us free desert. Everyone is so nice and the food is amazing.

I've visited Treetops Kitty Cafe several times now (every time I'm in town) and each visit has been wonderful.  The cats are happy and well taken care of.  The staff is hardworking and very loving with the cats.  It's a new business and they are always looking for good volunteers but it's run by a devoted, caring group of people taking care of these adorable kitties until they find their forever homes.  It's a great community of people working together to get cats placed in good homes and the loving environment of the kitty cafe is a marvelous place for these cats while they wait for their new homes.

Dinner here last night was amazing. This restaurant is definitely considered fine dining. We celebrated a birthday, and we had great service. Allison, our waitress was very hospitable. She was a great help when it came to recommending dishes, and was super funny. For appetizers, we ordered the escargot and fried artichokes. Omg, both dishes were delectable! I have not had escargot in years, and they were so yummy. Once you get past the whole idea that you're consuming a snail, you will see it is quite delicious. The texture is similar to eating a mushroom. They were served in a garlic oil sauce and sprinkled cheese on top that was divine for dipping your bread in. The fried artichoke came with a spicy chipotle mayo drizzled over it that was so yummy. For entrees we ordered chilean sea bass, monk fish, seafood crepes, and lamb shank. Everyone loved their meals! We were also served string beans and rice. My seafood crepe was filled with crab, scallops, and shrimp. I loved it. I never tried monk fish before, and I tried some of hubbys. It was very good and had a very different texture then typical white fish does. I also learned it is known as the "poor man's lobster". It was very good. Dessert entailed a berry profiterole with ice cream that everyone shared. This restaurant was beautifully decorated, service was great, and I highly recommend trying this place out if in the Treasure Island area.

First Burrito Sushi I ever ate.   Has to be in the top 5 Sushi items I have eaten. Phenomenal taste and fresh. I live in the other side of the state but I will be back to devour many more sushi burritos in the future.

You need to try this place. I saw the reviews here and thought I would give it a try for a pedicure. I was not disappointed. I got the Spa pedicure and loved every minute of it. My next service is going to be a dipping powder manicure.

Our 1.5yr old "new" Pitbull rescue gets along ok with our other 2 dogs, but is a total attention hog and would mow the others down to get it!  Rachel  spent several days working with him.  She also spent a lot of time with us to ensure we understood the commands and training to continue at home.  You can tell they love these dogs and treat as if they were on
We have lost count but think this might be our 7th or 8th Peppermill stay.

While I am normally very unimpressed with this location on the night I came there was a new manager named Brian who was very Hands-On and spoke to every table, was backing up the servers running food out and helping clean. The bathroom on this night was the cleanest I have ever seen it. In my server Miss Stephanie was Top Notch. She was genuinely awesome best server I've had in a long time.
Seriously tho, why change the noodles from beef noodle soup to some cheap non chewy dry noodles!!??
Best lobster roll in town! Get there early or order at the window outside.  Yummy

I am just updating this review, it took a lot longer than expected to hear back from someone at The Grove Hotel but we received many apologies and they are doing everything to make it right, it's not our wedding night but they have done above and beyond to show that they absolutely are sincere and they did what they could. We appreciate it more than ever and hope that we we get to use our free stay, we can actually enjoy it. Thank you Grove Hotel!

I had high hopes for this place but coming from a southern family I've been spoiled. The chicken tenders were dry, the mac & cheese was good, the herb beef was excellent, the cauliflower side was good, the green bean casserole was OK, and the cornbread was just OK. Positive: extremely fast service!

Worst experience ever. They charged us 3800 bucks for deposit while we provided the docs they asked for(proof of income). I live in LA and my bf lives there. I have a dog, which stays with me most of the time and I bring it with me to visit my bf, like probably once in two weeks, and the leasing office was trying so hard to make us pay the 1000 bucks for a dog deposit. They really made me feel like all they care about is money money and money. Of course we ignored it, and then they emailed us, threatened our roommates "if you don't pay the dog deposit, you will be kicked out". So we paid for it. And then I decided I'm just never gonna come to this community any more, so I asked my bf to take back the check( at that time I was visiting with my dog but I'll be back in 2 days), and the woman in the office said that "you either signed the document or you gotta send the dog away RIGHT NOW". almost forgot to mention that they are so good at asking for money but have not given us the garage keys or the other gym key since my bfs moved in for 1 month:)
Expensive mediocre food. Ham swiss spinach sandwich was okay but wouldn't bother coming here again.

I was visiting my best friends sister on music row and she recommended Edgehill Cafe to us because we were looking to grab a quick bite to eat. I walked in around 10:30 and walked up to the counter and was told the kitchen was closed. Talk about feeling bummed out after looking over their tasty menu options. We were standing outside for about 10 minutes and got called back in because the kitchen was some how opening. I am not sure what happened, but I am sure glad I was able to order my Belgian waffle. I added bananas and chocolate chips for a .50 cent up charge and it took the waffle to the next level. The waffle is made with a cinnamon vanilla buckwheat batter and topped with walnuts and syrup. The waffle also comes with a side and I went with the bacon of course. It was nice thick and crispy. You can tell they only use the freshest of ingredients. The coffee mugs are a pretty decent size which allowed me to enjoy more of my peach white tea. 

What I thought made this cafe unique was that it served beer. This isn't your typical coffee shop. They have something for everyone. You also order at the counter and they will bring the food out to you when its ready. The interior was very modern chic. I loved the tufted benches and light fixture in the larger dining area. They also have a really neat patio and lots of tables inside. I would recommend this place if you are looking to grab a quick breakfast.

I've been here two times and I love it -- the shawarma bowls are so good and the chicken is tender. The pita is pillowy and soft, the naf fries are perfection!! The whole meal + fries came out to only about 11 dollars, and I left feeling full with some to take home. The food is delicious and fresh, definitely worth a try if you're looking for vegetarian/healthy options.

I've enjoyed delicious lunches from Three Carrots' City Market stand for years and was excited to try supper at their new sit-down restaurant. We loved the  poutine as an appetizer. The BBQ seitan was great. I enjoyed the fettuccine Alfredo--it had a strong nutmeg flavor that was an unexpected but festive touch for the holiday season. They have a good selection of Indiana beer. It's great to have a vegan restaurant downtown, and it's a good place to try if you're skeptical of or intimidated by vegetarian food, since they have some traditional comfort foods. The place was busy on a Saturday night, but we were seated quickly and the staff was friendly and attentive.

Ordered the Edamames, The Saint Sushi Roll and the veggie tempura(lil greasy).. My sister ordered the shrimp and and grits. Everything was excellent. Unfortunately the greasy tempura didn't agree with her...

I've never had an issue with this location until now. I went through the drive thru and ordered 3 entrees. After getting home my husband and I began to chow down on our food. I always look at my food before each bite and I'm glad I do otherwise I would never have noticed the long nasty hair wrapped in my food. It is definitely not my hair because I have black hair. The hair in my food was light brown. Let's just say this ruined my appetite and I will never come back here again! Disgusting!

Such a St. Pete gem! Delicious pastries, great selection of wines, fresh pasta, pizza, and sandwiches. It's always packed but the wait isn't usually long. They are a well oiled machine at Mazzaro's. If you experience a long wait it's definitely worth the wait.  

Don't let the sensory overload get you down, take your time, you won't regret it!

This is a fantastic place to dine. The food is absolutely delicious. We ate the bruschetta sampler as our appetizer. I would return just to eat that with a salad! I ordered the Gorgonzola encrusted medallions and my boyfriend had the sea bass. We couldn't stop talking about how delicious our food was. Our server was first class. She knew her menu and her service was spot on!

Truly amazing meal. Favorite part by far was the hamachi curry. Cocktails were excellent. Also ordered the smoked tuna tartare, conch croquettes, broiled shrimp and goat curry- the most tender meat I've had in a long time! Our server Claire was very knowledgeable and fun. Highly recommend for a special night out!

Dropped in Cheu on a Sunday afternoon and had no wait.  Enjoyed the Mojo Pork Dumplings while they prepared our ramen bowls.  The dumplings were outstanding.  The Miso Ramen and Brisket Ramen bowls we had were very good - rich in flavor, spiced just right, unique sauces.  Cheu is a funky place with a young, cozy vibe.  If I lived in downtown Philly, Cheu would be a weekly visit.
Michael did a great job with my persistent back and neck pain. He seems well trained in shiatsu and some thai techniques. Would definitely go back!

Been here before but yesterday was extra good!They had pasta with garlic olive oil and scallops.It was amazing it wasn't a overly large portion of food but it filled me up!My husband got an item that was on the menu and it was also good.Service was great but I forgot the young lady's name.
I had the best pedicure ever today! The folks in this salon are so nice and friendly. Plus, they do a wonderful job and their prices are great!

Great place for a quick and easy lunch. Super clean and vibrant. Large salads with lots of flavor. Only downfall is having to park in the garage, wish there was more street parking. The prices are a little high as well....

My first time and what an amazing treat. The empanadas were amazing and I ordered the pork tenderloin which was cooked to perfection. I also had the carriage house margarita which was yummy. Everything was wonderful including our very helpful and knowledgeable server Miriam! I will definitely be back

I am a really big fan of this place.

Their food is pretty good and the beer is great.

I love the atmosphere. Its a great place to watch a game or just relax with a flight and play shuffleboard. 

Barrio is a must try on the Tucson beer circuit.

The Wine Tap has a great line up of beer and wines.  I love the atmosphere here too.  Its a quiet wine bar with an old world feel.  Their food menu is pretty limited, mainly to brick fire pizzas and meat/cheese plates but its not advertising itself as a restaurant so that's okay.  Their back patio has a retractable roof so its open year round regardless of the weather.  Come on that's kind of cool!

What's holding me back from giving them a 5 star review is their waitstaff.  Sometimes they're hard to track down and none of the are educated on their wine and beer menu.

Drove by after an early doctors visit. Hospitals make me hungry. Got the Pecan Bun and coffee. 
This sticky piece of heaven had me sold on the first bite. I'm talking fluffed pastry and sugary happiness filled my jaws. Coffee to dissolve the bun into itty bitty particles of joy. 
It lifted my day so much that even though I drove in the wrong direction home ; adding 20 min to my drive, I did not even care. 
Coffee had great aromatics and flavorful accents. Basically it tastes like love.

I didn't even mind the sticky remnants in my beard. They shall be missed.

Recently my wife and I have been looking for a new mid size pickup truck.  On a recommendation from a friend we went into Santa Barbara Toyota and took a Tacoma out for a test drive.  The first day we dealt with Armando and Frank.  Both were great guys!  They were personable and very easy going.  We went over our options, talked some pricing and my wife and walked out with a good feeling about working with them.  Our initial plan was to go visit a few other dealers and see what else was out there, however, after sleeping on it for a night we were both in agreement that that was the best experience we have had at a dealer to date.  At home that night I shopped pricing and found that I was getting about the best deal available in the state.  I went in the next day and purchased the truck.  I worked with Derek to iron out all the details and Hector in finance to get my loan squared away.  Both were very personable, professional, and it was honestly the easiest car buying experience I have ever had.  I will be a customer here for the long haul as I really feel that buying a car can't get any better than going to Santa Barbara Toyota.  Thanks to everyone I really appreciate all the help and advice plus I'm loving my new truck!

Went to this location last Thursday as I was in the neighborhood working.  My first visit to this Taco Bell.  I used the bathroom before ordering  and when I went to wash my hand I put soap on my hands and tried to turn on the water and it was dead.  No hot or cold water.  No towels either to wipe the soap off.  Lovely.  Now I have to go out to the there restaurant area to wipe the soap off using napkins.  No biggie, things happen.  However, when I mentioned the problem to an employee She looked me in the eye, then turned around and walked away.  2 other employees right next to Her also pretended not to hear me.  So how many others belted out a deuce only to have their dirty hands touch the door, napkins and soda fountains etc.  How are the employees washing their hands? Mama Mia Diarrhea! How do places like this survive?

I have been several times and recommended to visitors.  Everybody has been very pleased.  I am a foodie from the East and Europe and was quite surprised by the quality of the food and the freshness.  I very rarely eat fried food but was totally happy with the pakoras (spinach and vegetable).  It was apparent that they had just been made and the chickpea flour covering was a tasty combination of crunch and chewiness.  With our guests they were gone in a heartbeat.  We had several curries, mostly lamb and chicken as well as naan and papadam.  A nice assortment of well priced Indian and other beers to match.  Friendly, knowledgeable and efficient service.  I think they are seeing the success they well deserve.

This is my go to froyo place whenever I've got the munchies or drunchies (drunken munchies) and I'm on South Street... so basically every time I'm on the eastern side of South Street! There are always plenty of flavors of frozen yogurt and lots of fresh, tasty toppings to create a masterpiece with. The bathroom is always clean, and I've always been able to find a spot to eat inside.
Awesome Pizza! Large pie,wings,and a 2 liter very reasonable , delivered to our hotel . Had the Neopolitan. Fast delivery even on NYE
Prices aren't bad there at all...only prob i have is picking what toppings i want being that there's sooo much to choose from!
This is by far my favorite breakfast spot in all Tucson.  The food is fresh, local, and delicious!  I've never been disappointed by a dish.

Super amazing breakfast spot. Food is amazing, service is amazing, and you don't have to wait in lone at 7am to get a table. I live downtown and this is my go to spot when I don't want to make breakfast.

Pretty good preparation on the salads BUT the lady that runs it can be very moody at times almost to the point of being rude. Her husband is a sweet heart. One time the women was extremely rude and had the nerve to charge for an extra butter. So when you go inside you pick the size of your salad and then either you can get bread or a banana but this time I ordered the bread and I must say they're bread rolls are really good but the little tub of butter they give you is not even enough to butter the whole bread so when she charged me I was a little taken back surprised to say the least. Love their salads that's why I rated them them a 3. But their customer service I would definitely give them 2. Size of place is nice.

I've been many times and love the surprise selections. Always friendly service although sometimes it's difficult to find a waitress. The food is always great and large servings. It's my go to when I can't think of a place to go

So, I just moved back to Florida from Northern Virginia.  Felt the need for something different for lunch today and popped in to Zio's and am I glad I did!  What to order, what to order . . . homemade Italian sausage (sweet, not hot the first time around) with peppers and onions.  First of all, half a sub is still HUGE and I could only eat half of it; secondly, it was absolutely delicious.  Sadly, this place is too close to my new house - my hips and thighs thank you.
Sometimes they'll deliver to my job, sometimes they won't. I'd rather just not deal with them anymore and give my business to someone else.
Wonderful food and service.   Busy New Years night, but was able to get seat near bar, super friendly staff,had a great dinner.

I love these pizzas. They have a good selection of specialty pizzas. The salads are also good. They will let you buy their dough. On some busy weekends, I will just go there to pick up dough that is various sizes and prices (even keeps well in the fridge for a couple days until you are ready to make a pizza at home).

Good solid breakfast order the lot,  a good portion of food yet not over full like other places,  the coffee was refilled continuously without impatiently waiting on the staff UNLIKE all 5 of the other breakfast places I went to in Philadelphia.  Went two mornings in a row if I wasn't flying out it'd be 3.

This pizzeria was not bad, but it was really mediocre and the pizza wasn't remarkable. It was St. Louis style pizza, but it really lacked the robust flavor found at most of the St. Louis pizza places. It's not bad, but if you want St. Louis style pizza, there are other places close by that do a lot better.

First stop here. Just driving by and decided to check it out. Very pleased. Sat at the bar as we did not want to commit to more than a cocktail. Realized pretty quick this place was a good pick. Drinks were perfect. Ordered a veal dish and it was perfect. Absolutely coming back. Service was great. Tyler at the bar was attentive and answered our many questions. This was a great dinner.

Nobody greeted me. I had to walk over to a waiter to ask for a drink. Naan wasn't good...I think they cooked too much ahead of time.  Good variety on the buffet. One guy left mad because they sat him back in an odd place by speaker and bathroom and they didn't seem too concerned that he left. They would do well if this was the only option - but there is a lot of competition now. Need to improve service and atmosphere if they want to stay open.  I may go back, but I think it's worth the extra drive to go to Cool Springs or Taj.

I won't return to this restaurant. It's especially not for health-minded eaters. There isn't much of a selection on the food menu. The salads were unique, but the house salad entree I ordered had a bunch of oil on it.  My dressing was on the side like I asked.  The side for almost all entrees is just garlic mashed potatoes.

A fabulous shop!!! Eclectic finds! Unique, yet somehow something for everyone! I completed my holiday shopping in one visit! A shame I don't live nearby. Will definitely visit the next time I'm in town!

Yesterday I purchased a certified preowned car.
Salesman was a wimp and the sales manager Ed Merrill a total
d*#@!!!  Couldn't care less about the customer, only their pockets.
There was no hiding my lack of enthusiasm.
If it didn't need the car and had an alternative i would have walked.
Whereas the car went into get detailed and prepare a new key fob.
Took them 5 (FIVE) HOURS!  I watched and waited for an eternity.
I watched 3 mechanics in the garage  on their cell phones doing NOTHING!   Totally unprofessional dealership.
Buyer BEWARE!

I'm a big fan of the food at Zoe's Kitchen, and with the rewards program, they give a good amount of discounts. Fast casual, so you get the food quickly, but everything tastes clean and healthy. It's a tad on the pricey side, but bonuses through the rewards program help!

I didn't dine in when I went - I had ordered my meal on the app and gone to pick it up. It was ready when I arrived, and everything I needed (utensils and napkins) were in the bag too. This has always seemed like it should be second nature, but not all restaurants give that to you unless you ask, which I've found perplexing.

If I'm in the area again, I may find myself ordering food there again!

Thank you - thank you - I don't know the ladies name but (she walked with a limp her foot was injured )she was so awesome and helpful - I had been all over town looking for a rim to match my car because I hit an Indiana pot hole and cracked rim. She was the only one out of four tire automotive location willing to search her data base and find the exact tire rim to match the others I am so happy. Thank you service parts lady you are awesome.

What a wonderful dinner I just ate! Came here with five friends and the table we had was extremely accommodating. Love the mood lighting and stone tables. Our waitress, Stacey, was extremely lovely and answered all our questions! We had the rock shrimp and edamame as appetizers which both were very delicious! We shared a bunch of special rolls as well as sushi. The fish was very fresh and the soy sauce was very good! Overall a fabulous experience! Will be back soon!!!!

I wandered in here today with my boyfriend bc a silver shirt caught my eye from the street. The ladies working were so awesome. Friendly, helpful, and not annoying or pushy. The woman had to help me dress and clip the shirt on. She was very professional and it was a wonderful shopping experience. The store itself has so many great unique things. I wanted to buy it all. Don't miss this neat little shop. Also--- the prices are very reasonable. Nothing like some of the other boutiques. You could very easily get a one of a kind outfit with accessories for less than $100, maybe even less than $75. I love this store
Pitaya Bowl is amazing!! Need to branch out and try other bowls though because they all look so yummy!!
Best Indian restaurant in Pinellas County. Unfortunately too far for me to visit as much as I want!! delicious

Great experience with Ben who guided us to the perfect place.  He was very attentive to our needs and guided us to the best apartment for our needs.  We were moving from Vermont and were more than a bit overwhelmed with the search for an apartment.  Ben made the process effortless and enjoyable!

I would highly recommend Nashville Apartment Locators to anyone!

I called and tried to ask Jose a question about the appointment I made and he could not answer my question, nor did he try to find the answer for me. He was very short with me. I asked if I could cancel my appointment and he said yes, and then hung up on me. Poor customer service. Won't be using this company for future projects.

What a gem! My husband and I were staying in the Treme, and Lil' Dizzy's Café was recommended by our Airbnb host. It was a quick walk and we are so glad we made the trip! We were there for breakfast (their lunch does not start until 11, so if you want fried chicken you have to go after that time!) That said, breakfast was incredible! I had the shrimp grillade, their version of shrimp and grits, with a homemade biscuit, and my husband had a jambalaya omelette. So tasty! Exactly the comfort food we needed on a chilly winter NOLA day. The service was incredible; everyone made us feel very welcome and we saw three or four folks during our dining experience, including the owner, all helping to make our experience positive. The music station they play is pretty great too. We truly loved it and will definitely be back! Best breakfast in the Treme for sure!
It's 8pm I'm the only customer and it took 20 mins just to make my pizza and me receive it! The place was dirty and the employees were very unprofessional... good luck keeping your store open

Nice but expensive! I live in the Chicago area so I know that goceris can be costly but this place was more than I normally pay. I had to stop in while visiting family to get some salad fixings since I that was my potluck dish to bring.

Everything cost more than at home - lettuce, tomatoes, vinegar and herbs!

The store is big and has lots of food to go options with sushi and a salad bar but the layout seems a bit awkward as I kept having grocery cart traffic jams I need many areas.

It's nice but not worth the price!

Growing up here in the Bay Area I don't seem to take advantage of the nice long sidewalks. Today we started at the Vinoy and followed the side walk to the other end of the bay. Leading to this park.  Such a cute little playground on the water, lots of enclosed play space and with the airport right next to the park. Kids get up close to a plane taking off. Great local park with things to do for all ages.
I ordered popcorn chicken, beef stew with rice and stinky tofu. They were all good and closed to Real Taiwanese flavor. Stinky tofu was ok but kimchi was great.

Took an hour and a half for the oil change, never waited this long. Then somehow the $50 price became 80$ because my car took more oil. Never was I asked if I wanted the extra oil. I could have bought that myself. And that still hardly explains how it suddenly costs $30 more. And that's before tax and with the coupon. $100 full price for an oil change? That's a joke. People were nice though, not their fault pep boys robs you.
If you love calzones then you will love this place. They are so big that I am never able to finish them. Best calzone in STL.

The Logan Inn was a beautiful setting in New Hope, and the food was good, but our service was disappointing.  We were seated quickly as the restaurant was not busy.  A table directly adjacent to us had their water glasses filled as soon as they sat down.  We waited for about 5 minutes before anyone acknowledged our presence, and the waiter appeared disinterested in helping us when he finally came.  We had to ask for water and repeatedly ask for everything else, and generally received poor service.  The food was good, nothing special for the price and upscale setting.  I see that others had excellent service experience, including everyone around us that night with different servers.

We have had nothing but excellent experiences with TKO.  We used them for our wedding and for other family parties and have found them to be very accommodating and versatile.  They can match the personality of their DJ's to your needs.  In the words of the great Levar Burton "But Don't take my word for it". Try em out!

Lovely decor, very friendly and helpful staff and five star food. Fried oysters were amazing, the sushi was the best I have had in the phili area. The dumplings were also superb. They are updating their liquor list so the whiskeys were not listed BUT you can still order whatever you want. I will be back I ate this on Saturday and am already craving it again! I just wish they had fried rice but honestly everything was amazing

Can't beat 50 cent wings during Saints' games - every flavor is delicious! Who Dat!

Great environment, delicious drinks, and perfect football food. Try the Kentucky Sunrise - bourbon, maple syrup, red wine - sounds unusual but tastes better than you can imagine.

Love mellow mushroom!

Pretty bland pizza. It's just missing something. Maybe more sauce would help, or more cheese. I'm not sure. The workers were really friendly but I'm going to keep trying other pizza places until I find my favorite. This definitely isnt it.

Not just for breakfast anymore!
We are locals and would go for breakfast now and then, but did not care for lunch or dinner.
We heard it was under new management and decided to give it a try for dinner.
I will admit, we are food snobs. The food was unbelievable. We had chicken wings for an appetizer  ( recommended by a friend) chowder, mushroom Risotto and a special Cajun dish. Everything was delicious.
I hope they can hang on to that chef. 
Our server, Gabby was delightful and went the extra mile.
We will definitely be back.

We have been back several times and the food just gets better and better. Our new 'go to'

By far, this is the slowest DD in the area. Even if you're the only one in the drive thru, it'll take about 10 mins for 1 coffee. I waited 25 minutes last Friday with only 2 cars in line. The inside is not busy enough to warrant the long wait in the drive thru. I don't know who owns this location but it needs some serious work with speed & training. They also often get coffee orders wrong or don't add the flavor. I'm constantly checking before I pull away to make sure it's correct. There are a few gals who work the window that are very friendly, so I will give them that.

Got there to find that you no longer need to put your name down for a table but to seat yourself. So we had a party of 6 squeezed into a booth made for 4. We were gonna accept it since the place was packed and you had to fight for a place to eat here. But then a miracle happened and a larger booth opened up. We already gotten out food but the waitress was really nice and let us move since it was still in her zone. No biggie. But then the service was not up to par. She only bought us one set of silverware. I figured she just put the one down to go and get 5 more. Nope. So we had to ask for plates and more silverware. She brings us the other half of our order and says she'll come back with the plates and silverware. Brings me my drink. By this time we almost done eating. No napkins. Ended up stealing a batch from the bar. No silverware. No plates. Finally she brings plates and silverware. But she only bought 4 silverware sets/napkins and 5 plates. We have a party of 6. You do the math. Then she disappears for the rest of our meal. We don't see her again. We ended up having to hunt her down to ask for our check. Also note that before all this we were almost given someone else's order. The people delivering it totally looked lost. 

This place is still running around with its head cut off. I noticed that there is an entire area in the back that they closed. Then you have people hoarding tables while their brats run around to play games. If they are not actively order a continuous food/drink I think they are done. Maybe give em a hint by giving them the check. Just saying. 

Also, if you parked in the garage they only have pay Stations on the first and 6th Floor. That's makes a whole lotta sense. People can either go down to the first floor pay for parking and then go back upstairs to whatever floor they parked on. That's not enough elevators for all that foot traffic. Or you can pay for parking before leaving the 6th floor where people are lined up to buy cards for the games and the foot traffic from the elevators. So now you adding to the foot traffic as well. Yippie. Have fun.

Best car buying experience we have ever been through.  We had a specific type of truck model in mind and price range that we wanted to stay within and saw a truck on their lot that fit the model.  We decided to stop by to ask about the price and found that it was out of our price range.  Harry Martell was the sales associate assisting us and asked specifically what we wanted and price range.  He said a vehicle matching our specifics had just been traded in and was still in the back.  We test drove the vehicle, loved it and without ANY hassle or annoying haggling that you normally experience at dealerships, Harry had us in our new truck and out the door in no time.  Richard, their finance manager had all of our paperwork ready to go and I have to say it was the easiest transaction we have ever experienced.  We appreciate the honesty, ethics and knowledge these two brought to the table.  We love our truck!  Thanks guys!

The server was eating at the same time she was waiting on our table. The salsa was just tomato paste very bland. Not worth the money 4th has better places than here. Food was cold and will never eat here again.

I thought it was time to replace the carpets.  Heaven's Best was recommended by our realtor.  We gave them a try and the carpets came out great!  They were super nice on the phone and very easy to work with.

My family and I had probably the weirdest/worst dining experience here. It seemed as if they weren't prepared to handle customers and the waitresses seemed stressed to the max. I guess the best way to describe it would be unprofessional. The food is also overpriced for the small portions that are served. Everyone in our group left hungry. One person got their pizza just as everyone else finished eating their meals. Although the food itself was good, I wouldn't recommend this restaurant or return. There are many other places to choose from on Main Street.

Not bad, but not fab. If you need your food fast, you may want to try another place. Considering airport prices, it makes it hard to say I'm a fan. The roast beef sandwich had a hint of horseradish. It would have been nice have more of a kick. Don't be afraid to ask for more sauce if thats your thing. The gu.y serving was cool dude and had a bit of the pirate vibe going which works well with the theme. I took a long time for the food to arrive. One guy had to pack his food. 
Overall not a bad experience. Very convenient though.

Ate here last night and boy was it good! The staff was great, very informative and knowledgeable of the menu. I had the seasonal chicken- it's buttermilk fried chicken and it was served with grits and collards. Having lived in the south, I have a very strong opinion about grits, chicken, and collards and what I was served at The Love is some of the best I've ever had. My mom got the salmon poke and she said it was amazing as well. 

The decor is also great, the cork ceilings absorb some of the noise and it feels very cozy yet chic. 

Only reason it's missing a star is because the dessert menu was a little meh - as someone who's lactose intolerant I couldn't eat 3/5 of what was on the menu.
A nice change and a good taste of home. I think I was the only person to let the barista show their talents and got my usual double espresso. Well worth it.

Ola, my waxer, was literally amazing! (Let's rewind a bit)... so I haven't been waxed in a while...for a few reasons. One reason being that my previous wax experience went terribly. This was basically experiencing my first Brazilian all over again, so I was completely freaking out and almost canceled my appointment while I was only two blocks away. My skin is extremely sensitive... and maybe I was being a little over dramatic. I used to get brazilians regularly. Once I met with Ola, my entire mood changed. She did an amazing job and it wasn't even that painful. Can't be more thankful and relieved that this experience went well. I highly recommend booking an appointment with Ola!

Best service hands down. I came in on a busy Friday evening needing my flat tire evaluated. They managed to repair the tire and installed it with no charge.  When my car is due for tires I will definitely buy them here!
Excellent food. Great staff. Stopped here on our road trip from San Diego to San Francisco. As a Thai food aficionado I highly rate this restaurant!
Awful service- there was no line which should have been the first indication. Took over 15 minutes to make two small tacos. Go to Shake Shack instead.

Nothing to write home about.  Our server was good.  The other staff were friendly.  The drink was stiff.  The food was interesting, but not great.  The oyster Rockefeller special was good but the oyster got a little lost in the sauce.  The cheese empendada was cooked perfectly and stuffed full of rich cheese, but was paired with a bitter kale salad... It needed a sauce to cut the richness.  The plantains were cooked well, but the relish with which it was served didn't quite work.  Unfortunately because the small plates were underwhelming, I doubt I will give the restaurant a chance to win me over on the entrees.

Clean, well maintained machines and the friendliest attendant who walked me through the process of securing a laundry card (cash or credit card to load your laundry card).  Quick Saturday morning errand as hotel did not have onsite laundry. Very impressed

Yum!!! Our servers were Gary and Kevin. They did a great job taking care of us. They patiently answered all our questions and were super attentive to our needs. The gnocchi ricotta is really good! The vegetarian pasta (off menu) was really good. It's seasonal vegetables so that can vary, but it was full of flavor and the sauce was freshly made. My significant other ordered the burger. The burger was really heavy, but tasted good. The fries were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Next time we would plan better so we have room for dessert!
Like their wings, not too big therefore very flavorful! The price is less competitive though. New location is further east than the old one but much bigger.

Well, lots to say. Managers were busy makin coffee drinks and totally ignoring the business. Tables were ready and set but empty. The "15 minute wait" became 30. People that work there appear to be miserable and in slllloooowwww motion. Waiter brought table next to us their food holding a dirty rag and said "this is a really hot plate. The heat is coming through this rag."  Ummm. After seeing and hearing that we were kinda disgusted. Our meal was fair. My skillet was hot but the food was not. Sad- the menu is great but will not return unless a major re-do happens.

Went with a group of 8 people during brunch on a Sunday. Staff was friendly and accommodating! Food was delicious - not a single person at our table had a complaint. Speedy service, yet we didn't feel rushed to get out. Definitely a lovely experience and we're looking forward to our next brunch date here!
Great local brewery!!! I was lucky enough to taste every beer they had on tap ( thanks Shawna) and even took a growler back home with me. Ignore the fake reviews that you see below.

Terrific bbq in the great NE area of southern jersey.   The pork was tender and had a great flavor.   The bbq beans had food chunks of meat in them but a different flavor than I'm used to.  The brisket chili was decent with flavor but needed to be more hot in temperature.

First time trying this place out! The food is amazing and the serving size is large enough for 2 people if your order a large! I ordered the taso and diri kole! I'm very satisfied and would definitely go back if it wasn't an hour away from home!!
Super cool tasting room in the Funk Zone in SB. Staff is friendly, and it's a nice setting with the fireplace and some comfy chairs.
Great Place our Dazzle loves it. Staff is friendly and place is clean. We used the Camp Bow Wow in Strongsville OH before we moved here and this place is just as awsome.

The semi cute decor is the only thing pleasing about this place. If you're going to put Biscuit in the name of your business, the biscuits better be darn good. In a word, they are terrible. I am not a southerner but have lived in Nashville for over 10 years and have had a lot of biscuits. Luckily our wait was only 10 min, when it's usually a lot more. It's NOT worth it people!!! I'm writing this review before I even leave the place...

Lovely!!! Highly recommend. What a delight to stay in a legitimate boutique hotel. Your first impression is a bright stylish well appointed lobby with eclectic and local art. The front desk and valet give excellent friendly service. Complimentary items upon check in and your entire stay is a nice touch. 

The rooms are to die for.  A themed room?!? Yes! Cheesy? No! Complete taste and luxury. Each room and all common areas have real artistic flare without compromising comfort or 4 star standards. Each room has a fireplace, balcony, extremely comfortable beds. Bathrooms are spa like as well.

Walking distance from all restaurants in downtown. What an wonderful reprieve from a chain hotel. We will definitely stay again.
Burgers are decent, not fantastic but you can customize them which is cool. Their french fries alone are worth the visit at least. Super good. Had great service last night too!

Went during busy time and it was an awful experience... Waitress didn't know the menu.. Meal came out in sections so by the time everything i ordered came out 1/2 the meal was cold.... Bacon was uncooked... Won't be back again unless i come very early

Of course my Air Conditioner went on the fritz on some of the hottest days of summer!  And just coming up to a weekend, I got an appointment on the following Monday which I felt fortunate to get.   The repairman was slightly early but a welcome sight as the day started to heat-up.  He diagnosed my problem as the capacitor (whatever that is) which was a $200 fix and not the full outdoor unit which would have been a $700 fix plus the $80+\- service call.  (I was glad to hear that I had a "top- of-the-line furnace and A/C). He was so efficient he was in and out of here in about a half an hour.  He didn't try to sell me any duct cleaning or up- services, he came out, did a great job and left.  He even reminded me to re-lock my side gate.  Truly excellent service.  I think his name was Dago but he spoke with an accent- maybe an Eastern European accent.  He was a nice fellow.

My heater went out during the colder days of December 2017, and I called Sierra Air out to look at it.  The first technician came out and couldn't find anything wrong except for a little dust.  It continued not to work so I called Sierra Air again and they sent out 2 technicians who found that my circuit board had gotten fried in a few spots, affecting its ability to heat.  They didn't have the part in stock so they had to order it and an appointment was made for almost a week later to install it when they got it in.  So I used friend's space heaters for a while.  Today the technician came by, on time, and installed the circuit board and when I heard the sound of the heater switching on I was so glad to finally have heat!  It has a 1 year warranty on the circuit board.  Thanks, Sierra Air.

Sat at the bar for dinner. Service was great. I had a Christmas martini which was totally amazing. Got the gumbo Yaya by suggestion of the person sitting next to me, was an excellent choice. They brung you complimentary warmed baguette and butter which is truly amazing. This meal was breakfast+lunch+dinner for me thay day so I also ordered a main course, the shrimp and grits. The shrimp were overcooked in my opinion by overall it was a delicious plate. Definitely recommend this place and will go back if I go back to Nola. Perfect for a nice date!
The pork chops were delicious. Yummy burger. Good beer and cocktail selection, nice decor. It was busy when we were there, so a little loud.

delicious food
lots of parking
kind staff
cool atmosphere
appropriate pricing

quick heads up- there are two dining options

Chinese and a la carte sushi
or
all you can eat sushi

you cannot have a mixed group because all you can eat sushi diners have a separate place to eat.

Nice looking brewery/bar. Wanted to go here for a while, it's super close to my apt... first thing ordered was a Flight of beers (picture) for $7 you can choose 4 beers. I really like malted beers so I enjoyed a lot the Smoke porter and House Amber (Not malted) from those 4. Also got the King Louie (full size) which was really good! If you like that kind of beers. Get it! Won't regret it!.

Food... got the prime burger (per serve recs) was good, the meat was juicy and tasty! Nothing to die for, but a good solid burger. (It came with fries, which were well... regular and nothing exciting fries fries. Last but not least, the service was good, our server was attentive and nice. 

I see myself going back and getting some drinks here but won't go just for food. It wasn't bad but not super good either so...

Seriously it doesn't get any better than this. I had the chili dog and fries and it was delicious. It's so great to finally find a place that is authentic! Best dogs in town! Paulie is very personable and remembers your order is you're a regular!

The seafood benedict was arguably the best eggs benedict I've ever had. My husband had the big easy breakfast and said it was great. This place is small and busy so get there early. Once you're seated, the food comes pretty quickly. Highly recommend stopping here!
